Reviews.Title: “Sweet sleep among blood, noise and paint”
Reviews.Author: Helenn365
Reviews.Content: First of all, the shock of how tiny a so-called 4 star hotel room can be was distracted by the sight of blood on the toilet door as well as near the bed - then at 8am we were awakened by the construction work which the receptionist said "might" disturb us but it soon becomes clear that it´s impossible to avoid this noise. On the last day, the concierge returned our bags which had recent paint stains - he ignored us and said it was impossible for the bag to have got stained whilst they had them and the duty manager ignored us too, not giving any solutions and just saying "we dont use that colour" although it´s obvious there was paint as part of their renovation. It all ended when I asked for the complaint form and they said they dont actually have complaint forms, when I said they were legally required to do so, he said they were changing the format and offered to email me a feedback form that would be passed on to the general manager...guess what? I never got that email! His -and the concierge's- last nice touch was allowing me to carry the stained backpack which was about 20kg heavy, although I was obviously pregnant. TERRIBLE PLACE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What's with the bad reviews?????”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa R
Reviews.Content: Oh my god....where have these negative people been staying? It certainly isn't at the Kensington Close Hotel...... We were allowed to check in early by a very friendly foreign lady, who was also very polite and helpful. We found the room to be very tidy, clean albeit small, it was ideal. Perfect location from tube, taxi's, shops and restaurants, couldn't ask for more. We were informed when booking that renovations were taking place, however, no disturbance through our entire visit was experienced by us. We queued to check in however, due to arriving early other guests were checking out so it was to be expected. Breakfast the next day was very very busy. There again was a very long queue so we decided to eat at Macdonalds up the road as we didn't want it to interfere with our day. No hassle and no problem with this. Checking out was easy and for a charge of £1 per bag they kept them until we were ready to collect later in the day. (How reasonable is that?) All staff we dealt with were pleasant and helpful. As we decided not to use the tube at night we opted for a taxi. How pleased were we to find a rank outside. Even taxi drivers were pleasant throughout the whole weekend. They couldn't do enough for us. They even updated us when we got in the taxi to inform us that there had been an accident which meant a slight increase in cost as they had to go the longer way round. We really couldn't have asked for a better weekend and would definitely stay there again. Absolutely spot on. Thank you to all the staff involved, you really made our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Most surly bar staff on planet”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over six nations weekend and other guests have already mentioned the constant drilling,even on weekends.Were told we had the renovated rooms but if this is renovated then i`d sack the workmen.I`m 6`2 and as the bed is hemmed in on 3 sides had to sleep diagonally with feet out just to fit in it.The shower is high enough for someone of 5,4" or less and good luck using the toilet,couldn`t fit my shoulders between the 2 walls.All this i could live with but the bar staff were the most miserable, unhelpful people i`ve ever met.On saturday night , got back to hotel at 1145pm and thought id make use of the bar.Told quite abruptly, bar shut and only because we had to drag the manager into the argument were we allowed to order drinks on room service. A farce, i`m resident in a 4* hotel ( dream on) and we`re treated like scum.In contrast and fairness,restaurant staff were quite the opposite and worked very hard all weekend. Bar manager needs a rocket,service in their newly renovated bar is nothing short of appalling!

Reviews.Title: “You'll have to wait to get into the canteen”
Reviews.Author: Grumpigrandpa
Reviews.Content: The Kensington Close is undergoing a refurbishment but sadly that does not apply to the service. As always there is a wait at reception to check in and check in seems a lengthy process with polite but poorly knowledgable staff. The room was new and small but comfortable, only a shower no bath. I've not tried eating here. A very mediocre buffet breakfast is served in a canteen after queing to get in. The previous canteen was bigger so the queues are now longer. Limited range of fruit, orange juice that looks like coloured water, hot breakfast dishes not refilled regularly. If my organisation didn't have bookings here I would never return.

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere but here”
Reviews.Author: motley69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in December and new before booing about the works in progress, even so the 1st room allocated was dark, dirty and bed was pushed into the corner. The second room was better but not much, the bathroom door was broken so you could not close it properly. The room where breakfast was served was filthy I had to swap the chair at our table. But the overwhelming problem was the staff, it was as though they had been trained not to speak or smile, you cannot use as an excuse for everything "this is London that's the way it is". I had travelled from Cornwall for a Christmas theatre trip and the hotel ruined it. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Renovations are NOT finished even though they say they are! TERRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: BentleyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: If you like drilling at 8am then this is the hotel for you. We were informed that renovations were completed and if anything had to be done then it wouldn't affect our room. WRONG! We had drilling every morning at 8am and some days at 7:45am. On two days we had no hot water. Reception couldn't care less about it and said it's the same everywhere in the hotel. Do not stay here for the olympics unless you are prepared for this. They said they doubted renovations would be completed in time for the olympics. Basically if you get a russian female on reception you will receive no help. The only good staff members were the English ones (who are few and far between) - who were actually pretty helpful but the russian women couldn't care less about helping out. The entrance to the stair case STINKS of chlorine. The rooms are tiny. Great location but it's not worth it. I'd stay at Copthorne Tara next door if I had my time again.

Reviews.Title: “5* prices for 2* hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigbadwayne
Reviews.Content: Booked in for a night with my girlfriend. The rooms are small with minimum facilities, our room had been recently decorated bringing it kicking and screaming into the 80's. The bar prices are way overpriced and table service was slow (and charged). Some of the staff were very near to getting my fist put through the back of their heads.... rude and unprofessional. Workmen are all over the hotel making lots of noise..... don't bother.... you can't polish a turd. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “London”
Reviews.Author: Islandlover190502
Reviews.Content: London was great, hotell was not so good. The resturant so we thougt was there was closed and it was new buildings at hotell so it was noisy. We not been told this when we book the hotell, They also use old menu at bar so closing time, menu and price was wrong. They also not ave adapter for power to rent so i have to search and buy it self Break fast good and location. Maybe the rest will be better after new building. So my trip was to much money spend at this hotell.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: VeronikaM123
Reviews.Content: I was a guest and didnÂ´t have to pay for the hotel, neither I chose it myself. But I cannot complain about anything here. I was there in February 2012 and the hotel was under reconstruction. The rooms were small but very nice and clean, comfy and quiet. Nice and clean bathroom. Maybe all of you who complain visited it before? I really canÂ´t say nothing negative. It is very close to the metro station, close to shops and pubs, so even the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Rainy London Trip”
Reviews.Author: Femfacti
Reviews.Content: Located an easy walk from the Tube and the high street, this was a great base hotel for seeing London. The staff were friendly, the rooms were small, but clean. Crisp sheets, hot water in the shower and okay towels. We did have a loud radiator in our first room, but a quick call and we were switched to a different room. The room service was average, but when a down pour hit the city, it was plenty to tide us over until we could head out again. This is not a luxury stay, but they do run special rates which make a long weekend in London very doable.

Reviews.Title: “Beware strangers in you room”
Reviews.Author: Elainebea
Reviews.Content: We left cash and valuables in our room checked the door was locked and our room was safe. Returned to find strangers in our room telling us to wait a minute before we could come in they were doing the telecoms.... We called Reception and asked the Duty Manager to come and see us. Am hour later and he hasn't bothered! Looks like we will have to take everything with us....

Reviews.Title: “Simply disgusting.... complete rip-off”
Reviews.Author: rex1072
Reviews.Content: this hotel is awful and I resent the wedding planner booking this for a wedding party I went to last week. It is quite literally a building site with noises of banging coming from every corner, when you say anything you will be brazenly reminded that you have been told about this in good time and that you have free Wi-Fi to compensate. saying that the staff are possibly the rudest I have ever experienced, Surly,jaded,slow and demotivated. I experienced the worst language I have ever had in a hotel from an Eastern European member of staff in the breakfast area, which I may add was incredibly dirty with food strewn all over the floors and dirty cutlery plus a member of serving staff that refused to bring me a hot coffee (as he was serving the whole breakfast area cold filter coffee). The pricing structure of the hotel is a dark art but on the whole a complete rip-off. if I had known that reception would lie about their rates I would have sacked off the wedding party and stayed at a different hotel. another horrifying scene was that I recall getting into a lift to go to my room and being the lift full of upset residents, one resident had witnessed seeing a rat in their room and were checking out immediately. as for my room, we were given the Pokiest twin room, with no window and a toilet and shower that I can only describe as being in a cupboard in the corner of the room, it was so basic and cheap that it made the cheapest travel Lodge look like it was the presidential suite at the Dorchester. the only thing redeeming about this property is the excellent gym and the staff in the gym appear to have no attitude problems and the location ...other than that I probably would not care if the building fell down tomorrow. do not stay here at any cost, it completely ruined our trip here in London, do not believe a single thing you see on their website as I am certain it breaches the trades description act in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Would be great if the reception was not needed”
Reviews.Author: StephenCKendal
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at a good hotel after 11pm there is an expectation that you can book in quickly and get to bed. Sadly the Kensington Close Hotel does their best to keep you from your bed as long as possible. I booked through lastminute.com and had my voucher for 2 nights. After queuing to check in the reception staff advised me that I only had 1 night booked. After 10 minutes of anxiety she comes back and says its all OK and that she has sorted it out. So, I trundle off to my room with baggage only to find that my key card does not work. Once settled in the room it was very well appointed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, rooms in bad shape lousy value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: bammer42
Reviews.Content: Took us 3 rooms and 2 hours of our time to get a room with functioning wifi, or one that didn't have scafolling directly outside the window and workmen about. even in room number 3, wifi was sporadic. First night we lost our heat, finally got a space heater sent up, no sleep from 2-5am.. The toilets don't flush every time guess that's an English thing though. The manager refused to give us some sort of credit for at least the heat but gave us an upgrade for a future stay, which isn't going to happen as I would never pay to stay there again....The only bright spot was the staff, they are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, don't care about the guests!”
Reviews.Author: Djraw2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the other day, had 2 rooms for a business trip, took about 30 mins to check in even though it was all booked online in advance. The one room we had was small, broken mirror with tape holding it together and unclean. The other room which was miles down the long corridors, this had no heating due to the building work going on, the hotel sent up an electric heater, but this was insuffient. Tried to move rooms but they were fully booked. All the hotel offered was an upgrade next time we stay. We certainly won't be staying here again. Letter going off to the owners of the hotel for a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ailsa C
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, clean, room needed refurbishment Real problem is noise. Lack of sound proofing between the rooms meant knew when people in room above went to the loo and heard next door until very late

Reviews.Title: “watch the surcharge!”
Reviews.Author: dawn b
Reviews.Content: stayed for 1 night. Ask for a refurbished room and away from the building works that are going on. Breakfast was nice and plentiful, go early though to avoid queues. I wouldnt give it a 4 star. A convenient location to tube. Watch at the bar when ordering drinks and mention you dont want the discretionary surcharge. Its ok for short stay, I would go back because of the ideal location. Favourite part of the hotel was the location and breakfast. Least favourite was the size of the room and the photo taken of the front of hotel on the website doesnt look like it at the moment due to the building works going on. Some of the reception staff werent friendly, didnt even make eye contact!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgraceful and does not deserve any star, bb would of been better!”
Reviews.Author: mamabunny
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel with the smell of glue that carried on throughout my 5 days, plastic bags everywhere and dust which was no help to asthma sufferers. First morning banging and drilling which I complained and insisted I come down to reception!!! Annoyed I went in pyjamas and they just said nothing they could do!!!! How annoying and humiliating! While there the reception was full of upset guests and guest waiting for 45mins mins just to check out of which they complain and the reply was nothing to do with me from the staff! The pool was not in use but the jacuzzi was full of grit and no ventilation in the gym. Completely upset by the staff attitude and no wifi in the whole building and when I complain they said it was down and on the second day asked to pay of which the only reception was standing in one spot in the concierge where the porter is!!! The worst hotel by any star in the world... Btw I could carry on how bad this place was and completely ruined my break. I decided to check out early at 8 cos the housekeeping has been knocking and barging in every morning and plus it was freezing every night, to my dismay I was asked again to pay to leave my luggage with the porter even though I had generously left early by 4 hours :-(((((

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to see the finished refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: glentyan
Reviews.Content: We have often used the K Close for short stays in London, due to its excellent location. Due to major refurbishment and extension work there over the past year, this was our first stay in over a year, and we were totally blown away when we entered the new lobby. Gone is the old dingy and cramped lobby and in its place a much larger, brighter and open plan lounge layout greets quests. A major improvement more worthy of the 4 star status. Facilities are seriously restricted elsewhere in the hotel at present due to the building work The pool is closed, and the restaurant reduced in size (get there before 0800 for breakfast or be prepared for long queues). Rooms are still the same, small and adequate, but OK for short stays). Very helpful and cheery young girl on reception at check-in made it a pleasant task.

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: FREDANDWILMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights 26th and 27th February. yes there is building work but in reallity it did cause much disruption as the guys started work around 8.30am. and the hotel kept us informed. Breakfast was great and more than enough to keep us going all day. The only downside was that our room was small, but adequate. We booked the hotel through an offer for a west end show and a stay at a hotel so as the price was ludicrously low we really could not grumble. If going to London again for a stay I would stay here again. Reception is VERY VERY BUSY because of the size of the hotel. Reception staff were great however with all the knowledge needed for buses trains cabs etc.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: HuldaK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. The staff was helpful except for the staff at the bar who always charged extra fee for the drinks bought at the bar and almost "forgot" a change for 5 pounds for my friend and 15 pounds for myself. On a 4 star hotel one would expect that the admission to the pool was included, but the charge for a day is 8 pounds! The rooms were adequate, clean with good beds, but the sound insolation could be better - we heard clearly if someone was running on upper floors or walking or talking on the corridor. And the plumbing was noisy, but very little noise from outside even with an open window. The hotel is very well positioned - only a minute from the tube, good shops on Kensington High Street and a short walk from Royal Albert Hall and the Natural History Museum and Science Museum. Breakfast was good with good waiters but one had to ask specially for cheese and ham. The renovation didn't trouble us at all. The lifts were few and slow, but we were lucky staying on the 1st floor so we could take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: Alessandro B
Reviews.Content: On a trip last fall to London, I blindly chose the Posthouse Kensington from an internet site. It was a good choice. The rooms are predictably small (go for the double, even if you're traveling alone), but sufficient. The location was great for traveling on foot, by train, or bus. Get a transportation pass from while you're there, and you'll save a lot if you do much sight-seeing. I picked mine up at Heathrow for about $40 USD - one week, all access.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: USABritHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: We looked at several hotels before booking a week in London; we rejected those that informed us that they were undergoing renovation. The photographs of Kensington Close made it look great, and the price was reasonable, so we booked. Only afterwards did we receive information that work was ongoing. This is deceptive and unacceptable. When we arrived we found that the work was far from complete. Noisy, dusty and, if our (tiny) room is anything to go by, the quality of the renovation is very poor. Loose light fittings; locks not working; awful lighting. This is not even close to being a four star hotel. Some of the staff were helpful, especially those serving breakfast. (Some of them had limited English). Others, particularly the concierge staff, were hopeless. The wifi worked precisely twice during the week, and never in the room; the TV was ancient and defective. The plumbing made noises throughout the night. The elevators are tiny and often out of commission. In a nutshell - go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Erik E
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in August 2011, and booked this hotel through a travel company. We were 5 friends splitted up on a twin room and a triple room. The rooms need renovation and we was also disturbed by this renovation on some other rooms. The service in the reception and by the consierge was good, and the hotel is a little far from the city centre. The breakfast was very good, and will consider to use this again since they have renovated the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful in many ways, but could easily be better”
Reviews.Author: BlackCumin
Reviews.Content: Im not one to complain, but when I do I expect the courtesy of being taken seriously. Not the case here so forgive the rant. I was aware of the renovation work but when my room vibrated all day every day and the noise inside it reached 84 decibels (iPhone apps are great!) I decided to complain. I was told that there was nothing they could do as they were full (although the website was still accepting reservations!) I was proised a call back from the manager but this call didn't come so I called again. Again I was promised a call from the manager, again it didn't come so I called again. Again nothing, so I'm writing up a review. It's not just this though. The staff are incredibly variable. The bar staff were universally awful. If they really don't want to do the job this much, they should look for something else. The reception conversely were great. The decor looks great where it has been refurbished and I think they'll have a good product eventually but for now and the foreseeable, it's a total dogs breakfast. I don't mind things like dust sheets in corridors and tradesmen doing not intrusive work but this sort of disruption is dreadful and you would be much better off paying a little more and staying somewhere else. Sorry, in my top five worst hotels ever.

Reviews.Title: “Additional charges!”
Reviews.Author: Eamon R
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in the Kensington Close and was slightly disappointed in a number of things. The double room offered was very small but fairly clean and the staff at Reception were very polite and helpful. Unfortunately the pool the weekend we stayed was unavilable for some reason which was not properly explained to us. My main grievance was the bar prices which were fairly expensive in the main but they also added on a 'discretionary' service charge of 15% on top of the drink prices displayed. I must stress that this was at the discretion of the customer , not the hotel, but when we stayed over 3 nights it was automatically added to the bill. On our last night here another guest brought this to the bar staff notice and it was immediately refunded. So please if not happy with this additional charge mention to the bar staff at the time. Altough they have waiter service I ordered and brought down my own drink from the bar but was still always charged the extra 15%. This can accumulate over a 3 night period if you have afew drinks at the bar. When I mentioned this to Reception at check out they stated that I should have said to the bar staff each night not to add the charge on and confessed that they were aware of this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MaryTaormina
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was very inexpensive and we were aware of the building works. We read on the website that they would compensate the noise and works with free films in our room, free wifi, and free access to the pool. Their website did not say (and still does not say) that the pool is actually undergoing renovation as well, but we read about it in one of these tripadvisor reviews before going to London. We phoned the travel agent with which we booked our room to complain about the lack of pool, and the travel agent convinced the hotel to upgrade us to english breakfast finstead of continental breakfast and to an executive room instead of a basic one...for the same price! Our newly renovated executive room was absolutely stunning, plenty of space for 2 people, everything new and beautiful, tea and coffee, and about 47 films to choose from, free of charge (they normally cost Â£7.5 each), the bathroom was very clean, with 2 free small bathfoam toiletries. The wifi only works in the lobby, but we knew that, and we went downstairs to sit in the comfy sofas in the lobby anytime we had to check our mails. English breakfast was simply delicious, we never had to queue and so did the other guests while we were eating, there's plenty of staff to look after you at breakfast, they accompany you to a table, and they serve you coffee and tea at the table, and they topup coffe and tea anytime you want. The rest of the breakfast is self service, and it is delicious. Our room was on the fifth floor and we were not disturbed by the noise, maybe thay had already finished with it, because we noticed it was much more noisy on some other floors. The location is amazing, only one minute from the tube, and many buses to Piccadilly. Kensington high street is lovely for shopping. We were disappointed not to swim, but we are very happy about everything else. The staff was very friendly. We paid our damage deposit in cash (Â£90) because we wanted it back immediately on our departure day. All the staff are very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “great price but its in the middle of a refurb”
Reviews.Author: philmanchester
Reviews.Content: To be fair to the hotel they are currently offering really good rates because the hotel is undergoing a major refurbishment. On the upside I found the staff to be really helpful especially in the bar which is the only place you can get food at the moment. I was offered a refurbished room which was small but very clean and new. The rooms are a bit like a travel lodge with only a shower and not much space howerever the bed was very comfortable. On the downside check-in took 40 minutes but they were being hampered by the amount of guests complaining. Having said that they were very friendly and helpful. My room had been pre-paid but they still insisted on taking a credit card which was odd. The drilling started quite early but I was already up and about. On one evening I had to leave the bar as it was so cold. Having said that for Â£49 per night it was good value and I just excepted that the disruption was part of the deal. Great location as its just off kensington High St with lots of great places to eat and near the tube station. The thai restuarant right oppostive is lovely, Overall good value but you will need to be open minded about the work going on.

Reviews.Title: “clean, pleasant but not 4 star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn B
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel we were looking for a decent 4 star hotel to stay after seeing a show. We don't live far out of London but decided we would make the most of an evening out in the big city. We were very disappointed that we had to wait (for 10 mins) for a man to retrieve our bags from the luggage storage room before we could go to our room. On arriving at our room we were surprised that our room was tiny!!! It was very compact and the toilet was difficult to get to. I knew there were going to be building works during our stay but we found it difficult to sleep during the night due to the air conditioning changing temperatures and blowing all night. Most of the staff were pleasant enough but it was definately NOT a 4 star hotel!!! We will not be returning or recommending it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you like waking up in a building site”
Reviews.Author: jimbo7020
Reviews.Content: A serious disappointment, and frankly the hotel has a distinct cheek letting out rooms under such conditions. We will be absolutely sure never stay at this hotel or any associated chain, partners or associates again. The good points are that the staff are pleasant, the room was clean and the water hot, but that's where it ends. The staff were pleasant but pacified rather than helped. We were told on check-in that the building was under refurbishment, and work started at 8am each morning - this was the first we'd heard of it. We don't like being woken at 8am while on holiday. They assured us that we had been fully notified of this - a complete and utter falsehood, and I have all the emails to prove it. We asked that we relocate to a room where construction was not going to take place - this was waved away - words to the effect that, "Construction was taking place all over the hotel, you could never know where or when, and maybe we'd be lucky and they wouldn't start near us tomorrow!" We asked to speak to the manager, who was - naturally - in a meeting. So were all the senior supervisors, but they would be in contact with us as soon as it finished. Needless to say, they failed to do so. Heavy drilling that shook the room duly commenced at about 08:05 the next morning, and the morning after that. It was accompanied by hammering, grinding, and the sounds associated with very heavy construction. This was taking place across the entire hotel, rather than working on one evacuated wing at a time. The management attitude is screw the customers, we'll just brazen it out and be utter cowards - hiding behind the reception staff who take all the flak. Funnily enough that noise was absent from the early afternoon onwards - surely not because people would demand to check out immediately if they arrived at their rooms to find that unbelievable degree of noise and shaking? Fortunately we were only staying two nights. At check-out, the lady notably failed to ask if we enjoyed our stay, and didn't express any wish that we might return soon - that's a pretty big 'tell'. I imagine plenty of guests had sharp replies to such sentiments, and they had given up making them. The room itself was clean but incredibly small, the best feature was the kettle and teapot. Like another reviewer, my room's AC insisted on having it at a stuffy 25 degrees C, despite my repeatedly turning it down. Clearly it knew best and reset it to 25 every few minutes. The finish of the room betrayed workmanship based on speed rather than quality - a bathroom door which could not be opened or shut without a loud bang, loose fixtures, handles at odd angles, main doors which violently slammed shut, and so on. My own craftsmanship while fitting doors etc. is vastly better despite it being 1000 miles from my own profession, clearly these fitters had no pride or interest in their work. We were told that the spa was free because of this disgracefully intrusive disturbance (it simply said the spa included at the time of booking), unfortunately the main feature - the pool - was closed for maintenance. A good thing indeed we didn't even try eating there. Summary: When a hotel brags about an expensive refurbishment, it lends the impression that this must a good thing - the furnishings must be new. What one does not expect is to be shaken awake first thing in the morning while on holiday, and find themselves right at the heavy end, in the middle of, that refurbishment - with all the noise, vibration and dust associated. This hotel should have been closed for the duration. The management are greedy cowards. We will be absolutely sure never stay at this hotel or any associated chain, partners or associates again.

Reviews.Title: “Improving”
Reviews.Author: ScottishLady38
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed the Kensigton Close some time ago. I returned in early February. I booked through the website and it did warn about the refurbishment. The price of the room also reflected that. I arrived prior to the check in time but was checked in immediately and given one of the refurbished rooms. I have to say that the receptionist also advised me about the refurbishment at check in. The room was very nice, warm comfortable and clean. I ordered a room service meal meal which arrived promptly and was of a very good standard. There were signs (and sounds) of work being carried out but I didn't find these at all intrusive. In Central London you do not expect absolute quiet. I did go to the bar/lounge but didn't stay long as it was very cold. The bar man was very helpful but I did find one the two young ladies swanning around supposedly working very rude. She wasn't rude to me but one was being rude about another memebr of staff in my hearing which is very unprofessional. I will return to this hotel but for the moment we shoudl remember that it is a work in prgress.

Reviews.Title: “I could not fall in love with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: George0903
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for nearly a week in February 2012. I believe reviews should start with the positives - My single room was clean and newly refurbished. The shower was good and the water hot. The hotel has a good location and the staff I talked to were helpful. Unfortunately the review does not end here. This is NOT a 4 star hotel. My room reminded me of my son's student accommodation, without the benefits that go with a university room, it was very small - If my case was open in the place supplied, I could not open the door to the corridor, the Wi-Fi didn't work, The air-conditioning sounded as if someone was having a bath in the next room and kept resetting itself to 25*C. One of the 2 lifts near my room stopped working in Sunday/Monday and was still out of order when I left on Friday (The nearby stairs was being demolished and could not be used) but the notice directing you to another lift didn't appear till Wednesday. My room key stopped working and I joined a queue of people for the lift to reception to get a new key 'cut'. queues at reception (the 2 people in front of me also had faulty keys) and then queued to go up in the lift again. there was no fridge in the room (nor is there room for one). The gaggle of girls who returned noisely to their room at 02:30 on Sunday morning cannot be blamed on the hotel. I have purposly not mentioned other re-furbishment issues. In short, I would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on business”
Reviews.Author: Liz L
Reviews.Content: Hotel is under refurbishment but this was reflected in the price we paid and there was no disturbance to us. All possible inconveniences were explained to us. The staff were very helpful and friendly and we felt well looked after. Very close to Olympia where were exhibiting but close enough to central London if we had time. I would certainly book again. I look forward to seeing the full refurbishment, I think it will be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough Hotel but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Eileen_Cambs
Reviews.Content: I had booked a theatre/Hotel deal for my friends birthday, we had booked two rooms but on arrival the Hotel looked like a building site covered in scaffolding, we had not been told that the Hotel was being refurbished. However inside everything looked ok until we went to our room. My friends room was in a part of the Hotel not being refurbished but further down heading towards my room the carpets were covered in plastic to protect from the building work there was plasterboard partitions and you could clearly see daylight through them. Bearing in mind the temperature outside was minus 1 degree and the cold was coming through the walls you can imagine my shock. I was sharing a twin room and it was freezing. I turned the heating up as high as it would go and we went out for afternoon tea hoping to come back to a warm room. It was still freezing and we had to get ready and go for dinner before the show, I phoned reception who rang me back and said the engineer had checked it out and the heating in our room was fine!!! I asked her if she would like to come up and check it our for herself as the engineer had not come near our room. She offered us a portable heater I said that was not acceptable and if they couldn't fix it we wanted to be moved to another room. We were told that the Hotel was being refurbished for the Olympics but why put customers in rooms like this in the freezing cold. After kicking up a big fuss at reception before we went out we were told a room would be ready for us when we got back we never as much as got an apology from the staff, and when we returned at midnight the staff on reception knew nothing about a change of room for us so we had to go through it all again. First they were going to put us in a room that hadn't even been cleaned, and eventually we got moved to a room on the fourth floor which was lovely and warm but this should have been done when we first complained. At this stage it was nearly 1.00am. It really did spoil what should have been a lovely weekend and for the lack of service and lack of apologies we received I would not recommend this Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location.”
Reviews.Author: Salsacj
Reviews.Content: Booked this for theatre break weekend (fri to sat), I was very nervous from the reviews and thought I should of chosen a different hotel. I did email the hotel requesting a refurbished room and commenting it was for a special occaison. On arrival we didnt have to wait long on checking in and reception staff were very friendly, my request was taken into consideration and we were given a very nice room. 440 - It was a typical room as shown on the website but it was warm and very confortable. View from the window was of the scaffolding but we were not in the room long enought to worry about it. Only negative comments are main corridors were a little draughty, main bar area cold, we did have drilling noise at 8.30 on the saturday moring which was a little annoying and you could here other guests walking the corridors and chatting. Our room was very near the lifts. Breakfast room was nice and we were served immediately. The hotel is a little distance from the centre of london considering other hotels location. Overall a nice stay, but would only class this hotel at 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely, disappointingly average”
Reviews.Author: johnboySheffield
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long romantic weekend here just before Valentine's day. It's nicely positioned close to High Street Kensington (but down a quiet road) and local shops. Room was average for this star hotel - comfortable, quiet and clean. Think we were lucky to get one nearish the lifts - it's a large hotel. It's undergoing refurbishment at the moment - looks like it'll be going a while. Lots of boarding and a temporary entrance and lots of workmen around. The 4 reception staff seemed more interested in chatting and doing whatever really important things they were doing than on letting us register. What a shame as this is the first impression of the hotel. We'd booked because of the pool and spa facilities, but ended up not using them. The pool was out of action because of the work (something to do with work above the pool). Shame this wasn't mentioned on their website as sauna and steam without the pool is naff - so we didn't. Also having the sauna in the changing rooms removes any togetherness that we'd hoped for. Breakfast wasn't in the deal we got so we voted with our feet and had a nice massively cheaper breakfast over the road at McDonalds. So average and disappointed with the facilities and attitude of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Eager1234
Reviews.Content: Hotel should not be open during renovation. No heat in the room. Reported it to unhelpful staff at reception, Eventually got a blow heater. Had very little sleep. Do not stay here. It is a construction site and staff are poorly trained

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but a lot of buts”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHesky
Reviews.Content: The reviewers below paint a fair picture. This is a once fairly decent hotel going through a lot of refurbishment and will presumably look pretty good when complete. Gym was small but adequate. I found the staff to be OK but clearly others didn't. The list of Buts is lengthy. During the works you should expect to be up and out by 8am because that's when the noise starts. My small room (refurbished!) made even smaller by a strange corridor-like en suite. Double bed pressed against the wall under the window and pretty much filled that end of the room. Free WiFi during the upgrade however site had security issues and bandwidth was appallingly slow. Coat hangers without a bar to hang suit trousers up on. Cramped breakfast area. Â£1.50 charge to call out to a free phone number. Really noisy extractor fans in the en suite that stay on for ages after the light is turned off (I'd rather not be woken up by the person in the neighbouring room putting on the light in the night!). Overall I would only recommend this place if you are offered a very cheap price and want economy.

Reviews.Title: “rubbish!”
Reviews.Author: ant l
Reviews.Content: First of all, rooms are tiny and not clean. The key cards do not work most of the time. Staff were rude. Breakfast is poor. The biggest liberty is the 10% service charge they add to the the bill at the end of the stay! This hotel will charge you a service charge if you go to the bar and buy a drink!!!!! i dont think so!!! unless you want to get ripped off.... DO not stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Smallest double room ever!”
Reviews.Author: maturegappers
Reviews.Content: The undergoing major refurbishment didn't really interfere with our 2 night stay, but having booked 10 weeks in advance it didn't account for us having a double room only 6 foot wide, I had to shuffle sideways past the end of the bed! I wouldn't stay here again or recommend it, there are plenty of others in the nice neighbourhood. The swimming pool had just become out of action on the day we arrived and we requested that we be offered something to make up for this disappointment, (eg free breakfast?) but no they just didn't care.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: COLD! RUDE STAFF! avoid big time! big refurb going should no be open or charging less than a travellodge! ruined my bithday treat!

Reviews.Title: “Chaotic breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineW58
Reviews.Content: Great location, 2 mins from Tube station and lovely local shops, restaurants and bars. Good reception, and got an upgrade to an executive room. The room was clean and modern, but tiny! Only 2 of us in it and we had to manoeuvre past each other to move around. Goodness only knows how small the basic rooms must be! What really let the hotel down was the breakfast experience. We arrived down for breakfast and were met by a queue of 32 guests waiting to get in. It was clear to see why: the self service breakfast buffet was tiny and cramped, and invited a 'crush' of guests, again queuing in long lines and all getting in each others' way. It was really chaotic, and getting a bowl of cornflakes felt like a bit of a battle. The staff didn't help with easing the queues, which they could have done, for example by triaging and getting separate queues for different things, rather than by having one big crowd. Also, plates and glasses ran out, so people had to hang around, thus making the crush even greater. We were surprised that experienced hoteliers hadn't worked out a system for this basic process. They are undergoing a refurbishment at present - we hope it brings bigger bedrooms and a much more sensible breakfast arrangement!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: BellaMac
Reviews.Content: Our company insist on putting us in this hotel despite our many complaints. The staff are unhelpful, the door cards often don't work and sometimes we have had to return to reception several times (long trip from some of the rooms) to get new cards. The rooms are small (not unusual for London) and often freezing cold. The breakfast is a scrum when it is busy which is nearly always all the time (dont know why) and I loathe the bar area which is soulless and cold. Drinks are ridiculously expensive, we never eat here as there are good restaurants nearby. I would never recommend this to anyone, it has become a penance for us and I look forward to the day our company stop putting us there. I would rather stay in a b&b , you would get better value for money. Last time we stayed there was scaffolding all around and loads of noise and dust from renovations going on while the hotel is open. This is just greed, they should have closed it down to refurbish it. There were workmen passing by our windows and using loud machinery right outside our rooms. I could go on and on, I hate this place.

Reviews.Title: “Serious Update Required”
Reviews.Author: Gizelle T
Reviews.Content: Staying as part of a threatre one night break was not informed that the hotel is getting refurbished. We were allocated a room right next to the work as workmen in hard hats with drills hammers etc proceeded to hoover the corridor as we tried to get past. We asked to be moved only to be told that the Hotel was fully booked and they DO mention about the refurb on the website. The room we had to stay in was so small and tired and very cold it was lucky we were only staying the one night.

Reviews.Title: “In need of updating”
Reviews.Author: kevr39
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 2 mins walk from Kensington High St Tube station, there are resturants & pubs nearby. The hotel is large and sprawling so you may have quite a walk from your room to the reception and bar. The sports bar is busy and you can get a reasonable meal, you get drinks brought to your table but there is a service charge for this. I had to queue for quite a long time to get checked in the hotel was very busy. The room I had was in need of refurbishment and small but clean, though as others have said heating almost non existent. I was only staying with work for one night so it served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Building Site”
Reviews.Author: adamandcarol
Reviews.Content: We had booked into this hotel for a romantic birthday weekend. Check in was a disaster with rude receptionists who do not have the skills to converse in the English language. They should consider a career change! Our key cards did not work for the room which ended up in several return visits to reception. This is a two star establishment. Do not be fooled by their web site. the restaurants advertised were all under refurbishment and we had to wait twenty minutes outside their make shift cafeteria at 09;30 to be seated. Then another twenty minutes for them to replenish the grim buffet that resembled a major accident on a motorway! Give this hotel a miss and try the Copthorne Tara next door. At least if you wanted to complain there the staff would understand you!! I am passing my concerns about advertising goods and services that do not exist to the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea Trading Standards team.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but a bit bland”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a base to explore from then I would venture that this isn't a bad choice, it's near to a tube station but further enough away from the main road to be comfortable. I had to queue for 25 minutes to get checked in which was frustrating, my room was very clean but tiny and cold until I amazingly worked out how to work the heating unit on the wall (there were no instructions). The tea/coffee facilities were adequate but nothing special. I understand that a business has to protect itself from less scrupulous individuals but I had to have my entire bill plus Â£50 'pre authorised' which caught out some in front of me in the check in queue (being the last Thursday before payday!), there were also signs in the room warning of penalties for smoking and a menu for room service and a cost for films which I had been advised were for free but didn't use but there was nothing giving me advice of where to go, a map of the area, attractions nearby etc, it sort of screamed of "you're here, you'll pay and don't break the rules or you'll pay more" rather then "Welcome, what do you want to know?". The room was quiet and I slept well although the second night the people sorting out the bins sounded like they were having races with the biggest bins they could find. The upgrade works did not affect me and working in construction I was impressed at the lack of disruption they were managing to achieve. The huge mirror door to the bathroom at the foot of the bed was a bit disconcerting especially when half asleep and not expecting to see anyone else in the room! Finally I am glad I didn't buy breakfast at Â£18 a shot as the queue was at least 25 people deep when I went out in the morning. I did not use the spa facilities so cannot comment on them. Staff I encountered were a little aloof but professional.

Reviews.Title: “Not as scary as I thought”
Reviews.Author: Katie L
Reviews.Content: Having read all of the reviews on trip advisor before I went and stayed at the hotel (it was booked as part of theatre trip deal) I was anxious and nervous. Upon arrival at the hotel around 2pm (peak time for check in) there was a queue but with an mass influx of people this was to be expected. It took 15 minutes to check in. The room was standard very small but comfortable, sufficent for what we requiered. I found the staff to be extremely helpful when requesting an iron and arranging cab journeys they couldnt have been more helpful and polite. The renovations were ongoing but did not affect our stay and we were nto disturbed by them. The spa was lovely, Emma who did my nails was very friendly and put me at ease staright away (and gave me a lovely manicure). The breakfast was tasty with a variety of choice and attentive staff who were more then happy to keep my coffee re filled. The location was great and the lounge bar spacious again with friendly staff. All in all I would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DE73
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at the Kensington Close hotel and was apprehensive after reading previous reviews but I needn't have worried. Staff where very helpful and friendly. We stayed in a compact double room, not the largest of rooms but then that is why it is called a compact double room, perfectly sufficiant for our needs though and great value for money. The room was spotless and has hairdryer, safe and well stocked tea/coffe making facilities. Shower gel, shampoo and soap are provided in the bathroom and the room was quite due to the location being just off the high street. The tube station is a 5 minute walk along with numerous shops, restaurants and shops. The N9 nightbus stops right by the tube station from Trafalgar Square if you are out after the tube is running and are unable to get a taxi. Renovation work was fairly quite on the Saturday morning so did not disturb us at all. We where asked on check-in if we would like a new room which currently could not receive wi-fi or pay to view TV which are currently included in the price whilst renovations are taking place, as we needed neither of these as we would be out most of the time we took a new room. Would reccomend this hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location excellent staff fantastic offer!”
Reviews.Author: qwertyuiop021
Reviews.Content: Booked on an offer, so didn't read many reviews before went. It was for my partners birthday, I emailed the hotel in advance asked for a nice room and was upgraded for free! More than helpful customer service every request was dealt with and the location is superb, fifteen seconds walk from the tube five minutes from Kensington palace. There was building work going on but it was not noisy by any means we both slept straight through it, more of a full rumble than high pitched drilling. Will be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “The lock was broken.”
Reviews.Author: elroclya2002
Reviews.Content: Our lock at the door was broken and we asked for an adaptor to charge our mobile phones and they didn't have. They had amazing breakfast though!!! The staff was helpful in general.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 4* HOTEL ***BEWARE***”
Reviews.Author: js3101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this weekend as a part of a weekend trip for my birthday. I can honestly say I have never been so disappointed by a hotel in my life! We had a twin room on the first floor which was far from clean. There was blood in the bath and white stains on the curtains. As many others have said the heat is non existant and frankly it ruined our weekend due to the lack of sleep and having to sleep in as many clothes as we could. I would not recommend them at all. I have made complaints both directly to the hotel and lastminute.com who we booked through-If I recieve a response I will update the post to illustrate the quality of their customer services.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THIEVES”
Reviews.Author: Mark E
Reviews.Content: I booked in this Hotel as I was attending a trade fair in London. It appeared good value and the rooms are small but clean. However they clearly have a problem which they had no intention of dealing with. My room and my collegues room were broken into through the window by a thief that had climbed up the scaffolding presently in place. Neither of us had left our windows open so therefore I have to assume they were left on the latch by a member of staff and as it happened at about 9.00 in the evening and was dark they would clearly have been given directions to find the rooms which were in a corner position next to each other. We had both stupidly left wallets but they were concealed (only because the safe would not lock) and whoever did this clearly new what they were looking for they were clearly directed to both. The management were not in the slightest bit concerned and did nothing about it other act a concerned, we called the police (who were excellent). There must have been some assistance from within the staff as I can't see how else it could have happened but the management don't seem bothered at all. We will be following this issue up directly with the Hotel but be warned if you do stay make sure your window is locked shut if you are near the scaffolding. Personally though if you want a good nights sleep don't stay their security is appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay but ask for a new room.”
Reviews.Author: JCinSpain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kensington Close on a business trip so it was booked by a colleague. Having read the many very bad reviews on here I was very concerned but for me it was an OK experience. I asked for a new room and the helpful receptionist obliged. The room was very small for a 4 star but it was new and clean. A nice touch was the euro two pin socket on the wall. Very handy for people like me who travel with european mobiles and laptops etc. Breakfast was nice with no queues as many have moaned about. All staff I dealt with were pleasant and helpful. The many spanish staff were especially helpful when I spoke to them in spanish. The hotel is going through a major (and badly needed) refurbishment program so if you want quiet during the day this place is not for you. However I received free pool access and room wifi (very slow) and it was 2 minutes from the tube and easy walking away from many museums, shops and hyde park. I enjoyed my stay but would wait until the builders have finished before considering returning.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Marrakech Morocco when my partner became unwell. We decided to fly back to London and because we had reservations for accommodation in London at an apartment hotel that was not available to us for a few days, we decided to reserve a room for 2 nights at the Kensington Close Hotel on Wrights Lane, London W8. I reserved the room online and they did say they were undergoing renovations. When we arrived we waited about 50 minutes to get checked in. There were two receptionists but when our turn came one of the receptionists disappeared. When we asked the receptionist that evntually served us she did not respond as to why the other went away. We reserved an Executive Twin room. It was on the first floor and cold. We called about heating and after an hour a tech man came and told us that for two months they have been having problems with the heating in several rooms since renovations were on going. There was a tiny fan heater on the floor for "our comfort". We called reception and told them what we were told and that we would want a heated room for the next night. The room was cold all night. The next day we went to the office and made our inquiry about a room and they told us there was no other room that we had the largest room of that class on room. We sai we would pay for a larger room, even a suite and we were told there were only 2 suites and they were booked. When we explained about the heating problem they did not want to know.We then contacted the apartment hotel people where we had reservations for our original stay they told us they had a cancelation and we could come right over. We went to reception at the Kensington Close to tell them we were checking out because they were not offering us a properly heated room and they refused to reimburse us the second night cost. In all we were charged 225.00 pounds for one night in a cold room. The mattresses were terrible by the way and this was a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly, not 4* as advertised more like 0*”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannange
Reviews.Content: Arrived and was aware that building work taking place but looked nice in reception. Got to room which was dirty and smelt like a urinal. My daughter was expecting luxury, she was almost in tears. They changed us rooms. It smelt better but Walls covered in dirty marks. Old fashioned tv. Next time will book premier in or travel lodge!! Am angry and feel like asking for money back and booking elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Like drilling?”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_chick28
Reviews.Content: Kensington close Pros - great location, friendly front line staff and waiting staff. Cons - renovations, facilities, breakfast staff x1 Stayed here for four days in the last week. Great location, staff were pleasant although very busy at times. I wush i had read the reviews first, only found the hotel was under rennovations once you got there, thought staff should have mentioned that building works start at 8am as i found out the first morning with drilling going on in the level above. This wont matter to business people but not ideal if you are here for pleasure. Our tiles were lifting in the bathroom, literally sticking to your feet, and the toilet took at least ten attempts to flush. Found Agnese the person to meet you at breakfast to be rude and unhelpful, other than barking what is your number, that was the most interest she took in anyone. We had the lovely linda one morning who took the time to say hello to each party, direct them courteously to thier tables and give them a quick explanation. I overheard many comments about the rudeness of agnese. The waiting staff were responsive and friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- Clean hotel-Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gmichael27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 29 December until 02 January with my family and we had lovely time. After I already booked this hotel I read the bad reviews and I wanted to make sure that for us everything would be okey so I sent them an email. Eylem was very helpful and she arranged for us very nice rooms. The hotel was very clean even they are still doing renovation. Reception staff was excellent . Porters very helpful . Room cleaners excellent (fresh bath towels every day) Breakfast very good( fresh fruits every day but no cheese, English breakfast !!!!!!) Great location ! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Secret Agents Ball, don't waste your time!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenAshleyJarvis
Reviews.Content: This event was held at the Kensington Close Hotel on New Years Eve. The deal was reasonable, Â£250 for 2 people (event, room and breakfast). ROOM: Me and my boyfriend were in a newly renovated room, can't complain, very nicely done out, small, but this is London, can't expect much more than that! However, we went with friends, their room was not renovated, all I can say is, renovation was WELL overdue! House keeping were more than happy to bring an ironing board/iron upon request. THE EVENT: Where do I start? What a joke. You can't enter the event through the hotel lobby, you have to go outside (in the rain) and queue with everyone else, even though some were not booked into stay at the hotel, only coming for the "event". Went to the (hotel) bar for the first round of drinks, I asked for Disaronno, a common drink, to be told, "we don't have any". Good start. Ok, Southern Comfort? "we don't have any" yes, you do, it's right there! All this was due to the fact they were only serving 5 spirits, whiskey, crap vodka and Archers, all Â£10 each with mixer. Rip off!! I ended up not drinking for the rest of the night, couldn't see the point in paying Â£10 for a drink I didn't even want! The music. House. House. House. Nothing else. There were 5 different rooms in this place, now, anywhere else I've ever been, they would be playing different music, oh no, not here, just house house house. This was not advertised on the website. In the "main" room, all the guy on the mic keep referring to was drugs. I even recorded this on my phone as evidence for complaining. He was asking the crowd for ketamine, saying thanks to people for the cocaine, disgraceful behavior in my opinion. If people choose to take drugs, that's their business, I do to expect to have it rammed down my throat by a bloody mc!!! The "casino" was a joke, 3 tables, couldn't get round one of them, when we finally got near, we found out it wasn't even for real money, what a joke, again, website VERY misleading. At this point, we actually decided to leave the hotel and go to a casino elsewhere, which we did, unfortunately we did not have any ID so were forced to go back to the event. We saw in the new year but had had more than enough by 1 and headed up. We had some drinks in our room which was when the fire alarm started going off. The hotel seemingly did nothing. It's like "we've hired out the hotel for the night, not our problem". In the morning, my friend said that she'd hardly slept due to the fire alarm continuing to go off for most of the night. She could not contact reception on the phone, no one was answering, which I've seen mentioned elsewhere on here. The alarm went off a few times in my room, but wasn't continuous, so that's something I guess. BREAKFAST: Average. That's all I can say. They constantly ran out of things, and rather than having more ready to replace it with, it was gonna be "a few minutes", no fried eggs, no sausages, no beans, no mushrooms. By the time they bought it out, they shut the doors 2 mins later and wouldn't let anyone else in! NEVER in a million years would I go to this event again, it was dreadful and the hotel did nothing to help any issues, because? You've guessed it, they weren't responsible for the night!

Reviews.Title: “Good but there is better locally for the same price”
Reviews.Author: BarryChocolate
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was modern and clean but on the small side. There was no heated rail in the bathroom to dry towels so you have to leave wet towels hanging in the bathroom. The tv was old and very small. There was no iron or ironing board in the room however one was delivered within 10 minutes after calling housekeeping. Breakfast was good but the range of continental foods was limited compared to other nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location Otherwise Average”
Reviews.Author: holidayobsessed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December. The location is very good being just a few minutes walk to High Street Kensington tube station. However the hotel is certainly not a 4 star. When we arrived they could find no trace of our booking (which we had paid in advance for) but found us a room - I don't know what would have happened if they had been full. The room was very basic and I can honestly say Premier Inn rooms are better. The bathroom was freezing with no heating source at all and the main air conditioning never seemed to get going. We switched it up to the highest setting at 32 degrees which should have made the room too hot but it was still chilly. Little things you would expect in any decent hotel were missing such as tissues in the bathroom. The plug mechanism was missing from the sink and as it was a modern sink that left just a big hole - we lost a couple of things down there! It was fair value for a London hotel in that location at Â£270 ish for 3 nights without breakfast. All in all it was ok but far from excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: Flugwiesel
Reviews.Content: Great location, tube and Boris bikes within easy reach, so are all sights, a cinema and shopping facilities. But a breakfast that is atrocious (and do they really believe it befitting a four star hotel?). Revamp still going on for half a year (free internet was offered as compensation, meaning you would normally pay for it).

Reviews.Title: “Most certainly not a 4* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca C
Reviews.Content: Visited here 5th-7th January for 2 nights with 7 other friends for a break to London. This hotel was a bit out of the way for most of the sights in London and was at least 2 tubes to anywhere we wanted to go. The walk from the tube station was only a couple of minutes which was quite handy. The area seemed a little bit dodgy, especially when a man dropped a suspicious looking package of white powder in front of our feet on the street outside the hotel. When we arrived to check in, the lady at reception advised us we had to leave a Â£30 deposit per night, per room which was very inconvenient! We were offered the option to leave cash or card however this was a lot of money for the whole party! We advised the lady we would not be using the facilities however we were just shown a terms and condition and had no choice! The hotel room was very basic, however seemed a little like a B&B and most certainly not a 4* hotel! I am pleased we did not need to spend much time in the hotel. On the second night when we arrived home from a show, there was a dispute with our check out date and I had to go down to reception after 10.30pm to show them my booking confirmation and again they tried to take more money for a deposit! This was the staffs fault as they had checked out my room instead of my friends room in the party! I was not impressed! There was at least a 20 minute wait on the Friday morning for a table in the breakfast hall and the staff were not very good at keeping the food supply up on the buffet making people stand around waiting for hot food especially! For such a big hotel and breakfast hall, there was only a tiny room for you to get your food, which was cramped and crowded! The Saturday morning breakfast que was not as bad! It was a good job we were not after a lie in on the Saturday morning as the drilling and renovations were to be heard prompt at 9am in the morning! Overall the stay was okay for our needs, which was a place to sleep after sight seeing London for a couple of days. I would definitely consider looking for other hotels next time for many reasons listed above! It most certainly was not a 4* hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: Joanna S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on 6th January, 2012, for one night as we were going to see Wicked (which is fantastic by the way). We arrived just before mid day and the receptionist told me that although, officially, check in wasn't until 2.00 pm, the room was ready for us. She was really polite and helpful, I'd been dreading the service after reading some of the reviews on here but no problems at all. Although very small, the room was perfectly clean, I think our room had recently been refurbished - it's not a palace but entirely satisfactory. The TV was really old but worked ok. Bathroom was spotless and the shower was great. We had breakfast on Saturday morning at around 9.00 am and there were no queues, we were seated straight away and the breakfast was fairly standard. Yes, there is building work going on and this started at around 8.30 am on Saturday morning but the receptionist had informed us of this when we checked in. I'm not sure what all the complaints are about. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: OakleyFife
Reviews.Content: The best thing is the location. Regardless of the building works, the place will continue to be mediocre as we had a renovated room for 4nights but the decor/fittings won't wear well in my opinion and it looks to be renovated 'on the cheap'. Breakfast was dreadful, definitely not worth the extortionate rate charged, only went once it was so bad. Self-service but they had service charge! MacDonalds do better coffee, nicer surroundings than this place. The queue to check out was about 20people long, so service not this hotel's strong point. In short, do yourself a favour, go to another hotel in the area, of which there are many. This one will never be 4*

Reviews.Title: “Poor service. Unhelpful and slightly rude staff. Disgusting room.”
Reviews.Author: Laurcolm
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel several months ago. We then called to confirm the reservation enroute and the hotel had no record of our reservation for that night. Reservation held by hotel had the wrong dates, and despite showing a prepaid voucher with correct date confirmation, the hotel was not interested and insisted we pay again if wanted to stay. The staff were not in any way helpful in trying to resolve the matter and were quite rude in some instances. The hotel is undergoing extensive renovations however these are being conducted in a haphazard and disorderly manner with contractors dropping scaffolding (right near the main entrance) from a great height at 8.30am and no safety barriers in sight! Work is being carried out from 8am mon - fri and a little later on Saturdays and the noise level early in the morning is ridiculous. Housekeeping walked into our room to make it up at 8.10am without knocking and we were still in there. The room was shoebox size and despite being non-smoking absolutely stunk of cigarette smoke among other things. The linen smelt like vinegar. The bed had saggy springs and was not the most comfortable. We didn't eat breakfast there as the lineup was out the door. The only positive thing I can say about this hotel besides the location is that the shower had great water pressure!

Reviews.Title: “More like Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: Booked on line throught 1800 Hotels for 3 nights in Dec 2011. Firstly, the hotel Is having renovations done, so, I can appreciate scaffolding outside etc. It was about 4:30pm when we checked in. No problems there. The problems began when we were going to our room. There were buiders lying on the corridors pulling panel of walls, rewiring bits n bobs, and so on. There was plastic sheeting all down the corridors and as someone else has stated we were literally stepping over builders. A bit much in my view. Walking from reception you can glance over towards the bar and I thought to myself "Im not having a drink there". Just looked shabby. The Room, oh my God, the Room! Small, dingy, dated, smelly for starters. Horrible room. The matress on the bed was like a crisp bag. When you sat on it your backside went straight through to the base of the bed and you could feel the bedsprings through the duvet. The bed was pushed up to about 12 inches from the wall so access was from one side only. On closer inspection I realised why it was pushed so close to the wall. There was a patch of mould on the wall about 15 x 6 inches. The bathroom was terrible. You had to squeeze down a narrow sleeve to use the toilet. I didnt stay any longer to admire the decor and about 6 and a half minutes after checking in we were at the reception to complain. The receptionist got a duty manager to hear our complaint and his answer was that "most" people liked the area and would put up with it. I told him again that the room was sub standard to say the least and I asked him would "He" like to stay in ther for 3 nights? He bumbled about for an answer so I took him out of his mysery and asked him what My options were? He said that he could give us a superier room for a charge of Â£50 on top of what we paid and he said we could have that for one night only and that we would have to go back to the original room for the remainder of the booking. I immediatly asked for the refund procedure and I was told that a 1 night late cancellation fee would be charged because of "late cancellation". When I explained that this wasnt a "Late Cancellation", that I wanted a refund because it was sub standard and it was NOTHING like the photos on their website. He said there was nothing he could do and we left that disgusting hotel. Luckily we got a hotel 5 mins away in the Hilton. Needless to say, we would not recommend this hotel and we will NEVER go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Can't see what the problem is???”
Reviews.Author: Zoe W
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights before Christmas, on arrival the front of the hotel isn't like the pictures on the website but this is only due to the rennovations which are being done at the moment. On arrival we were greated by a random butler (who amused me) the receptionist greated us and explained about the building works that were currently underway. Our room wasn't the biggest but plenty for what we needed, it was newly decorated and was well heated, we were able to control the temperature of the room ourselves which was a bonus! The bathroom was again quite small but not a problem as it was very clean! We stayed here for two nights, during which time our room was cleaned and we were given fresh towels. If I'm honest I was a bit put off by the other reviews on here but I believe that a number of people book this hotel via a third party in order to get a cheap deal - the hotel gives these customers the rooms which haven't been refurbished at the cheaper price - so all in all you get what you pay for so I would advise to book through the hotel direct. We didn't eat at the hotel and found the breakfast was quite expensive? Just across the road from the hotel is a very cute little cafe call The Muffin Man which was wonderful and does a brilliant breakfast at a very good rate which I wouldn't recommend!! The hotel is a two minute walk from the tube station and you can park at a local car park but this can be quite costly (it's free to park outside on a Sunday). So to wrap it up - if I were planning on going to London again I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel as I had a brilliant stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not four star worthy”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: I mostly agree with the previous reviews. The rooms are small but tidy. The staff speaks not too well English, which was sometimes quite confusing. Didn't hear much from the renovation though. The location, however is fine and the price is quite good. But, you will probably find something better when you browse through some other hotels. There is a swimming pool situated in this hotel, but they will charge you eight pounds per person in order to use it. I thought that was totally out of proportions, so we didn't used it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKJfromSweden
Reviews.Content: Renovations made the place horribly noisy, drilling and hammering even Saturday. An extra deposition was taken out when we checked in although we had paid for the rooms in advance, 30 pounds per room and night. We had not been informed in advance and the reception staff could not really explain why we had to pay it. We had ordered twin rooms but got double rooms and we were told that it was impossible to change because the hotel was full during the weekend. Instead I took a single room and paid 180 pounds for two nights for that. Then it turned out that the other people in our company could change into twin rooms, All of a sudden the hotel was not full. No heating in one of the rooms and it took a long time before that room could be changed into a more comfortable room. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: TightGuji
Reviews.Content: The worst place I have ever stayed in. For Â£188 a night this place is a joke. Firstly I booked through a travel operator who were not informed of the extensive refurbishment works taking place. They checked me into a room next door to one which was being refurbished. Building work went on 8 am to 6pm, why would you put any guests next to these rooms. The corridor leading to the room was being worked on so had people laying across the floor whilst I'm literally climbing over them to get to the room. When I went for breakfast the que was stupidly long and it was so busy I couldn't eat in peace. Avoid this hotel at all costs, so many bad reviews don't lie.

Reviews.Title: “a completely disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte S
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by photos of this hotel on the website or the 4* rating - God only knows how they came by that. It is without doubt the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. Reception were dismissive to the point of rudeness - all three Receptionists remained with their heads down as we waited to check in. The rooms are absolutely disgusting. The double room we were allocated was so small that the bed was pushed right against the window - leaving access to the bed from one side only. The twin room was like a school dormitory. When we asked for another room we were told that the hotel was fully booked and if we wanted to upgrade, we would have to pay Â£30 per room. I argued that I shouldn't have to pay extra just to have a suitable room - it was what I had paid for already. While this was going on, the people either side of me were also complaining about their disgusting rooms. We were eventually upgraded and if this was their definition of an executive room, I despair. I have stayed in better Travelodge rooms - the rooms were small once again, old, tired and filthy - disgusting filthy net curtains, carpeting, water stains from previous floods. The heating was faulty in both rooms - the double didn't work at all (it was 2* outside) and the twin's broke in the night. The bathroom was so small - should any overweight person try and negotiate the pathway to the sink, they would be in real trouble - the gap was perhaps 20 inches at most! The next morning one of the guests in the twin woke up to find a prominent 'insect bite' on her arm that certainly wasn't there the night before. Breakfast was as expected - I can't tell you what the food tasted like because one look at it and I passed! I can say that it looked pretty grim and the diningroom was set out like a huge dormitory with cheap tables and chairs. The hotel offered to refund 25% off the bill when we complained through the booking agent. Woopee - as if that was enough to wipe our hideous memories of this place away. Their excuse was that the hotel is being refurbished but that doesn't account for the rudness of the Receptionists, the horrendous rooms - which the Receptionists assured me, were remaining unrenovated.
