Reviews.Title: “Pretty good considering the building work.”
Reviews.Author: rahamx
Reviews.Content: You can see by everyoneâ€™s review that there are extensive building works being carried out at the moment. The hotel did need it though. Iâ€™ve stayed here a few times and was most impressed with what they have done so far. The new rooms are very nice and modern. They are still small, but bigger than before. They have removed the baths thus making more space. The rooms include the usual bits. Hairdryer,TV, Full length mirror, Safe,Tea/Coffee/Water and plate of fruit which i thought was a nice touch. From what I could see they have upgraded a lot of the rooms, but not all. So try to get a room thatâ€™s been renovated. The noise from the building works starts at 8am and finishes at 5.30 ( Mon-Sat). I canâ€™t see why itâ€™s such problem. I mean if youâ€™re in your room all day in London, then thereâ€™s something wrong with you. There were some advantages to the building works including free Internet, free movie channel and free gym/spa. The sports bar has gone Im afraid. So us poor guys canâ€™t watch the big match while the woman go shopping. It has however been replaced by a very nice comfy bar area. The breakfast area has also changed. Itâ€™s been moved over slightly and is now much smaller. Im sure this is an area that will be upgraded because at the moment the breakfast area just doesnâ€™t work. You have to wait an age for coffee, and if you want a piece of toast then be prepared to wait in line for ages. Some of the staff could also do with a bit more training in the service industry and maybe a smile might help. Another casultity of the refit is the car park. If you want to park you will have to use a meter or use the hotel next door. I will return xmas 2012 and cant wait to see the finished hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well below Expectation...”
Reviews.Author: 881WrongHotel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we had planned an evening in London as a pre Christmas break to relax, We did read the previous reviews thinking perhaps they were just one off experiences! well to be honest we were wrong... and for the record we had stayed in a "Club Room"!!? The buiding renovation work was the least of our problems...there were a list of issues with the Hotel/Our stay that broadly included the poor accommodation, non responsive hotel staff and general quality based on the 4 star status...this hotel is perhaps 3 star at a push. Despite the hotel renovations...our problems were unrelated and "fixable" but the hotel chose to ignore them - customer service is not a priority. We did then lodge a formal complaint after we had left but the senior management take the same view ...so you have been warned avoid at all costs

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: WolfofWallstreet
Reviews.Content: Let me star by saying I have stayed at least 10 times if not more in this Hotel, not to mention I have sent at least 15 friends to this hotel when visiting London. Every single time there is something wrong with it. It's either a leak in the room, or refurbishment, or the maid come storming into the room while you are asleep - but today topped it all. I had a reservation which I had to cancel on the day due to family issues. After calling in to make the cancellation I was told immediately the cancellation charge is the FULL room rate for the night. Absolutely ridiculous! After pointing out how many times I have been a guest it didn't change a thing for the reservation clerk - who BTW hardly speaks ENGLISH. Well they can go ahead and charge the fee, but I'm not coming back and neither am I recommending the hotel to anybody ever again. Kensington Close, enjoy the Â£99 fee - bad move because you just lost at least Â£3000 in the future. Bad policy never pays of, no matter how you wrap it up in the small print. The Hotel itself boast a beautiful refurbishment on their website. Far from it. The rooms are still grubby, staff is bad and the food is a massive NO, NO! The only thing going for this property, which is also the only reason I kept coming back is the location - yet again, thank God there are many hotels in Kensington.

Reviews.Title: “Find another Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: The most unfriendly and unhelpful reception staff on check in. We had supper in the bar as it was freezing outside. No heating on in the bar! Sat eating my meal with my duffel coat on. Bar not very clean, dust on everything! Mattress needed changing,picture on the wall had slipped in the frame. (not a good look) Staff started moving chairs by dragging them across the floor in the dinning room at 6.30am(my room was one floor above the dinning room)

Reviews.Title: “WARNING...Renovations going on....no morning lie in possible”
Reviews.Author: Pick_E_Diner
Reviews.Content: Was very unhappy to find the renovations going on when arrived - no warnings when booking. Quiet room requested on check-in - yes quiet between about 17:00 hrs and 08:00 but hammer drills and banging started at about 08:00 (maybe 08:30), but after a late night either time was completely unacceptable. Just got up and checked out so can't comment on the breakfast. Bar selections not very enticing. My comments may have been different if the building works weren't happening - but whole experience spoilt.......very poor customer focus.

Reviews.Title: “Beware massive renovations & noisy building work”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: This will be a lovely hotel when it is finished but for now stay away. I am a regular reviewer and mostly leave glowing reviews and I am often bemused by some of the bad reports but now I find myself writing one. I booked a group of 32 for our work Christmas party - spent over Â£5k - party side fine but hotel a mess and chaos. 20 mins to check-in - requests not done - rooms not ready - and this was 5pm in the evening - hoards of people - noise - scaffolding - workmen.....no warning from hotel when I made the booking in Oct but on 1st Dec notice appeared on their website offering extras due to renovation - which was a few days before party and we didn't see and weren't offered. Party was at the hotel - bed after 2am and at 8am on the dot - drills - bangs - noises - workmen on scaffolding otuside bedroom windows - impossible to sleep. Corridor smelt damp and of paint or something - even as party organiser they gave me one of these rooms and after a while managed to be moved. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL UNTIL THE WORK HAS FINISHED AS YOU CANNOT SLEEP AND SERVICE APPALLING.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: Latetraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing extensive renovations so be sure you are clear as to your requirements when booking. A good central spot in London for an overnight stay, with a car park in the adjoining hotel, if full, there are plenty of NCP's near at hand. Clean, but basic, and for Â£80 per night a reasonable price this may rocket when renovations are complete. Prices for bar and tea/coffee etc are expensive. Breakfast is not included in the price, suggest avoiding it and going to a local cafe, the Muffin shop nearly opposite I can recommend Tony Marsh

Reviews.Title: “Great Kensington location with English speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: S70Kj
Reviews.Content: All staff speaked English, even housekeeping! The service was good. We even changed room due to low wi-fi connection. Beds and pillows/duvet etc are good. Location is great. The tube (and busses, I believe) is very close, and stores (incl a Tesco) and a place to grab a bite, too. The refurbishment were of absolute no concern to us, but still the hotel compensated with free wi-fi and free movies. Daughter says pool was ok. Quite small. The housekeeping hammering at the door from early morning were a much bigger problem. The pool/jacuzzi should really be open later than 10 pm, at least between 10 pm and midnight when people really need it after a day walking up and down London's streets and sights. Rather close it some time during the day. Settled for tub in room after a cold night shopping only to find there was NO hot water at 11 pm! The bathroom door in 225 needs to be fixed asap! No fridge. Missed bisquits/cookies and hot chocolate option in room with the coffee and tea (gotten used to this in other hotels same range, and daughter preffer hot choc) Had to ask for more milk and sweeteners for the tea every day (no, I did not drink much tea) These are minor issues, I know. But it is the little things... We did not have breakfast so can't say anything about that other that it really should be included in the price. And even though the reception clearly is moved due to the refurbishment there really should be a seat to sit down on in the lobby! Not easy for everybody to stay on their feet waiting.

Reviews.Title: “In need of "CLOSE" attention”
Reviews.Author: seamermate
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room at a good rate on a business trip so for a good position in Kensington so shouldn't be critical of the room I was allocated Suffice to say the room was small, the TV has seen better days and only work intermittently and the safe didn't work On a positive note the room was comfortable clean and quiet - all I needed for a brief stay the Hotel is going through a refurbishment programme but no doubt the rates in future will reflect that For an overnight stay I would you this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good location but overpriced considering its many issues”
Reviews.Author: ninja91
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a night at this hotel recently based on its convenient location. It cannot be faulted for this as it's right by the Kensington High Street tube which is exactly what we wanted. However, it is overpriced and doesn't present the customer with a very enjoyable experience. Upon arrival I was impressed by the decor of the lounge/bar/entrance as it looks as though it has been recently renovated. I noted the building works which were annoying, but not a massive issue especially as this was noted upon booking the hotel. They offer free wifi as 'compensation' but they had run out of codes when I asked for one...The receptionist was fine and gave us all the necessary information. When we went up in the lift, I was very disappointed with the shabby hallway which didn't concur with the decor of downstairs - my expectations were high after seeing the renovated parts of the hotel and also after noting the Â£96 per night rate. The room was small. It was decorated in an OK way - moderately tasteful - but was very rough around the edges in terms of shabby, grubby walls, curtains etc. The bathroom was in a similar state, but I must note that everywhere was VERY CLEAN. When we went to sleep it was absolutely FREEZING. While the bed was comfortable in terms of mattress, pillows etc. it was just miserably cold. I had to sleep on the same patch of bed all night because otherwise I would wince in reaction to the icy cold. I noticed a tiny little fan heater in the corner of the room which was probably an attempt on the hotel staff's behalf to stop people complaining and make everything OK. The same problem occurred in the bathroom - the floor was icy cold and it almost seemed as though the window was wide open even though it was closed. The shower was very nice. All in all, not a very enjoyable nights' sleep. I could have perhaps excused the shabby quality of the room, if the room conductions were warm enough to be comfortable, but that wasn't the case. All this cost Â£96 and the hotel is rated 4*... The downstairs decor and random butler man standing outside don't justify the room rate or the hotel rating. Budget hotels are more tasteful and at least warmer. Both the price and rating are deceptive and the actual experience, at least on this occasion, was not at all pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “If you are prepared for the building works, fine hotel! Stayed 6th December 2011 in an Executive Twin”
Reviews.Author: GemmaKentNorthWales
Reviews.Content: Feel I must write a review on this hotel. We knew about the building works when we booked so that did not bother us nor inconvenience us in any way. The location was key for us as we were heading to the Royal Albert Hall. Location was great with a taxi rank outside. We had booked an executive twin but needed to move as the Wifi wasnt working. The staff were lovely and really helpful. The gentleman who moved us even set up the wifi on the Ipad for us and made sure it was all working before he left - lovely guy! The room itself was in need of updating - hence the 40million refurbishment!! But the beds were comfy and I honestly wanted to take the pillows home with me - fabulous nights sleep! Found the heating no problem to work - seemed to be the standard air con/heating system I have used elsewhere! Bathroom was clean and the shower powerful. To be honest, I thought the hotel was great value for money. Surely most people do check the website or Tripadvisor before they book anywhere and therefore should really be aware of the refurbishment. Breakfast was decent, really enjoyed it - bit squashed in the room but again that was due to the works going on! The bar area was lovely and relaxing. Didnt use the lesiure facilities so cant comment on that. We were a little daunted after reading the reviews on here but I think if you are prepared for the building works, the hotel is fine. People dont tend to write on here if they have just had a pleasant stay - usually if its outstanding or horrid so wanted to make sure that we let people know that our stay was lovely - no complaints. I am sure, as anywhere, people do encounter problems when travelling to hotels but for the price paid in the centre of London, this really was value for money. Hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: “MISERABLE!”
Reviews.Author: Snowcem
Reviews.Content: Spent a recent weekend in Kensington Close and the experience was truly miserable! Upon arrival, we noted the construction works however we were greeted well upon arrival and we were advised that we had been upgraded to an executive room. What a laugh!!! The reception area and bar area had obviously been renovated recently and it looked chic and modern. As we carried on to find our room the hallway decor began to look shabby....more to come! Our room really was miserable. A twin room which was freezing with dirty carpets, tiny beds, makeshift bathroom; generally poor quality. Later that night I called reception to advise them I was freezing (even though I was sleeping in my clothes!) and an employee brought me up a blow heater and 1 blanket that wouldnt warm a doll (by the way there were two of us!)). The heating system was noisy and so we couldnt turn it on and I said I would speak to the manager in the morning. The next morning we tried to relay our issues with the room but to be honest there was little or no assistance. We did however get transfered to another room - we were told it was of better quality!! Again laughable - it was exactly the same but a bit warmer!!! We won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “Unable to cancell booking”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: A booking was made by myself using their ON LINE booking system this was made on Sunday 27th Nov 2011 I thought for the Tue 29th Nov 2011, reviewing their conformation email I noticed I had mistakenly booked for Sun the 27th, I telephoned the Hotel to cancel as their on line system would not accept my cancellation, I was told that was fine and the cancellation accepted, I also followed up with an Email to confirm this, on the Monday morning I recieved an Email from the Hotel telling me I was a no show and payment was taken, after numerous telephone calls to this hotel I was told that nobody was on duty to deal with this incident and kept getting the run around by their staff, I have acted correctly and feel Ihave been dishonestly treated by this Hotel who has conspired to cheat me out of money so be very aware when Booking this Hotel ON LINE. Also be aware that Tax is added after giving your card details so you end up paying considerably more than stated.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: The_Immy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights last week (22/23/24 November 2011) and it was truly awful. The location is good but the hotel is under major refurbishment. No one told us that until we arrived and by that time it was painfully obvious. After check in we attempted to go to our room. The corridor was blocked by workmen on ladders who eventually moved albeit begrudgingly, after all they have work to do which must be made virtually impossible by constant interruption. We complained and asked to move rooms, we were told this was impossible as the hotel was fully booked. As a sweetener we were given free internet and free in room movies. Neither worked. The rooms are the smallest we have ever seen. You have to climb over the bed to close the curtains. They are dated and grubby. The heating in our room did not work and the shower was a constant scalding hot. Ironically, we left the shower running for 20 minutes at night to warm the room. The lifts worked intermittently. And for a man with Chronic Arthritis in his legs, the cold coupled with scaling the stairs was totally unacceptable. The hotel is listed as four star but is sadly nowhere near this. We didnâ€™t try the facilities or food as the place was that horrible we just wanted to leave. All in all a terrible hotel, a totally unpleasant experience. I have no doubt that when the refurbishment is completed then the hotel will be a nice place. Until then I would avoid it like the plague. There are other hotels comparable in price locally and I would recommend you stay at one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: primarkqueenDorset
Reviews.Content: The hotel is having a make-over so I have taken all of that into consideration, but the staff just don't seem happy to help or even happy for that matter. Our room was a twin and was small, heating was hard to understand and tv kept switching off, having the complimentry movies and spa use was great and the duvets and mattresses were so comfy.

Reviews.Title: “eventfull stay”
Reviews.Author: rangersloan
Reviews.Content: Stay in this location was booked by office in relation to proximity to Olympia, had read various reviews and was unsure as to how this would work out especially as on arrival and stood at the check- in, young lady was making complaint about standard of her room however happy to say ended up on 7th floor, but room was good, staff helpfull general all round good 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud Risk Evident at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JP T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this week for one night whilst on business. Arrived late on after a very long day looking forward to a good restful night. I was greeted by at reception by a staff member who informed me that I would have to leave a pre-authorise of Â£50 on my card to cover use of bar / facilities etc. This is pretty standard in a lot of hotels, but I did challenge this - it was nearly midnight, I am going to bed and do not intend to utilise any service that requires a charge - Reception staff were not accepting this.. hotel policy blah blah blah... fair enough, not a problem, or so I thought. Having done the pre authorise on the streamline machine, reception staff then typed my card details into his computer - he had no right to do this and is breaking PCI DSS guidance, but what was worse, he then decided to write them out onto a piece of paper by hand. I challenged this and suddenly we were into the "my english is not so good" mode - NOT happy, but it was nearly midnight, so went to my room thinking I would get this resolved in the morning. Room was ok, nothing to write home about and a few niggles including a dirty bathroom, a small CRT TV with access to only five channels and an air conditioning unit that kept turning itself on, making lots of noise and waking me up. Matress on bed had seen better days and seemed to taper down to the right side. Needless to say, sleep quality was poor. Breakfast the following morning was shocking - I was waiting for ten minutes to be seated ( only four other guests in front of me waiting to be seated, staff were clueless) and when I was seated, two of the serving staff decided to conduct a conversation leaning over my table in a foreign language. Quality of breakfast was sub standard, coffee was cheap and nasty, only streaky bacon available, generally everything was nasty apart from the hash browns. Go to check out and get told that there has been a bar bill charged to my room ( I did not go near the bar) at which point and explained that I had not been to the bar and raised my concerns about what happened with my card the night before - the only thing that was said repeatedly was that it was a mistake and I would not be charged. Got really annoyed with this and left a parting comment to this effect. Needless to say I will be keeping a very close eye on transactions on my account and the second I see anything fishy I will be in contact with both my bank & the police and will make them fully aware of what happened at this hotel with my card details. I have been in IT security for over ten years - I intend to find out who the PCI QSA was for this hotel and raise my concerns directly with them - My recommendation - DO NOT GIVE YOUR CARD DETAILS TO THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rate, great location - shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: Shiregirl
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny, with tired bathroom which didn't look very clean. The staff members at reception had limited grasp of English, the woman who dropped off iron knew 'thank you' Only! Renovation really spoils the place, But the rate is low due to disruption, so my advice is to only go if you want cheap & good location

Reviews.Title: “Family stay in London”
Reviews.Author: countyfanuk
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in this hotel and whenm I read the reviews I must say we were a little apprehensive. Don't believe everything you read would be my advice!! The hotal is an a great location and it is also very quiet and whilst the improvements may be off putting to some I can honestly say they did not bother us at all. When you go to London do you really need a top of teh range TV? What I wanted was a great location in a really nice area with clean, comfortable bedrooms and pleasnt staff and this hotel managed to satisfy all those needs. Yes its quite expensive even by London standards but then again you get a great gym and swimming pool (free by the way), really good breakfast so don't be put off by some of the reviews. Overall it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs in suite”
Reviews.Author: Margaret J
Reviews.Content: I have intense gratitude for this hotel because they basically didnt charge me for calling my travel insurance adviser when I had to go to the hospital to see a doctor due to a bad virus I caught on my trip. They were very accommodating and helpful. I have so much gratitude to the staff at the front desk that day. But when I got back to my room, I did find bed bugs, thank GOD I didnt get bitten that night. They put me up in a new room right away. Just be careful if you stay at this hotel, check the bed for bed bugs before you turn in for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Lori H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location and my room was very clean. Those are the only two compliments that I can give to this hotel. The photos of the rooms on the hotel's website are NOT representative of the actual rooms. The rooms are small, which I expected in London but the photos show king size beds and flat screen tvs and they definitely did not deliver. The room actually had a full size bed, not even a queen, which was pushed into the corner. One side of the bed was against the outside wall, which made for cold nights in November. The tv was not a flat screen as in the photo but a portable tv of about 16 inches. There were only five channels (no cable or satellite like other London hotels we have stayed in) and the signal constantly cut out. There is no internet access. When we asked about it we were directed by the staff to the hotel next door, which made us think we should have just stayed there instead. There is currently construction at this hotel, a fact we were not advised of when we made our reservation. They say that they don't do any construction on Sundays but that is false. There was construction all day on Sunday and every other day as well. We even got to enjoy one day without hot water. The staff was not at all helpful. At the end of our stay they tried to charge us for days we were not guests at the hotel. Even the manager tried to make us pay for these nights that we were not registered guests. We are still disputing the charges now, even after we have left. Overall it was a very disappointing hotel. I would not advise staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever, ever going back!”
Reviews.Author: Phil1000
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel at all. Yes it might have been going through a renovation which I was aware when I booked. However, cold breakfast, dated room, no English speaking staff and the list goes on. I booked an executive room, sorry but a tiny box room with a door that does not open fully because of the automatic door closer is not my idea of a four star hotel! Don't waste your money go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Kensington close hotel, Kensington, London.”
Reviews.Author: Wsatx1977
Reviews.Content: A+ location, rooms rather small (it's Europe) wifi signal not available in entire hotel, but they let us change rooms with no problem! A+ onsite gym. Hotel is currently under renovation. Only a 10 min. Walk to Kensington high street tube (subway) lots of shopping close by on highstreet. I would stay here again! Museums 10 min away on subway. If only the u.s. Had a subway system like London!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay great location.”
Reviews.Author: tihauga
Reviews.Content: This is an average ok hotel. Cheap with a great location, prizes in the restaurants were very expensive. It was clean, but a bit old. Staff were friendly and helpful, it was impossible to turn the heat up in the room. This was in december and a bit cold....

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CJC3
Reviews.Content: We recently had a very good weekend staying at the hotel, the location was great, close to Hyde Park and Kensington gardens and transport routes. In spite of the renovation work taking place and the proximity to the tube station, the hotel was very quiet. But the main reason for posting the review is that I left a bag behind in my room, the staff were excellent in sorting this out and arranging to post it to me at home. Many thanks to the customer service team.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, undergoing renovation but doing it well!”
Reviews.Author: caknights4086474
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sat 5 November - hotel full and initial room tiny - room 510 (twin) (next to lift shaft) - when I asked if there was any possibility of moving they were extremely helpful and accommodating and put us into one of their new rooms (room 701) - king sized double - very quiet,(stayed on Sat night so no building work - can't therefore speak for other times) fab shower etc. A thumbs up from me. Only problem was with getting there because of underground works - can't blame the hotel for them though!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money!!”
Reviews.Author: dd78
Reviews.Content: For the price paid for this hotel the rooms were tiny, facilities very poor and the Manager was less than helpful. The room was also very noisy with constant banging of the corridor doors going on outside. In my opnion this is not a 4-star hotel and the price we paid was very high. The pool, jacuzzi and sauna were ok, but in dire need of refurbihsment as part of the ceiling in the pool was coming away. Normally you are charged Â£8 a head for use of the pool on top of the room rate, but due to the ongoing refurbishment of the rest of the hotel this was free. If the refurbishment had not been going on at the time, I would not consider Â£8 a reasonable charge for use of the basic facilities on offer. The building works were very annoying and woke us up with very loud banging between 08:00 and 08:30 on Saturday morning. Had the noisy works been scheduled at lunchtime or in the early afternoon (as they could have been as they didn't go on all day) this would have been much more acceptable as the hotel is in need of work. A complaint was made to the Manager about the noise at that time of the morning and I was just fobbed off. I asked the Manager to provide us with the name and address of the owner of the hotel upon our checkout so I could make a further complaint, but he did not bother. Although it is worth saying that the works would still not have any bearing on our decision not to stay at this hotel again - it is simply not worth the money. The photographer who took the photos on their website must be very good as they dont represent what is actually there! We would not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, shame about the Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vickie P
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a short break. I like this location and we usually stay at the hotel next door - Copthorne Tara - but the price seems to be very high now, so we decided to stay at the Kensington Close instead. We new the hotel was undergoing refurbishment, so we expected it to be noisy between 8am & 5pm, but that didn't effect us that much as we were out between those times. We entered the standard twin room and my parents room was strongly smelling of paint fumes and mine was smelling very damp. I opened the windows and turned on the air conditioning which helped a bit! The toilets are so small in the en-suite, if you have a big bottom, you will find it hard to sit down, without being wedged between the walls. We booked room only but decided to try breakfast for one day. We had 1 continental breakfast and 2 English breakfast from the buffet. The buffet had plenty choice, but was standard instant coffee and juice was from concentrate. In a 4 star hotel, I would think the standards would be higher. It also cost - Â£47!!! for 3 people Which gave me a shock! My advice it to go to high street turn left and walk a little till you reach "Balans" - they have an excellent choice - I had the "Breakfast Burito, which is delicious! There are no evening meals apart from in the lounge area, but again we rather get our food from outside. In the Copthorne Tara next door they have a very nice Chinese Restaurant which have all the usual favourites and Singapore specialities, which were delicious. I won't be staying there again until the renovations are finished. Also went to see Ghost the Musical - I can't recommend it enough. Magical effects and a good laugh for anyone. Buy the best tickets on the Royal Circle to fully appreciate the special effects. When It finished I wanted to see it again the next day! If you can afford it stay next door at the Copthorne Tara instead, much more facilities and atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsSocks
Reviews.Content: Last weekend my husband and I stayed at Kensington Close, Yes the room was small but how long do you stay in it? Yes the TV was dated but who on earth visits London to watch TV. The building works did not bother us at all, the breakfast was fine. Our room was very clean and the staff were the friendliest I have ever encountered in a hotel anywhere! Very good value for money. Close to tube and bus services and near Kensington High Street. I will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here for 1 night only prefered the hotel before renovations!!”
Reviews.Author: nic061171
Reviews.Content: have been here twice before a few years ago and must say i loved it back then the massive bar is all gone now :-( a wine and beer not much change from Â£10 in the new bar :-( pool area gone very grubby over the years which they will charge you Â£8 each if you book through an ageny and not direct with them! the gardens are shut at the moment aswell, standard double rooms amazingly tiny ok for 1 night but not much more, very noisy but thats due to the work being carried out.car park closed but can use nextdoor hotel parking at an expensive Â£32 per day. breakfast ok but very crammed in a small area not a lover of being sat with strangers on top of me whilst i eat. i would stay again for 1 maybe 2 nights purely for the location is good but would upgrade to a larger better decorated room,prices only good if you get a deal online otherwise expensive for what it is.bathrooms very small and not up to cleanliness bigger rooms would be better. found the staff quite helpful and polite.really recommend the thai resturant across the road on he left and will be going there again for def. :-)))))

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: lulu3
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 stayed here as part of our Cosmos Bus Tour. Rooms were small, but the beds were very comfortable. We weren't bothered by any construction, because we arrived late and left early. The included breakfast was fantastic! Probably the best of all the places we stayed! We weren't able to phone to Canada from our room, even with repeated help with reception. We walked around the area at night and felt very safe. We had supper at the Britannia on Allen Street a few blocks away and highly recommend it! The fish and chips were great!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ashpam
Reviews.Content: Booked a theatre break for our anniversary, checked out hotel and had good reviews. When we arrived they are having renovation work done so constant drilling and banging fom 8am till 5pm. Room tiny, bathroom had no ventilation, toilet did not flush properly and when I tried to run a bath all we got for 15 minutes was thick brown sludge. Very few staff spoke or understood english. Sorry but this hotel is not up to the standard that it advertises would definitely not go back.

Reviews.Title: “They do their best - just ask”
Reviews.Author: Vee H
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a theatre break in London on the 28th October and would disagree with most of the reviews - it is a perfectly resonable place to stay provided they one knows why exactly they book it: i.e. my husband and I booked it for it's location, proximity to the Tube and convenience for travel in London, we DID know it's under renovation and we DID read horrible reviews. However, we can 'solemnly swear' that if one comes across a workman in the corridor, they are not intrusive and do pay attention to guests and their convenience. The work is strictly scheduled - we didn't not notice it starting at 7:30 but at 9:00 on Saturday. When we were back in the evening the work was over so we were not affected. Instead of 'ranting' about the renovation (which is there and won't go until Jan 2012) would like to offer a couple of good tips: a) if you have any issues, bring it to the attentions of the staff/ preferably manager a.s.a.p and NOT after you have left (what's the point in it, please?) We did have an issue, we brought the issue to the manager at the reception and then the duty manager and it was resolved PROMPTLY and to our satisfaction; b) our room was small - but obviously it fit the standard of the starring they were awarded otherwise they wouldn't have been awarded the star rating, BUT it was clean, bed comfortable and bedlinen immaculate; c)reasonable hight of shower in the bathroom - which you can change!!! so just adjust d)room has complimentary tray with selection of teas - coffees (including decaffinated) e) don't even want to comment on the TV and whether it's modern enough - if one comes to London, pays Â£120 or so for the room and watches TV - well, it's their choice, however, most of the people wouldn't care - we didn't: there's a TV set, there are enough channels To cut it shorter, one should really 'shop' and look around what they are buying: we wanted good location, reasonable pricing (for London standards) and clean and comfortable room. We got all we wanted - and when we didn't, we spoke to the manager and did get what we wanted. The next morning the same member of staff at the reception did check if everything went well in the end - the staff IS polite, and do their best

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Serge C
Reviews.Content: Been at that hotel in october 2011. Ridiculous room (less than 9 square meters, bathroom included), for more than 100 pounds a night, an old and very small television set, with stains and dirt on carpets almost everywhere in the hotel, many holes in ceiling. Dark room. Dark dining room, with very old furniture and ceiling and carpet. We tried to get a compensation but the staff was not accomodating at all. Very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good.”
Reviews.Author: WI Boy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of an escorted tour and it appears that this is the only clientel. It's a dated hotel in a less than ideal location with a staff that needs a course in customer service. I was glad I didn't spend more that one night. The room was clean and breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: pineapple_coconut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago and I would never ever ever EVER recommend anyone to set foot inside this hotel. It was horrific. We changed room FOUR times. The rooms were disgusting - the bathroom was terrible, the rooms were tiny, the window in one of the rooms didn't even close properly, mould growing on the sills - the bathroom in the fourth room we were given was marginally better than the others but it was still rotten. We gave up after the fourth change because we were so tired and fed up. The bath/shower was not cleaned properly, we actually went to a supermarket to buy cleaning products because clearly housekeeping in this place do not have the same cleanliness standards that we have. The food there too was horrible and one of us got food poisoning and were very sick after it. Avoid at all costs, absolute nightmare of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close the Kensington Close”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the nights of October 10th & 11th 2011. I had read on travelwise that there was some construction going on and it was annoying. There was construction in progress, however the work didn't start until 7:30AM and ended around 5:00PM.Did not find it annoying. The public areas of the hotel are undergoing renovation and when it is finished I suppose it will be nice....H O W E V E R. the room accommodations are horrendous. Our room was dark and dingy. The television was an old model that received 5 channels was blurry with muffled sound. The bathroom was absolutely the pits.I am 5'9" 180 pounds and was barely able to fit into the cubbyhole that the toilet was placed in, I would estimate it to be less that 2 feet wide. The restaurant although nicely appointed is located much to far from the reception area where the lifts stop to let you off for the restaurant. I was on a Cosmos tour where all the hotels were supposed to be at least 4 star, I would rate this one as a FLOP HOUSE

Reviews.Title: “Do not visit the Spa”
Reviews.Author: Dixan
Reviews.Content: I visited the Spa with a group of my friends for a day of pampering. The staff didn't provide us with the treatments that were booked and didn't provide a good service. I wouldn't recommend going here. I left upset and stressed rather than relaxed and refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Kensington close construction nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: My mother and I have recently returned from a trip to the UK. Do not under any circumstance book anything at the Kensington Close hotel and spa. We were greeted to mounds of scaffolding, plastic and soot covered hallways. The construction (that according to hotel staff will be contiuing for months) begins promptly at 7 30 am each morning. Its a blend of drilling and men clambering along scaffolding that is right outside your window. It also continued well into the night. It was the worst experience ever. The staff was not accomodating at all, nothing was offered as compensation. One of the maintenance workers that helped us with our very outdated tube style tv ( with FIVE grainy channels) said " I would never check anyone in here" .... A great seguay to the rooms....simply put, Shoeboxes doubling as rooms. Brutal. Oh one more thing. My moms digital camera was stolen to from our room. So lock your stuff up too. Worst hotel ever. Scott Ross London Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Customer service needs reviewing”
Reviews.Author: nessienoops
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the 25th October 2011 before I saw the results on Trip advisor however because of the location I decided to book a standard room for Â£118, I was asked to be upgraded to Executive room, there Executive rooms are nothing short of very basic the shower you had to bend under and I am short at 5 foot 4, the bathroom got soaked because the shower curtain is not sufficent and the room as a whole was very basic I would not mind if i had paid Â£50 that is all is was worth, the work going on at the hotel did not affect me as I was out most of the evening and up early but I could see how it could upset people. That aside the receptionists are very frosty to say the least and you do not feel welcome on arrival or departure they seem very stern and a smile seemed too much trouble The only good service was in the bar when we ordered coffees, I cannot comment on breakfast as did not have this due to the terrible reviews. One of the refurbished rooms which i was staying in was definately of low quality , the hotel might be busy for the olympics because of demand for london but after that forget it. I would star this hotel as a 2 and not a four star Management train your staff and welcome guests they are not the enemy.

Reviews.Title: “London a great city”
Reviews.Author: BILLYCo_Durham
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to London with Stanley Travel, and Malcolm Ward was the driver, one of the best we have been with, with any of the coach operators, helpful, pleasant, and above all he was well up on his knowledge of London, he gave us a first class tour of the sights,{ costs Â£27 on the sightseer bus, that includes trip on the river Thames }.The Kensington Close hotel, well it was acceptable, clean, and when we left the new bar and reception were done and it looks good, room 531 was small but clean, and as it was a twin we had two nights good sleep, and it was needed there is so much to do and see we were ready for bed. For us the two night stay was not enough and we look forward to going back, and yes I will be quite happy to go to same hotel, as all refurbishment will be complete. One thing that could be better is the breakfast had to wait in line for a table at busy times,and do your own toast on a rotating grill that took twice to toast the bread, and the bacon {all streaky} was under cooked. other than that all was very good for us. Well done to Malcolm. Oh nearly forgot Denise helped a bit .

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at all costs”
Reviews.Author: CaptGTK
Reviews.Content: This place is a mess. Certainly not worth the price. The rooms are minuscule; most college dorm rooms are bigger. It is impossible to move completely around the bed, as the mini-fridge is right up against the foot of the bed. The bathrooms have NO counter space. None. And it's only slightly easier to navigate than the airplane lavatory. There is a whopping 5 channels of free TV! When I was growing up in the 1950s near New York, we had 7 channels over the air. In this age of cable, how could any hotel offer only 5 channels? I get more English language channels in hotels in France and Spain! The room safe is as inconveniently located as they can possibly make it: on the floor of the closet. So, when you are placing things in, you need to get down on all fours. When you take things out, in order to see inside, you literally have to get down on your belly. There is no place to put your luggage to load and unload it (I'm told that some rooms have a luggage rack, but not all.) The hotel is undergoing extensive renovation (but the room size won't increase.) They are adding two floors and a whole wing in order to cash in on the Olympics next year. Meantime, don't expect to take an afternoon nap, unless you can sleep through jackhammers and power tool noise. Additionally, your view is of the scaffolding. And, if you have the curtains open, the workmen have a view of you! The good points: it is in Kensington and conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: jomarmy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pathetic in many ways. The rooms are nothing like pictured. Bathroom floor was filthy, tile and grout coming up. Room was extremely small and the TV did not work half of the time. I was told that my room was newly refurbished. This hotel is not a four star by any means...maybe a two star at best. The front desk and staff are totally out of touch of customer service and need some training. A waste of my money to stay here....never again!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Rosalind B
Reviews.Content: Our children's rabbit Flopsy has a bigger hutch, Rose West lives in a bigger cell than the laughable pretence of a room my husband and I had the misfortune to stay in for two nights on a break in London with friends. I had to live with the embarrasment of booking this weekend break for our friends to find ourselves in a noisy, dusty, run down, allegedly 4* hotel ,which it is not. Staff who care very little go about their business. While the refurb is on, one gloomy bar/ restaurant with about as much ambience as an airport waiting area, is their only offer of 'service'. Please note that the refurb is for reception and bars not the rooms,they are ridiculously small . Not only that, they are grubby and poorly furnished with a TV of the old analogue variety. At one point we thought we had a balcony until we realised it was the scaffolding that webs its way outside across all floors interspersed with the odd builder's bum. It was an absolute rip off and we will never stay there again. To cap it all, I had to get up to spend a penny in the night and as I sat up off the bed I bashed my head into the bathroom door-it was that cramped! Luckily for the hotel we all have great senses of humour and accepted our plight by laughing it off as a Fawlty Towers experience. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: lukamandog
Reviews.Content: I stayed on business at this hotel for one night on business last week, and i can honestly say that it was one of the worst experiences of my business hotel stays in almost twenty years. The hotel is having a re-fit. Much overdue I'd say, as it certainly didnt seem like a four star hotel, and that'sbefore they decided to turn it in to a building site complete with its own scaffolding and 100ft high crane! But, i suspect that the owners are too tight to shut it, so you are staying on a building site and boy, do you know it - see my photos. My room wasn't ready when i arrived in the morning - I wasn't expecting it to be - I was told that there was no lounge, and the only place for me to plug in my laptop and work was in the breakfast room. I was shown into the room, which, apart from the carpet, was like a YMCA canteen. The chairs were stained and there were water stains on the ceiling. The noise from the building works and guests enjoying breakfast was horrendous, so after 20 minutes, I left. As for the bedroom, it was clean and poorly appointed, but Not significantly worse than many other London hotel rooms, apart from the scaffolding and walk-way outside the window! Jack-hammers at 8am do little to enhance early-morning well-being. The breakfast Â in the same room as i'd been the day before was the same loveless, experience. The whole hotel is shabby and showing signs of wear - definitely NOT a 4starhotel. Â The staff seemed worn out from apologising for the obvious shortcomings and disgruntled guests.Â  Typical example of greedy hoteliers - is it any wonder people want to go abroad. I paid Â£120 for this hotel through an agency, who to be fair have refunded half of it as they agreed with me.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, unfriendly staff, awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KevJeff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a two night stay at the hotel, what an awful place the rooms are so small, nothing like those shown on the website, you had to take care when getting out of the shower that you did not put your foot in the toilet, the door to the bathroom would not open fully as it kept hitting the sink. The staff were just not interested when I said the room or hotel was not similar to the pictures on the website, I am fully aware all companies use their best rooms/views but this was way off the mark. The room was clearly not fully serviced after our first night as paper on the floor was still there even after the vacuum cleaner had been shown the room. Marks on the mirror and tiles also remained. The bed is small, I am 6 foot tall however I spent most of the night with my feet hanging over the end when fully stretched. The TV did not work properly; the room safe was also a joke, placed in the bottom of the wardrobe, therefore should you choose to use it you have to get down on your knees. Breakfast was slow with items running out and long delays whilst they were replenished, even though we ate at what was considered their quietest time. As for taste and quality, these were two items clearly missing. Little things like moving through the hotels when staff met you at the doors, they did not even bother to open/hold them for you, as for the doorman, well we did see him move once. My other major concern was where they appeared to challenge a guest who had a support dog with her, the staff were clearly questioning her about the need to bring the dog with her, whilst we did not witness the full conversation it was clear the staff were totally ignorant to the rights of the lady and were uncomfortable with her situation. I am aware that a lot of people leave reviews and we all have different experiences, however I would strongly urge you even if you have to pay a few more pounds more, go elsewhere you will not regret it, class, comfort, style, leisure, welcome are just some of the words you would not associate with this hotel. My only regret is that I did not read the reviews on the hotel before we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - wish we had listened to the other current reviews.”
Reviews.Author: P-Lion007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel a few times in the past when visiting London. This recent visit was surprisingly poor. I wish we had listened to the other current reviews. It started off with us being put in a room with a tiny bed after we had specifically booked a king sized bed. When we went back down to the front desk they said the bed we just saw was the largest bed in the hotel and that there are no kings (I get that in the UK not every hotel calls them "kings" but they have enough N. Americans coming through they should know exactly what we're talking about). We told them we had stayed at the hotel several times now and each time have stayed in a room with a king - we were genuinely confused. We told them we were going to find another hotel (luckily we didn't pre-pay) and I was ten seconds away from booking another hotel when the manager on duty decides to step in and show us a new room. And there you have it, a room with a nice big king. We had just got off a red eye flight from Canada and had to deal with this. We were too exhausted to deal with the fact that an employee lied to us and at this point too tired to change hotels. And then there was the construction. Frankly it was such a joke they really shouldn't have had the hotel open with so much construction. The jack hammering was so loud we couldn't hear ourselves think. I could go on about the rediculously slow elevators or the ghetto restaurant (i must add, the restaurant staff were lovely) or the lack of ramps for stroller access but I digress. Do not stay here. Spend a little bit more and stay somewhere where you'll enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “not bad...but not great either!”
Reviews.Author: travelingchef33
Reviews.Content: this was the final hotel my friends and i stayed at during our trip through europe. it was nicely located in london. the tube was a mere 5 minutes walk from the hotel. there were ample choices for dinning. the breakfast provided by the hotel was top notch compared to some of the other places we stayed at. there were only two issues i had: 1) the large amount of construction goin on at the hotel, 2) WE DID NOT HAVE VIEW THROUGH OUR WINDOW...we were staring at another room..we were inclosed in another room that was not finished!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: anca j
Reviews.Content: Great location, but that's about it. Rooms are clean, but extremly small and poor facilities. Staff quite unfriendly, hotel loud until early hours. No restaurant just a bar with very poor quality and far to expensive for what they offer. If you need just a bed for the night it's ok, but not worth it for anything else, it would ruin your city break.

Reviews.Title: “Under Refurb at moment”
Reviews.Author: tiger96_nz
Reviews.Content: Hard to judge due to major renovations underway. Stayed here before our Cosmos Tour started. The room was small and only one lift was working the whole time we were there (5 nights). The breakfasts were absolutely brilliant and a great selection to choose from. I dare say that it will be amazing once the refurb is complete. Convenience wise it was brilliant with a short walk (approx 200m from the front door) and close to the high street for Boots, coffee shops and a supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel - poor staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveller606606
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in what was described as a double room. This is the first hotel, meant to be 4 star, where one of us had to climb over the other to get out of bed. The room was painfully small with an uncomfortable double bed pushed up against a wall! The facilities in the room were poor. No iron or trouser press and the television was an old CRT type with one 5 channels and poor reception on all of them. The bathroom was tiny. It comprised a WC enclosed in a small alcove and at the other end was the sink next to the bath. To describe just how small it was you need to understand that drying oneself after a shower meant hitting one of the walls constantly with your hands if you were not careful. On top of this was the staff. At check in they appeared to try to ignore you and happily wandered off despite queues forming. The porters were also rude - how dare you ask someone to take care of your luggage! We booked this as part of a theatre break and wished we had checked trip advisor first. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “WASTE OF TIME”
Reviews.Author: janRotoruaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We booked a room by email and had confirmation of our booking. Arrived at the Hotel 10th October 2011 to be told they had no bookings for us. They demanded proof of who I was but still no booking. I then used their computer and was able to show the Hotel their emails confirming our booking. Meanwhile went next door to the copthorne and got a far cheaper rate and and they were very happt to have our business. Would strongly recomend that you stay clear of the Kensington hotel they need to get their act together

Reviews.Title: “1 year later, still great location, still mediocre property.”
Reviews.Author: MarkWorld
Reviews.Content: Having been here a year ago, and with its great location, I thought I'd give the hotel another try. That was an underwhelming decision. Yes, the rooms are small, it's Europe, rooms ARE small. Many reviews seem to focus on that; it's just what it is. However, to make this easy, here are some bigger issues: â€¢There is still construction going on, which I can sort of deal with (even the jackhammers at 0800; It was kept quite tidy but the "we're sorry" offer of internet access (which barely had signal and often cut out) doesn't count (I can have that at a Hampton Inn for free AND get breakfast, too) â€¢5 channels of television (in this age? I didn't go to England to watch telly but it would be nice to have some broader options) â€¢no radio or clock â€¢bathroom lighting is abominable!!!! Two recessed lights and both are behind you when you're at the sink! As a designer by trade, I'm embarrassed and amazed that this is still the case; I mentioned it last year, too. When I expressed my dismay on check out, I was greeted with a bemused look and "Really, I'll have to look at that." Honestly, they don't know how badly designed these bathrooms are? â€¢bath sink with virtually no counter space, plan on carrying your items back and forth from the room (the shelf over the toilet just invites dropping your items where you never want them to go) â€¢HORRIBLE situations in getting the front desk to answer at night, when calls came in from the US, it rang 52 times and no one answered, I dialed from my room, 32 rings and no answer. When I finally reached someone 20 minutes later, I was told there were many people at the desk and they couldn't answer the phone. I'm glad the back of the hotel wasn't ablaze. That answer is inexcusable for any property, anywhere. â€¢When told I had internet access, gratis for my 5 nights, I was given codes for two nights and told I "could come back for more if I needed them." I should have just said, "give them to me now" but was too stunned by the lack of logic to respond. (didn't matter as I spent most time just trying to find a signal. Better bet, if you need to get online, go to the McDonald's up the street, sit down with a little nosh and fire up the FREE internet.) There are some good points: â€¢the staff at check in seems more personable that last year. At least they seemed slightly interested that you were checking in. (last year they were just surly) â€¢the beds are comfortable â€¢the rooms are clean â€¢the location in Kensington and nearness to a Tube station is great But lots of other properties have those attributes. Approach with caution. Used as a convenient base of operations, it is okay. If you want anything else from your hotel, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Camilla L
Reviews.Content: Although it does say that there is building work currently going on, it needs state that the amount of noise is considerable. Infact we were put in a tiny box of a room on the 7th floor, the works were going on on the floor above us and it literally felt that the drill was in our room. The walls shook and we couldn't hear a word each other said. There were workmen constantly outside our window and in the corridors outside our room. Graffiti round the lift. It was horrendous. When we complained, the manager could not have been any less helpful.....or interested. What a god-awful place, we will never ever set foot near it again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Take a hard hat”
Reviews.Author: Harry H
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£118 per night to stay in a building site without breakfast. First room on 3rd floor had a room being built on directly outside my window - fine view of a man fitting plasterboard. Corridors littered with workers, ceilings open, wires hanging down. Jack hammers and hammer drills from 8 til 6. Told duty manager that it was unacceptable to be paying to stay in such conditions - no compensation or discount offered. I can only assume that they have the cheek to keep operating like that because the public will put up with it. Please don't. It's outrageous!

Reviews.Title: “Very unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: gpq1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kensington Close Hotel during a weekend with my wife. The room had a non working telephone and safe box (both fixed after reporting it). Worst thing though was that on Saturday morning at 08.00 I was waken up by a jackhammer, because of the renovation taking place. I called (from my mobile, because the phone didn't work) and asked to speak with the manager. After 15 minutes I wasn't called back, so I called again and asked again. Finally I managed to talk to him and all he could say was "You should have known it, because we also told Expedia, that we work from 08.00 to 15.00". This is what Expedia has on the website: "This property is undergoing renovations from 20 January 2011 to 31 January 2012. Completion dates are subject to change. Every effort will be made to minimize noise and disturbance", so no mentions about working hours. Does "every effort to minimize disturbance" mean jackhammering at 08.00 on Saturday morning? I sleep in hotels around the world over 120 days per year and I could never witness these crazy renovation working hours. The personnel is not trained to 4-star standards and the room makes you think that a couple of stars must have been forgotten since some time. If you book a hotel to be able to sleep, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: clifford1745
Reviews.Content: We stay at this Hotel on the first night of a Cosmos Tour in June very disappointed with the hotel the location was fine but the hotel was very poor the rooms were very small and in need of a upgrade glad we only stayed for one night. Do not know how it rates 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: lyagywonok
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in London for duty and company booked me this hotel that's why I can't rate the value of staying here, only pure impression. Location is definitely good, but that is all the hotel has. I like walking by foot, both Piccadilly and Fulham are reachable from here. Cons: - I understand this is large traditional hotel, but most of traditional things are annoying. There are no double-glazed windows only single window. Wind is blowing through it constantly. The room is ridiculously tiny and bathroom is of a strange shape to fit hotel's layout. If you stay alone the bed is always single not double. There is no mixer tap, the water is mixing straight on your hands - unpleasant feeling; - I was offered 3-course dinner a la carte each evening, Menu was limited and not attractive. Buffet dinner was also available to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “poor choice”
Reviews.Author: jaydboat
Reviews.Content: Hotel was picked by Globus travel for 6 of 13 days in England. They should have known better. Somebody is making money on this. Upon arrival after all night flight and 2 hour customs, we arrived at 10 a.m. and was told we had to wait until 2:30 (understandable). Tiny lobby with no seating. They should have given out coffee or water? Every time we asked if a room was ready, the answer was rude.No computer was available as advertised and the pool was not for us. The luggage, which I was told at 4:40 was being delivered as we spoke, did not arrive until after 6:00, when we went to dinner. As already stated-tiny, not very clean rooms. We had to call for a cleaner bed cover.Jack hammers quit a 5:00. Breakfast was very good. If this hadn't been prepaid, We would have left. Not a one star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Debbielund
Reviews.Content: We've used this hotel before and although the rooms were small the service was excellent. That's all changed! On arrival they had lost my sons booking so he was put into a tiny single room, both our rooms had a wonderful view of the construction work going on and it was great to be woken to the noise of workmen in the morning! When complaining to management, we were shrugged off as if annoying them. We left and spent the next night at the fantastic hotel next door, the Tara Hotel which was a pleasure. I wouldn't ever go back or recommend Kensington Close again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4*.”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Firstly they're renovating the hotel and you have to give them some slack for that. But are they doing it on floors that have been closed? Nope, they're doing it either side of the room they've stuck you in! Expect a drills and hammers alarm call at 8am prompt. Room is a bit of a misnomer. It's suggests space, and that's something that you simply don't have. Twin room with the beds stuck together defeats the point of a twin room! And they were almost, within inches, of touching the bathroom door. Finishings of the room weren't up to 4* expectations. A time warp from the 1970s, even then you'd have expected better joinery work. Better facillities. Even without the building works it's a 2* hotel. What did the hotel offer as compensation for the building works? Free access to the Spa and 20% off breakfast. We eat at the Muffin King just outside and had a wonderful breakfast, probably for less than KCH would have charged! Best thing I can say about the Kensington Close Hotel? We only stayed the one night....

Reviews.Title: “kensington close hotel. claustrophobic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ziggyzeus
Reviews.Content: On arrival were given room on the first floor. It was very small, obviosly the room had been split in half. Ordinary double bed which was up against the window,with a terrible matress, no table on that side, had to climb over partner to get in and out. The carpet wasnt clean, the bath had antiquated shower and bad tiling with messy sealant, burn holes around sink. Box tv not flat screen. The lighting was clinical. The room was Â£90.00 no breakfast. When we complained, the manager said he had an executive room on the 5th floor. Apart from that he was fully booked. The room was the same except it had more light because it was highrer up the building, and a newer carpet. Other guests were complaining at reception. The manager told us that they were going to have a new impressive lobby, one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louisemcc
Reviews.Content: Described as a 4* definitely nowhere near! The hotel is getting refurbished, however we stayed in a room already done and it was small, basic and the bathroom had been left undone! Old brown tiles, cracked dirty bath. I'm just glad I was here for work and didn't have my kids along. We ate one night in the restaurant and had to return our food uneaten it was that bad, breakfast is passable. The location is good and that's the only positive about this very dated hotel. All the blinds remain closed in the bar/restaurant with very dim lighting all day so ur sitting in the dark eating breakfast! (think they're trying to hid decor)!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: bourbonSydney
Reviews.Content: the single room was so small, barely had room to put my suitcase. once in the shower, not enough light to see. shower rail nearly falling off. construction going on outside my window, so could not open curtin, very dark and depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Okay at the price but undergoing construction work.”
Reviews.Author: Viking75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last week for a conference and had a ok stay with my colleagues. The first thing that we noticed was the poor service at the front desk, the staff seemed slightly annoyed, tired or just not bothered with the guests whom they were helping in front of us. Our own check in went well and we got to our rooms fairly quickly. The rooms were clean, maybe a bit small and the air vent in the bathroom generated a fair amount of noise. The beds were comfy though and the bathroom was also ok. The hotel is undergoing construction work at the moment(new lobby i think) and there was a lot of very loud banging, drilling etc. during the morning. We were there for business so we were up very early and not to bothered but in my opinion it was unacceptable at 8 o'clock in the morning. I don't know when they're done but i wouldn't recommend a stay for anyone who's not out of bed early and back late, until they've finished construction.

Reviews.Title: “good value for english standards”
Reviews.Author: jenwil27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is currently under going renovations but is ideally located near Kensington High Street tube. The rooms are clean although small in comparison to Australian standards however English standards - it is very normal. The rooms are clean, price is value for money & the staff try very hard to help. I had my handbag stolen from the Prince of Wales Pub (not in the hotel) and they went out of their way to assist us contacting Australia, police & insurance companies. Definately happy and would stay there again. You have to get your head around that ALL the accommodations has small bathrooms and rather trying to cramming a family in to one room, book 2 rooms, you can afford to at these rates and be happy. One of the best gym facilities I have seen. Pool was excellent for English standards.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Glenda S
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. It is the first hotel we have only stayed in for half an hour and left in disgust. It is nothing like the photos on the website. The room we were alloted was no better than a student flat and was very dirty. Toothpaste still in the basin, hair in bath and toilet, mold on walls. Disgusting, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “i had to add my positive views”
Reviews.Author: helend222222
Reviews.Content: I stay here often for business and feel awful reading some of the reviews. Yes they are undergoing renovations but they say that on the website. the nosie si between 9 and 5. The rooms are very small but so are they in most London hotels unless you pay a small fortune. they are rally clean and comfortable. the last time i stayed - July this year, they had a problem with my reservation but they upgraded me in minutes. i always recommend it. it is 2 minutes from the tube and i am always upset when they are full and i have to stay somewhere else! unless you have a lot of money to spend then London is very difficult. i stay away for business a lot and i like it here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanceWorld
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in London many times and always frequent the Kensington Close. However, as the years have gone on the rooms seem to have gotten smaller (probably due to the rennovations that are going on). What was once a standard room is now classified as an executive suite!!! Also, because of the refurb there was a lot of building work and loud noise going on but we were pre-warned about that so didn't mind too much. Other than that, I have no complpaints. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is decent enough and there's enough variety to satisfy most peoples tastes. Best of all the location is fantastic and so central to everything in London.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it here!”
Reviews.Author: 7734IJA
Reviews.Content: Maybe it is too late for my review but I had to write about this hotel. It seems most reviews were negative. We were there in July 2010, daughter, grandson and myself. We had a double room and a single room. At that time, they were in the beginning stages of remodeling but it didnt dampen our experience. Breakfast was great!! Wake up calls were on time! We had dinner one night in what I call the Sports bar....very delicious. Also, my daughter went there alone without a problem to view a World Cup soccer game. We liked being close to Tube stations and a dept store that exchanged $ to â‚¬ for us. My grandson loved the Muffin shop just up the street. There were also many different types of restaurants in the area. Would I stay there again??? Without a doubt!!!

Reviews.Title: “disinterested staff and hotel- avoid”
Reviews.Author: chris2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed on Tuesday 2nd August. When booking I wasn't told the hotel was undergoing renovation and the leisure facilities would be unavailable- one the of the main reasons for booking. The room itself was small and tired. Between checking in and leaving the next day one of my bags went missing, I informed reception who weren't interested and told me to speak to the concierge. He told me to speak to reception but after some pressing agreed to look into for me and I left my contact details for him to follow it up. Having heard nothing I emailed the hotel to follow it up but have heard nothing since (now almost 2 weeks since my last email). They obviously care very little for the hotel, their guests or their reputation as a theft free place to stay- aviod if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: chic_sailer
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid afternoon, obviously a big refurb going on, didnt effect our stay at all! Biggest complaint I had was the fact the clock was wrong in our room, meaning we got up and checked out an hour early.... wasnt very impressed at 9.30 on a sunday morning on holiday! But apart from that staff were friendly rooms well stocked with everything you need and very clean. Very close to a lovely Italian resturant (opposite prezzo's) and the Tube!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for location”
Reviews.Author: Rich_N16
Reviews.Content: The hotel has some major building work going on. If you are staying at the weekend, it won't have a major impact as work stops at 1pm on Saturday. Rooms are rather small. Two people plus luggage in a room can be tight. Wifi is ok, not lightening fast but it does work. Health centre is nice with a small pool, steam room, sauna and small gym. In my view, this hotel represents good value given the nice location just off Kensington High Street and close to the tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go”
Reviews.Author: RetfordNottsSpurry
Reviews.Content: Customer services appalling, on arrival was told room would be a few minutes actually one and half hours later we got our room. Was told we would have to pay Â£8 each to have a swim we have never had to pay to use hotel facilites so after contacting Trave Republic they gave us a concessionary pass. The rooms were very small the noise unreal there is building work everywhere on getting ready to go out I looked outside the window only to see a builder walk right past my view, we were on the fourth floor?!!!! Scaffolding everywhere.....The only thing that was actually any good was the breakfast but not enough to make up for a very poor hotel. My advice simply don't go!

Reviews.Title: “Shocking!!”
Reviews.Author: blockthetunnel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a number of times on business trips. This time will be the last This hotel is going through major building works with drilling starting at 8am and workman crossing walkways outside the room windows At the moment it is only suitable for people who have severe hearing loss, or those looking to become deaf. Don't bother ringing down to reception to complain - they won't be able to hear you over the noise!

Reviews.Title: “not the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: craftyAustralia
Reviews.Content: if we had known what was happening we would have stayed somewhere else we were only staying there because out European trip was starting from there . The room was so small you could hardly move and the jackhammers starting early in the morning we were glad to be going out. After a 24 hour flight we would have liked to have had a rest but couldn't. and the view out our window was of scaffolding. We would have liked to have been told about the renovations before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Average in everything”
Reviews.Author: Manos_LHR
Reviews.Content: To be honest I never intended to use this hotel but the city was overbooked due to a big event of some sort so this was the only hotel I could get a decent deal. I have seen the images and the fact that it had a spa made me book it. Service wise I didnâ€™t expect more than the hotel had to offer but I didnâ€™t even expect 2 fire alarms in one night. Actually they had a group of school children that have been smoking in their rooms and the fire alarm went off a couple of times. They evacuated all the hotel. People were out with their pjs, bare foot etc in a snowy night. After they have checked what the real cause of the trouble has been, the children went back in the rooms and the procedure was exactly the same. 3 hours of lost sleep after and before long days work!! Maybe the hotel should select better the groups they co-operate with. The concierge service was terrible but I canâ€™t really blame them as my stay was during the major tube strike of last year and the major snowfall that blocked London for 3 days so these poor people had to find a way to transport their guests in every corner of London. At some stage they just couldnâ€™t take this anymore. Maybe if front office and managers helped them a little they might have succeeded better in a crisis like that. One can say that all these are not management faults but I think they could do better both with the school kids and with helping customers find alternative means of transport during the strike and the snowfall. These guys couldnâ€™t help you find a single bus root! My hotel room was overlooking a new wing being built so from 1st light I could hear the construction workers chatting and whistling. The room is tiny and I was stumbling everywhere. I never used the so called spa, not too appealing to be honest. Internet charges was a joke in this hotel like in most London hotels. I would not visit again until after the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good.”
Reviews.Author: sischka
Reviews.Content: The location is quite good if you want to be somewhat close (15mins comfortable walk) to Earls Court Expo centre. And very close to the subway as well. You should be aware that this hotel has very many rooms and is frequently taken by travel agents booking for larger groups. So, be not surprised about long lines during check in/out etc. Also, there is significant construction going on right now. This might create some (more) noise and also the location (lobby hallways, elevators etc.) can not be used to its full extend. Just be aware. The rooms which are renovated are nice, but relatively small, which should be okay as long as you expect this. Beds are comfortable, bathroom all good. Despite of the number of guests every morning, they manage well to provide quite good breakfast (for UK standards). So, overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “undergoing rennovations, but a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the hotel while it was undergoing significant rennovations, but found the position and the staff were absolutely brilliant and made our holiday in London very successful. The rooms were well appointed. The position is just brilliant - within walking distance of all major needs,( high street shops, Marks and Spencers, tube etc) yet very peaceful and quiet. We will certainly return to this hotel when we visit London in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: pillola_2011
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Kensington close for years but this time I should really say it's not worth the money. I'm still in the hotel while I'n writing this review room 359. My window is broken and for the 1st time in my life no one have make up my roon even if I called them to point out that at my return in the hotel , late afternoon, no one have made up my room. I had to call them again at midnight and ask for towels as noone replace the wet towels.
