The hotel is under a massive renovation and we have been called out for a fire alarm and this happen quite regularly (staff saos 4 times last week). I'm sorry for all the staff that is doing his best but I don't accept to pay 130 pound for staying here with such a poor room service. If I want to make up my room I can choose for an apartment. Maybe after the renovation but not now. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: edgetrx33
Reviews.Content: All the positives were what to expect from any normal hotel. I will therefore list the short comings; 1) One of the two elevators from reception didn't work. Hence, the queue ends up being too long. Rather took the stairs 2) Only 4 tv channels. All of which had fuzzy picture and I ended up getting dizzy watching them 3) Pay TV didn't work (it just says 'please wait' on the TV set) 4) None of my devices (iPhone, iPdag and PC) could connect to the wifi (this is a joke!) 5) Room service food missing items that are indicated in the menu (e.g. hamburger with invisible onion rings, chocolate fudge cake with invisible cream). No explanation or excuse from staff 6) Wake up call at 6am despite not ordering one - aaaargh! 7) Key card stopped working halfway through my stay 8) Interior generally old and worn 9) The view from my room is to a wing under construction. Said wing smells like wet cement/wood when opening the window 10) Size of the room is very disappointing. I can only imagine how small the standard rooms must be Bottom line - there are a million better hotel deals in London. Not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but terrible shower”
Reviews.Author: onceayeartraveller
Reviews.Content: I joined a Cosmos tour at the Kensington Close Hotel. Good location, excellent English breakfast, average room. The shower didn't work, a maintenance man was called, he tightened something and showed us how to work the shower. Immediately he left, the shower didn't work. As we were only there one night, we didn't bother further and used the bath, but the mechanism to work the shower is the most peculiar one I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: safarijkts
Reviews.Content: This was my second solo stay in this hotel. It was booked at the last moment because it was available at a very good rate. My previous stay would not normally have lead to a second stay, but the late booking and the good rate swayed me. The rebuild was just beginning during my first stay last year, it is still ongoing and perhaps the hotel should have closed to achieve the rebuild faster, but I did not find the ongoing building to be a real disturbance. check in at 2pm was quick and simple, single rooms are naturally very small, but adequate. location is the key attraction for this hotel. Transport, local shops and restaurants are good. The rebuild so far has really transformed the public areas into a good standard, they were really quite shabby during my previous stay. There is clearly still lots of work to be done and staff generally still need to improve their customer services skills, but I was pleasantly surprised. If you get a good quote and just need a safe, clean place to sleep and rest during the day, which is near the centre, don't let the negative reviews put you off, too much.

Reviews.Title: “I'm still unsure as to what star rating this hotel actually is! If it is 4 star- it shouldn't be! The customer service is terrib”
Reviews.Author: carlawelsh
Reviews.Content: We were sold a short break here including either free breakfast or use of gym & pool. When we got there, the gym & pool were out of use. When we explained this, they would not let us swap for the free breakfasts & no-one would sort the problem out. The manager tried everything he could to avoid us but after constant nagging, on the second morning they finally gave in! Not very good customer service at all!

Reviews.Title: “surprised”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for the Ideal Home show at Earls Court, booked 3 rooms 2 doubles and a single. Got a really good rate for the hotel due to the major works that were being carried out in the property. The web site clearly stated about the work and also on booking in I was informed once again. The check in was slow and i was mindful of the no parking at the front of the hotel, you have to park in the hotel car park next door. expensive for parking but you think hey this is central London so you kind of expect it. The rooms were all slightly different, all had small bathrooms and tea and coffee making facilities, ample wardrobe space and a small TV. My room had a small fridge in which was handy. The bar was quite busy and drinks were reasonable i suppose for London, plenty of seating around the reception and lift areas I was very worried about staying at the hotel after reading bad reviews after booking, but I have to say i was surprised and did enjoy my stay. Yes there is work going on and that was evident in some of the corridors but I have to say it didnt effect us at all. I would however have been upset if i had not had the good rate and paid the usual price to stay at this hotel as pre work I imagine it was very over priced, but thats London for you!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Alandefra
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the KC for 2 nights at start of Sept. Have stayed here with work on a number of occasions (due to convenient location) and will probably do so again, but all is not currently well at the KC. As most reviewers mention there are a lot of major renovations currently going on. As such the hotel is in a bit of a mess, with the spa closed, breakfast taken in the old bar which is also being renovated, and some lifts not working. To make up for the inconvenience the hotel gave us free in room movies and free wi-fi access (although no code for the wi-fi and when we asked reception they didn't give us the correct info). The room was clean, but the bed was tiny and certainly didn't feel like a double. We only ate breakfast in the hotel and this was a mixed experience - my hot self-service full emglish was very average and Luke warm, whilst Jan loved the croissants! As I say, the hotel is not at it's best and given the renovations you would expect some disruption. I just think that the hotel management need to make a bit more effort to compensate for this or they run the risk of losing 'valued' customers such as myself to local, rival hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was everything that we needed in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Nicola I
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in a great location and fairly easy to find. In walking distance to Kensington Palace & Gardens which is definetely worth a visit. Tube station just a min or two up the road and near a busy high street with all the shops that you could possibly need. The room was satisfactory and the beds were comfy although I wouldn't pay the normal room rate as the hotel is at the moment (we paid a reduced rate due to the Spa being closed). It may be a lot better after the renovation. The staff were friendly & helpful but watch out for the added Â£50 deposit which gets added to your credit card when you get there although you do get this back if you behave yourself !!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, looks and is nothing like it's described”
Reviews.Author: j1mbojones94
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights are moving between properties. Price was key for us, but at Â£80-90 a night without breakfast it's not cheap Reception staff rude on arrival and we were made to wait. Extensive scaffolding which doesn't look like budging any time soon Rooms look like something out of the 1980s, lots if work going on inside that's uncovered/not signposted. Tiny TV and limited space, although clean Didn't eat breakfast as a complete rip off (Â£18) Everything about it was cheap and clearly catering for the foreign market with busloads of tourist coming in and out every morning Seriously reconsider if you're thinking about the Kensington Close-just read the other reviews for the heads up

Reviews.Title: “Good location but crowded”
Reviews.Author: PatrickChatou
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located near Hyde park and Harrods, but lacks charm and was crowded, we had to queue for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “HORREDOUS!”
Reviews.Author: n_bailey6
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel to it not looking its best as renovations were happening this was expected as I had seen it on the website. While waiting to be checked in we spoke to a woman whos reservation they had lost. We got in to our BOX rooms (they could only just fit the beds and the entrance to the room you could not open fully due to the fire door, neither could you open the wardrobe door properly) the rooms were filthy and had damp up the wall and we were on the 6th floor. The rooms had air conditioning although it was hit and miss whether it worked or not. Also the system for using the lights and airconditioning was awful! The bath was that discusting I didnt even want to shower in it let alone bathe. If this wasnt bad enough the staff are thieves!!!! I left some jewellery in the room when we went out on the saturday I returned to the room late that night to find it was no longer there and the only person who had access to the room was members of staff! When on the phone to a member of staff I was told because I had left it in the hotel room it was the hotel's property. I was appalled that this was the attitude they had! I will NEVER stay there again and make sure that nobody I know even considers staying there. It is cheap for a reason! The website looks fantastic but the hotel is the worst I have ever seen it does not deserve any of the four stars it supposedly has. The only positive is the beds were comfortable and warm.

Reviews.Title: “THIS "HOTEL" MUST BE CLOSED”
Reviews.Author: trodat
Reviews.Content: The kensington close must be closed as its name says. It is the worst hotel i've stay! It is absolutely unaccetable to stay in a "rest area" which looks (sounds and smells) like a buiding in demolition. How to sleep or relax with a non-stop vibration and noise of jack hammers overhead? How the city's official services gave the licence to make the works of reconstruction in such size and contemporaneously allow citizens to live in the building site? Why this hotel is open when the fire alarm and the evacuation which follows, is too frequent (almost every day)? Workers were just outside the windows on scaffolds and in the hallway outside the door of our tiny rooms! Wreckers move dangerous debris above our heads! The most disappointing was that the stuff (at all ranks) was uninterested, rude (with a tendesy to thievery). So, we spoke to a lawyer and now we gather evidence to make accusation against this hazardous "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Jackie297
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very disappointing. Room was so small you had to turn sideways to get past the end of the bed. The window was completely obliterated by scaffolding which considering the price of the room, would have expected some sort of warning. The reception was more like a hostel, the decor was dated and tatty. The bar/restaurant was dark and dingy with a holiday camp feel. Didn't even bother to have breakfast! The only thing good about it was the location!

Reviews.Title: “" TAKE A TAXI"”
Reviews.Author: MrMojo1966
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel during a bussinnes trip. I used the taxis that are always queuing on the rank outside the main door. When it was my time to check out the concierge asked me what my destination was and when I replied "heathrow" he then started saying I should order a car through him as Black Taxis are to the airport charge Â£70/80. Now on my travels in the week I had already asked a few cabbies for a rough estimate to the airport from my hotel and the all said around Â£45/50. I don't think it's good business for a hotel to use a 2nd class service just so the concierge can get a kick back from the mini cab driver,and who probably uses a sat nav to go around the corner. When they have professionally trained London Black taxis on there doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but good location”
Reviews.Author: turkeyjim11
Reviews.Content: After a 13 hour flight I didn't appreciate arriving to a room where the carpet was so threadbare there were holes in places and the bed linen wasn't much better. I received an upgrade upon complaining to management - but as far as 'upgrades' go, it was marginal. Basically the rooms were so cramped we struggled to get 2 suitcases into the room and be able to move in the remaining space. Ultimately very disappointing since this hotel cost us equivalent of NZ$250 per night! Upside: Exceptional breakfast, good central location, helpful staff and amazing indoor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel by default but wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jcr1954
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a couple of nights in London prior to joining a Cosmos tour of Europe. When we arrived at our hotel we were informed that "there was a problem" and they had booked us in a different hotel which turned out to be the Kensington Close Hotel. We were somewhat apprehensive at the switch, but were soon pleasantly surprised. The hotel was wonderful. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Breakfast was 5 star for us. it was centrally located and only two blocks from the Tube station. For someone that had never been to London before, the entire experience was a pleasant surprise!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Darren D
Reviews.Content: After my wife and i stayed her i would recommend that nobody books into this hotel. The rooms are tiny (6mtr x 3 mtr). No wi-fi in room as advertised and room was filthy. Read rooms had flatscreens with satellite but found only a portable with 4 stations.My wife and i couldn't pass each other in room. Complained to no avail after paying 100 pound for night. There are proper 4 star hotels close by without staying in this doghouse. MORE LIKE A 1 STAR, NOT A 4 STAR. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close is the right name”
Reviews.Author: delcher
Reviews.Content: Unless you like the world's smallest rooms and surly employees, find another hotel. Concierge no help with dinner reservations at a restaurant practically around the corner. Claimed he couldn't find it in the phone book and had never heard of it! Had a larger room on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: audreytime
Reviews.Content: Check-in time is 2pm. We arrived at 3pm to learn that our room, booked weeks in advance, was not ready. Say no more...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Linny81
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel expecting the worse after reading reviews on here. As this was a package deal we knew we couldn't swap. We paid 30 pounds to upgrade and was surprised at how good and friendly the staff were breakfast was full of choice from full English to continental nothing ever ran out and all looked very fresh. Our room was spacious and decorated in burgundy and White. However the bathroom was a liitle tired looking but it was clean and well equipped with towels and toiletries. I was expecting a poor and dirty hotel but it wasnt the building work could be heard but the builders were courteous and soon stopped at 5 and started again and 8 ish. The location is fab a 2 miniute walk to the tube and 5 min to Kensington Gardens. I'm sure after all the refurbishments has finished it will be great and this visit has not put me of.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service , damp room, badly managed, AVOID THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MikeandTone
Reviews.Content: My colleague and i shared a twin room and we took an adult with learning difficulties who was booked into a single, we specifically asked for the rooms to be close together to minimize risk and distress before booking. After 4 hours travelling we arrived and was given our keys to the rooms but noticed they wasn't anywhere near each other, so asked if this could be rectified, they just said NO, my client was extremely distressed and frightened due to being in a strange place, they didn't care. The room my colleague and I stayed in (511) smelt damp and upon inspection noticed damp all over one of the walls, near TV and dressing table, bathroom was filthy. We asked staff in the restaurant not take service charges off our client as she has learning disabilities and her money needs to be accounted for, and it could be seen as taking advantage as she has little concept of money, time and time again this was ignored. My client was looking forward to using the gym, when we enquired about the opening times they told us it was closed for the next 6 weeks, at no point was that mentioned when we originally booked the room, my client was even more upset. I have supported many clients on breaks away both in the uk and abroad and have never experienced such poor quality, standards and customer care. I went to put in a complaint before we checked out yesterday and was told by the manager no complaint forms as we receive too many complaints, asked him for something in writing to prove I'd made a complaint, he refused and told me to follow the complaints link on the hotels website.... there isn't one. I emailed them hours ago and they still haven't bothered to reply. I have children and was going to bring them to London we will definitely not be staying here. I see no reason why it's rated 4* I've stayed in better with lower star ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Just say no”
Reviews.Author: peiterry
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. We were in room 142 and immediately next to us there was major construction. The room was shaking and we couldn't even hear each other to talk. It did stop at 5PM. It restarted at 8am even though the front desk staff said it would not start until 9am. We asked to change rooms and they said we would have to pay 30 pounds to upgrade as no standard rooms were available. Our toilet did not work and we had to use the one in the lobby. Rdidiculous! We asked twice for it to be fixed and no on showed up. I asked a lady in the hallway who seemed pretty high up in the management chain - she was overseeing the construction workers - and when I asked to move rooms she asked why. I pointed to the noisy construction right in front of us. The whole thing was like a comedy show or something. Couldn't believe we were being treated this way. We even videotaped the noise in our room. The entire hotel is under construction and is clad in scaffolding. The staff are dismissive, rude and uncaring. Jay at front desk in the only kind, sensible person we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: nothappyjan011
Reviews.Content: Faulty Towers!!!! Toiletries from a previous guest left in the room, a strip from a female product left on the floor, the toilet cubicle 50 cms wide obviously only suitable tiny guests the bathroom above leaking on bed. The only good thing about the Kensington close is it's location

Reviews.Title: “One thing after another!”
Reviews.Author: prmj_86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week long trip in London. It was our first time in the UK and we were very excited! I had read the reviews of the hotel before leaving for our trip and was a little skeptical. When we first got there (around noon), we were in line at reception to check in with 4 other guests ahead of us. There was only 1 staff at the desk, with other staff going in and out of the back. It didn't occur to any of them, to help shorten the line and service the guests. 1 customer ahead of me was complaining about the construction of the hotel and that he upset that the website didn't indicate that the hotel was under construction. He would have chosen a different hotel for this reason, 1 customer was complaining about the size of the room and 1 customer was complaining about how he had paid for a double bed and was given a single bed. The response from the desk staff was that he was given a single bed because he was the only one staying in the room. I turned to my husband and told him not to expect too much from this hotel. We finally checked in (after 20 minutes of waiting in line) and went up to our room. It was a fairly small room, but that didn't bother us because we knew we weren't going to be spending much time in there. The room reminded me of a college dorm. Very small and simple. We quickly realized that the AC wasn't working and knew that we wanted to switch rooms. The weather was very hot oustide and we wanted to be able to have a good night sleep without waking up in full sweat. We didn't want to open our windows since construction was going on right outside and anyone would have been able to climb into the window. I went downstairs and told the staff member that I wanted to switch rooms and that I expected that they meet our request since we were staying for a week. I was told that they were fully booked, but that we would switch the next day after somone checked out. They told us to have our luggage packed and that they would move them to our room the next day when we were out sightseeing. The next day when we got our new room keys, I asked them if our luggage had been brought to our room and we were told that it had been. Needless to say, we were disappointed to find out that they were not in our room when we got there. I was upset and my husband called down to have them bring us our luggage. When the staff member came to our room with our luggage, he didn't knock at the door. He just opened it with a master key and walked right in. Not professional at all! We were very happy to learn that the AC worked in this room. The room was even smaller than the first one (our room on our cruise was even bigger), but it didn't bother us. What bothered us was that the toilet didn't flush. You would flush it once - nothing would go down. You would then have to wait for 10 minutes before flushing again before it to actually work. We had to do this everytime we went to the washroom. It was ridiculous!! At this point, I just didn't care anymore. We didn't want to ask to switch to a third room because we assumed that there would be something wrong with that room too and we just didn't have the patience anymore. We found a hotel nearby and used the toilets there at the end of each day before coming back to our hotel. After breakast, we would used the washroom on the main floor before heading out for the day. The next day after sightseeing when we got back to the room, my husband and I were upset to learn that the housekeeper left our windows open and our curtains wide open, We were not happy about this! Construction workers were working outside and could easily see into our room. If they liked something they saw, they could easily make there way in. I had to leave a note every morning to housekeeping asking them to not open anything when we were not in there. The spa in the hotel are only for sepcific guests. - depending on how much you paid for your room. Many groups stay at this hotel. I can see why! Great location! Shopping and tube station are just steps away! Breakfast was fine, Typical continental breakfast - both hot and cold foods. Other then the hotel being in a good location, this hotel had nothing to offer. It's worth spending more money to stay at a differen hotelt. It's just not worth saving a few bucks on this hotel. Too many headaches!

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay here, I don't understand all of these terrible reviews?”
Reviews.Author: JJ20000
Reviews.Content: My partner & myself fancied ourselves a long weekend away in London. We came across this hotel, for a very good price (we are a young couple, so this was important) and a convienient location for us (We wanted to shop, visit the London Dungeons, eat out etc). So we booked up for 3 nights- English breakfast included. We read the reviews AFTER booking, and in all honestly, we were very worried! The impression given was that the hotel was filthy, the staff were unhelpful and the main website was mis-leading. We found NONE of these to be true. Yes, the website shows of it's finest rooms available, and ours was not exactly luxury, but it served the purpose we were looking & paid for! THE ROOM- The room was clean, the bathroom was great (nice shower, spacious), and the room was not a bad size for central London accomodation. I'd say one improvement that could be made is the TV size & quality- In fairness, we weren't in much, but the one night we wanted to stay in and watch one of their many available films, we were slightly put off due to the TV size. The bed was also quite small, maybe my partner being 6 ft 4 didn't help matters, but otherwise it was comfortable. Renovations were happening throughout the hotel, which we were advised of prior to booking. They didn't effect us. THE SERVICE- The service was absolutely fine. Everyone that we encountered was very friendly, and happy to answer any queries. THE LOCATION- Right next to Kensington High Street tube! Very handy, although this tube station was shut for 2 days whilst we were staying due to engineering work. We had to walk around a mile to get to the next tube station at Gloucester Road. We managed to visit Picadilly Circus, Oxford Street & Tower Bridge over our stay, and it was easy to reach these destinations on the tube. FOOD- We didn't have a chance to eat at the hotel in the evening, however we ate breakfast every morning. There was a large selection of food, suitable for all. A full english cooked breakfast, which you helped yourself to. Cereal, fruit, yogurt, fruit juices, toast, croissants etc. All of the food we tried was lovely, the cooked breakfast was made to serve a large scale, so maybe not quite as tasty as a homemade breakfast, but more than acceptable. We can't comment on the leisure/spa side to the hotel as we didn't experience either of the things. Hopefully this review was helpful to you, don't be put off with the overally bad reviews, we had a great stay. It sounds as if the hotel is to only get better, due to the renovations. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: denwat
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review whilst still at this hotel, what's wrong with the people that give this place such a negative view. The room which I am staying in is plenty big enough for 2 people yes it does look a bit tiresome but not enough for me to be negative about, bathroom good has a bath and a shower(yes over the bath but good all the same). Renovations ongoing but no noise on a Sunday as it's the builders day off but surely If you are in London your not going to sit in your hotel all day so the noise is usually done and dusted by 5pm. My husband and I got the room for Â£90 a night which includes breakfast(Â£15.53)rooms cleaned daily except for today I think (Sunday) which in my opinion is value for money. This is the second time I've stayed here and would definitely use this hotel again whilst visiting London, tube station is a 2min walk,plenty buses to use also and if you get a travel pass you can choose any mode of transport. So unless you are wanting to stay at the Ritz this is a good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel unless you are desperate”
Reviews.Author: knob18
Reviews.Content: How this hotel got any stars amazes me .The staff on the whole are rude the rooms are tiny and old the beds are uncomfortable. It is undergoing renovations the jack hammers go from 8.30am to 4.00pm. It has few facilities and the wifi only works in few areas not including you room and is costly. To call it a dump is an understatement

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a student group”
Reviews.Author: ikkiLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: We went there with a group of students and the hotel managed to have 28 teenagers and 3 adults satisfied. The rooms were ok, they made us a group discount, the hotel is situated in a quiet street , just around the corner of an underground station. There are shops and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel staff was very friendly and very helpful. The rooms are a bit small, but clean. Breakfast is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you!”
Reviews.Author: vitttoria
Reviews.Content: How strange! Just a few hours after my complaints to the hotel manager and after my suggestion to think over all these bad reviews about the way this hotel is managed... there comes the good reviews! Wow. Sense of timing. This dodge won't help you, people! This hotel is dirty and smelly. Go somewhere else if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I can't understand the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: keithloon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a great location, only two min walk from the tube. The staff have been first class, lots of them ay breakfast and in the sports bar. The rooms are small buy they are very clean. I am amazed other reviews complain about the room size, if your on holiday surely you don't want to sit in tour room?????? We only used the hotel to sleep in and to have breakfast. We did eat in the sports bar one evening and it was lovely. Yes there is construction work, but as we were out seeing London we didn't have a problem. If you want hotel facilities and too stay in your room, go and book elsewhere, and pay more. Don't worry about this hotel, its great.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Tennessee
Reviews.Title: “A nightmare of a stay...website misleading and rude rude staff..dont stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: mzshire2009
Reviews.Content: I lost my husband and father within 5 days of eachother last November and this was a trip that was to help me. I stayed here for luckily only a few days instead of 2 weeks like I did on Athens. This hotel website was VERY misleading... the pic's show what it is going to look like after the renovation is done but they dont tell you that. My 1st room looked into the addition, so absolutly there was no light coming into the room, the toilet would not flush. I request to be moved to a different room and the staff was very rude. I have been in customer service for years and I also work in the hotel industry. They need some training on customer service. There was a fire alarm that sounded and we went down the stairs (we were on the 6th floor) only to find a backup of people at the 2nd floor. Someone from the hotel informed up false alarm and to go back to our rooms. We did and the alarms kept going on and off, we figured it was the construction that trip an alarm by accident. We kept looking in the hallway to see if others were leaving and they were not. Come to find out my friends that were on the 1st floor were outside with all the staff, about 50 employees waiting for an all clear from the fire department. My friends told an employee that they knew for a fact that not everyone was out because the mother and I were still up in the room because of an employee said to go back. That evening we decided not to go out for dinner since the weather was bad. We had dinner in the restaurant which was on the 1st floor. due to the water leak (that is what caused the fire alarm,the pool area and spa were flooded) we ahd to enter the restaurant from the back stairs. They have to hanidcap access as we seen an elderly woman almost passout after coming down the stairs, she apparently had a medical condition because of the oxygen tank she was having to carry/ tote around with her. I thought the poor woman was going to collapse. Her niece came down the following morning to get her aunt some breakfast. The woman was not able to make it down the stairs again. This is not a handicapp friendly hotel what so ever. The cleaniness of the room was terrible. Shower rod was about to fall, I secured rod and was careful after that. Room had a musky smell and was extremly small and dirty. The TV only got 5 channels. The breakfast was the only thing good about this hotel. I have been telling everyone I know not to consider even staying here, not even if the room were free.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kytana1
Reviews.Content: Four 'girls', no husbands, no kids, and what do we get..... Only one room, (we booked Oct 2010) no apology, beds so close one person can stand the other one had 2 be on the bed or in the bathroom, wanted credit card details but there was no mini bar! Rooms were tiny....with a capital T, renovations........don't go there....doesn't deserve a 2 let alone a 4!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS ONE - Absolutely appalling rip off merchants!!!”
Reviews.Author: Portsmouthmummy
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs. The staff are appalling, the manager denies the fact that they have charged me twice for the room and we have now had to put this through the fraud squad at my bank. The rooms are tiny, not sure where the word "luxury" comes into it and having to flush a toilet that someone has used and hasn't been cleaned is slightly awful in my opinion. Avoid at all costs and stay at the much nicer Premier Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Hell”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromusa30
Reviews.Content: RUN AWAY! Even if you've already paid!!! Under renovation. Jackhammers. Toilet doesn't flush. Can't check in until 2 pm after having been on an overnight flight from the US. We arrived at 6 am and had to walk around the city until 2 pm. Jetlagged and in need of refreshment, we tried to relax but the hammering and drilling not only kept us awake, but gave us a significant headache. I asked the front desk if this was some sort of joke. They said they knew that they really shouldn't be open during the renovations. Sorry about that, but there's nothing we can do...

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: candiegirl06
Reviews.Content: I stayed here having booked through LMDC paying Â£360 for 2 nights standard room, on arrival I asked to upgrade to Executive as I was staying 2 nights. I was expecting fluffy robes and towels, and nice toiletries for the expected Â£30 per night upgrade I was very disappointed it was in my view very basic, and the good budget hotels fulfil all that this hotel offered on a standard room rate. What irrated me more was a call from the duty manager who argued that executive offerings to travellers varied, and was subjective , but I have been a business traveller throughout the UK and Europe for over 20yrs and nowhere have I been asked to pay Â£30 for such a poor upgrade, he did relent and waive the charge, however had I not pre-paid this trip I would have looked for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking hotel, never stay here”
Reviews.Author: Amyhut1
Reviews.Content: From my personal excperience at this hotel, i can honestly say i t is truely awful. My mum and i had come up to london for the weekend, it was a treat for me to celebrate my exams being over, my mum wanted to make it amazing for me. So when we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with shoddy carpets and an unwelcoming reception environment, we had delibratly booked a twin room and on our arrival we were given the keys and we went up to our room, only to find we had been given a double room, so we went down and complained and we were moved to the 7th floor to their last available twin room, which smelt of damp and was considerably smaller than the room we had had before, we did not want to complain again, so we left it however whilst us being in that room a fan or something was leaking and was completly covering shelves in water so that my mums make up bag got soaked, also leading to wet patches in the actual room, we were not about to stay in a place like that so my mum went down and complained, but we were due somewhere in 10 minutes and they decided to move us again, (they also claimed that all the rooms have been checked and there is no way that room had been checked) we were finally moved to our 3rd room, which is still a double room and the toilet you can't have eaten alot if you want to go or yyou may get stuck! Finally the tv only had 5 free channels, an overpriced room and totally terrible, avoid the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mad212011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of July and after reading the reviews I was really apprehensive about staying here. But I was really pleasantly surprised. No hassle getting checked in and although the rooms were pretty small you have to remember it's a city hotel and really all you need is a bed and clean bathroom. For two nights it was perfect, we were up around 8 anyway and out of the room by 9 and not back until 11.30 at night so the building work had no effect on us at all. Staff were helpful enough, offering us complementary use of the gym and pool due to the renovations, and our room was tidy and clean and the beds comfy. Also it's in the perfect location 2 minutes from the tube station so no time wasting in getting about. We had a brilliant time and would definitely be back. I can't believe the complaints on here about this hotel; maybe I speak for myself, but all I wanted was a bed for the night and certainly wasn't spending the day in the room!!! Who comes to London to relax in their room anyway?! I would ignore all the complaints as we didn't have a single one!

Reviews.Title: “A Definite Miss - avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: HelenP12
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Kensington Close Hotel was the antithesis of what we expected â€“ it turned out to be a truly unpleasant experience. Firstly, the internet advertisement is completely false to what one encounters at this hotel. We were shocked by the appearance of the shoddy entrance and dirty carpeting in the foyer. The internet site claims that renovations are taking place in SOME areas of the hotel, whereas, the ENTIRE hotel is surrounded by scaffolding, in reality. The noise during renovation hours is unbearable and the drilling causes reverberating shudders in the reception area. There are NO GARDENS visible anywhere around the hotel so donâ€™t let the internet pictures of lush gardens lure you. The breakfast area is dull and dark; the reception is dilapidated; carpets and public toilets are dirty and the overall corridor looks nothing like the advert on the internet. Our room did not resemble the internet room AT ALL and we were forced to upgrade to a bearable room, at an additional fee of 300 pounds! Thus, we ended up paying 200 pounds per night â€“ certainly not worthy of this hotel. The upgraded room had minimal cupboard space and there are no drawers to place t-shirts in. Thus, we were forced to â€˜live our of our suitcasesâ€™ for an entire week! In the middle of our stay we were unable to sleep for two nights due to noisy guests. Security could not control the noise and they were smoking in their rooms and corridors the entire evening. So the hotelâ€™s claim of being a non-smoking hotel is also fictitious. When we questioned the staff about the discrepancy between the internet pictures and the disheartening reality, they claimed that this is what the hotel USED TO look like.... I found this false advertising preposterous in today's internet age and I seriously recommend that you DO NOT BOOK to go to this hotel. Overall, a big disappointment. The reception was filled with complaining guests and one had to queue up for at least 20 to 30 minutes in order to ask a simple question. I guess they were short-staffed too. We met other complaining guests from as far abroad as Australia, on a daily basis. One gentleman told the manager that â€˜the hotel should pay people to stay there!â€™ A DEFINITE NO and a definite waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: sftravelangel
Reviews.Content: this hotel was AWFUL. talk about false advertising. the website shows the hotel already renovated. the carpet was peeling away from the wall. there was literally a pile of dust under the window and the curtains were full of visable dust. not to mention, the bedsprings didn't always pop back into place. while they did disclose that the hotel was under construction that usually means some part of the hotel where they do not have guests is under construction. we awoke to the sound of pounding and drilling in the room next door to us. the noise was unbearable. when we went to the lobby to complain and try to change rooms they were not the least bit helpful. the woman stated that all the rooms are the same and she could not let us change rooms. there was absolutely no customer service available. upon more than one occasion we walked into the lobby to a long line of guests and about 1 or 2 employees at the desk assisting them. meanwhile about 3 more employees standing around talking. on top of it all, on two occasions when i inquired about the underground or tours the so-called concierge said " i don't know" and offered no further help. based on customer service alone, even if this hotel was already fully renovated, i would highly advise people to stay elsewhere. the travelodge was a 5 star compared to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe it will be better once the rebuild is completed”
Reviews.Author: NodrogSouthAustralia
Reviews.Content: I wish we had fully understood what the hotel meant by "refurbishment". This is a full on building site, complete with all of the noise, dust and disruption that you could possibly muster. It was simply terrible! This is no "4 Star" hotel at the moment, and several areas of the hotel are not really inhabitable.The rooms do not correspond with the official website, and it is a miracle that the Office of Fair Trading in London allows them to get away with it. How we envy other Tripadvisor contributors who were actually able to walk around the edge of the bed, and had a view better than ours ( see photo attached). On a positive note, the hotel responded well to my complaints. I will let readers know how it is after the refurb is completed early next year. In the meantime, it might be best to simply stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place, don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: BlumeSingapore
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the most horrible places I have ever stayed at. Surprisingly they are completely renovating the outside of the hotel, although the inside is falling apart. I would tear down the whole place. Apart from the lovely GM, who helped me to find a clean room and helped me to relocate to another floor, the hotel is dirty, noisy, overcrowded, rooms are particularly small, bathrooms are even smaller and $$$. Don't go!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Tidy (but also very small)”
Reviews.Author: 10AKA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and tidy but we were shocked by the size of the rooms. So small with just walking space in between the beds. Facilities at the hotel were good such as bar and restaurant. However the hotel was let down by rude and inexperienced staff. Couldnâ€™t get advice about tours, buses etc from anyone and when someone finally did help up they gave us the wrong information which meant we were left standing at a tour stop waiting for a bus that never arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Brutal service, tiny rooms, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: johnug
Reviews.Content: We knew the hotel was under renovation, but that was only part of the problem. We settled into our room and went to bed, only to be woken up by someone trying to get in. The next morning we learned that we should not have been assigned to that room and were provided another one. We grabbed our bags and went to the new room. As we entered, a woman from inside yelled "whose there?". Back to the front desk. We were led to a third room, an "upgrade" to compensate for the inconveniences. It was a better room, but the bathroom fan was very noisy and would not shut off. We were told not to worry, it would be repaired. It wasn't. The second day I received an email guest questionnaire asking for our feedback. I quickly filled it out and sent it off (twice), only to have it returned "need password and user name filled in". Of course there was no request for that information. I then sent my complaints to the email address on the website. No response, of course. Finally, the rooms are tiny, the hotel is overpriced, and the internet service was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Suethe186400
Reviews.Content: I was happy with my stay. All the staff were polite and helpful. My room was small, but most hotel rooms in London are small, and this did not bother me, especially as only staying 1 night. I enjoyed the swimming pool and had a good stay with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “good staff”
Reviews.Author: bigruss55
Reviews.Content: Very busy hotel. Clean rooms we were pleasantly surprised. Check-in the staffs were very polite and helpful. After reading about the tiny rooms, I was quite interested about what the room would look like, so it was a surprise to find a reasonably sized room , it was perfectly suitable for our time in London, the Hotel is located very close to the Kensington High Train station making it easy to travel in any direction. Service is very good, a great selection available at breakfast, extremely friendly staff, who were only too happy to answer any queries, We would recommend it to any travellers who are spending time in London. We got up at 7.30 so the work on the hotel did not mater. We were out all day. Yes this hotel is not the Hilton but you are not paying the same prices.

Reviews.Title: “BUILDING SITE CHEEK TO CALL ITSELF A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Glenbea
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 1 night on 4th July 2011. As soon as we arrived and saw all the scaffolding surrounding the building our hearts sank, this was not what we were expecting - we were looking at a building site. Once we stepped in the foyer it got worse, the sound of pnumatic drills and men walking around in hard hats. The receptionists were all dealing guests moaning about their accommodation/rooms etc, The receptionist said we could have free wi-fi and free access to the spa because of any inconvenience caused due to the renovation works. The room we were given (756) was meant to be a Double with 2 single beds only the space between the beds was wide enough to put one finger between. The room was sooooooo small the smallest room I have ever encountered and the air conditioning did not work. When we went to the spa the staff memeber tried to take Â£8.00 each of us and did not believe our explanation that the receptionist has advised we could have free admission. We actually commented it was the first hotel we had stayed at where a fee to use the pool and gym was enforced. When we checked out we complained profusely to the manager (Andre Huefner) who advised we could have a room upgrade to a Club room the next time we visited and that he would email us to confirm this would happen as a gesture of goodwill for our unhappy experience. We have not received an email as yet. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone whilst the building work is being carried out, the management should have done the decent thing and closed the hotel instead of ripping people off staying open. A real unhappy experience - and not cheap either!

Reviews.Title: “Frightful!”
Reviews.Author: Desperata
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems good value on its website but in fact it is the sort of place where foreign coach parties stay. We did not hear one English voice, not even among the staff. When we arrived I asked one of the men standing around if I could get a glass of water and he just said "no"! The hotel is being refurbished and the builders start at 8.00 so if you want a lie in - forget it. THe whole place smells of building work and unwashed people. Yeugh. The cooked breakfast is a disgrace. Heaven knows what all these continentals think of our "great English Breakfast". The plastic keys to get you into your room don't work properly. Would we go back? Rather have a night in Strangeways Prison.

Reviews.Title: “Very good considering the ongoing refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: krammlbs
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I was not looking forward to staying here after reading the reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised. Check-in did seem to take a while, however the staff were very polite and helpful. After reading about the tiny rooms, I was quite intrigued about what the room would look like, so it was a surprise to find a reasonably sized room - yes it wasn't huge, or even big, but for a one night stay in London it was adequate. There was plenty of space to walk around the bed and to put bags. There was a wardrobe with plenty of space, and a desk with chair and mirror. The bathroom was compact but everything was clean and tidy and the big mirror was nice over the sink. The only major down-side to the room was the length of the bed, it was certainly too short for my 6'4" boyfriend, and was almost too short for me at only 5'9" The other disappointment was the view from the window - the back of the hotel and scaffolding, but as it was the hottest weekend of the year we spent all daylight hours outside so there was little impact of this. The breakfast was served in the Sports Bar as the restaurant is undergoing refurbishment. It was an interesting experience; a bit dark and with music channels on the TVs, it didn't create an atmosphere which encouraged you to linger over your meal. Another small thing was the lack of bread options - sliced for toasting or croissants - no bread rolls. Thought the small pastries were very tasty! Overall the hotel is in need of a refurb and it will be interesting to see it afterwards. I think if you go in prepared to see the scaffolding and the areas that are awaiting a paint or new carpets, then you won't be disappointed with your stay. I would say give this hotel a chance - they are doing very well considering.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A JOKE”
Reviews.Author: kipper56
Reviews.Content: Lock didnt work had to get maintenance man to relocate lock,drains were blocked couldnt have a shower,moved to another room but key cards didnt work so could not get in.Got dizzy from going up and down in the lift to reception.Sounded like they were knocking the place down after 8oclock in the morning,not a bad idea actually.They had the cheek to leave do not disturb cards on the door knobs they should have left ear defenders on them instead.Dont go there,not when theres park benches available,

Reviews.Title: “Staff stole my iPad - worst hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Maldini2706
Reviews.Content: This place is without a doubt the worst I've stayed in and to top it all off the staff stole my iPad. Others have mentioned the renovations, they were disruptive, but when you see the state of the hotel you can understand why they are trying to do the place up. Our twin room was miniscule (10ft x8ft) with a pungent smell of damp and the bathroom was claustrophobically small. After we checked out I realised I left my passport and iPad in the room, the staff were able to return my passport but said there was no iPad in the room which is complete rubbish. The manager couldn't have been less helpful, he basically told me there was nothing he could do about it, that the staff are very thorough and they contact him with anything they find. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: zoe_hollis
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed at the standard of this hotel. Advertised as a 4 star, I booked a twin room. The room was very small, very basic (I've stayed in better budget hotels!), old and tired with paper thin walls. The service was poor when I arrived to check in. I waited 30 minutes while watching numerous members of staffing walking past the growing queue and ignoring us. Sorry - but not impressed!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathleenG20
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms we stayed in in this Hotel were not very big, they were perfectly suitable for our time in London , the Hotel is located very close to the Kensington High Train station making it easy to travel in any direction. service is very good, a great selection available at breakfast, extremely friendly staff, who were only too happy to answer any queries, and to suggest places to dine. We would recomend it to any travellers who are spending time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Staggeringly awful hotel, you couldn't make this stuff up.”
Reviews.Author: DrillerKiller
Reviews.Content: First off, the bed was comfy, the breakfast good and the location great. The positives stop there, unfortunately. I'd been warned about the building work and that I'd been "upgraded" to an executive room. The hotel's interpretation of an executive is clearly someone who enjoys all the same sorry, dated, furniture and decor from the 1970's the other rooms have, but in bigger surroundings. Terribly tatty, stained carpets, shower mould and peeling paint. Windows that opened directly onto the ubiquitous scaffolding outside. Corridors where the carpets are held together with gaffer tape and rain poured through the ceiling when the storms came earlier in the week. They're taking actual money from people for this, remember! The safe in the room didn't work. The TV provides five (that's a whole five!!) channels, three of which have poor reception and one, solitary radio channel that's anything close to being tuned in. The shower in my room didn't work. When it did, it was cold. There was often not even any hot water available from the taps, so my morning routine of a wash at the sink with cold water isn't one I'll miss anytime soon. Complaints about the faulty shower were never really resolved, although it was suggested I come downstairs with my toiletries and use the showers in the gym. Well that's alright then. On to the building work. Whoever took the decision to let the rooms on the 7th floor when the building work was going on directly above should be sacked at best. The drilling began every morning just after 8am, and by drilling, I'm not talking your average Black & Decker hand-drill putting up some shelves. This was large, pneumatic drilling, working on what sounded like concrete floors and walls. On more than one occasion, this was DIRECTLY above my room. Every fixture and fitting in the room was shaking from the vibrations - the noise was way above anything even remotely acceptable by health and safety standards; it was genuinely deafening. Complaints were met with 'we're having building work done, it was advertised and we can't move you as the hotel is full'. I recorded the worst of the noise and shared it with astonished colleagues later that day. I'm struggling to put into words just how awful this hotel is. It's amazing that they should be allowed to stay open while such major, disruptive work is being carried out, but I guess money talks.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers. Worst hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: JacquiF82
Reviews.Content: How this hotel has four stars is beyond me. From the moment we arrived we were treated appallingly. Firstly, the hotel was undergoing renovations. It should have been shut down and I'm sure if the authorities knew what was going on it would have been. We were forced to walk between ladders with plastic on the hallway floor and wires hanging down from the roof, we had to walk around the builders just to get to our room. At 8am the first morning we were there they started pulling the doors off the rooms next to ours and then drilling new doors on. We were given a disabled room, even though we didn't need one, and the shower had little doors on it to stop a wheelchair from rolling out. Every time we showered the whole bathroom flooded! The worst part was the room was on a floor where the builders had set up a cement mixer on a platform right outside our window! The curtains didn't close properly and the builders could see right in! We asked to be moved to another room. This new room was tiny and the wifi didnt work. I asked when it would b fixed and was rudely told "I dont know". We asked for a wakeup call- it never came. I ordered room service and an iron- both went to the wrong room. But the worst thing about this hotel is the staff. They are rude, obnoxious and literally rolled their eyes at us when we had a problem. At one point the manager glared at me and said "oh now I remember you". Every time we returned for the day the electronic key wouldn't work in the lock. Once it took three trips to reception for the staff to put the code in right! This is truly the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. One more tip- the rooms look nothing like the pictures on the website. Disgusting. And dangerous- don't ever stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired but...!”
Reviews.Author: GHNBillund-Danmark
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is undergoing a huge refurbishment - we had a great time! The noise from the refurbishment was in the daytime when we were away from the hotel. The hotel staff is very serviceminded. Nice but small twin room. Good housekeeping. Hope the Sportsbar will continue and will be part of the refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Sammyas
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here on a business trip, I will not be visiting ever again. Wouldn't recommend. After the chaotic 40 minutes queuing to check in, where 3 reception staff seemed clueless. I then had to come back down three times as my key card didn't work. The bedrooms were tiny, with no room to walk round the bed, also very little storage space. Views out of the windows were scaffolds due to the renovation work. Which started at 8am.. There was only one resturant open out of the advertised 3. ( again due to refurbishment) Which was a dark dingy sports bar.

Reviews.Title: “2 star not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: creepycrawley2001
Reviews.Content: Hi stayed here recently expecting 4 star luxuary. Was extremly upset to find the hotel to be in a very poor state and also in the middle of re-furbishments. Rooms are tiny and even though our room appeared to have been recently decorated, the bathroom was extremely dated and dirty. Would definatly not recommend anybody stay here.. book at your own peril!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: r0bjm
Reviews.Content: I am *currently* staying in this hotel - 4* it certainly isn't. The place is old, worn, and well past its prime. The room I'm in is small, smelly, the bathroom has mould in it, and there's no way I'm going to sleep a wink in the bed tonight. Like others who have reviewed this place, I've paid substantially less for a far better standard of room. Steer well clear!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Liwilhelmson
Reviews.Content: An absolute disgrace. Me and my mum went to London for a shopping trip over 4 days and this hotel totally ruined our holiday. I have stayed in better places for Â£12 a night. The rooms were moldy and smelly and the beds must have been from the 17th century and so uncomfortable that I slept on the floor for the entire stay. I so wished we would've changed hotels the first day. Don't come here!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of four stars - a very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: SGr4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel. On the surface it looked like a very good deal for a four star hotel, but beware....The hotel is NOT worthy of a four star rating and there is no way the saving from rack rate (as presented on the website) is real. They could not charge the rate they say is their usual given the appalling state of the place, The bedroom on the website bore no resemblance to the one we stayed in, which was cramped and shabby, and I have experienced far superior facilities (TV, tea and coffee tray) in a two star hotel. We could not access the inclusive internet service, were given wrong information about blockbuster films being included, had an over bath shower that leaked despite the curtain being correctly positioned, and after one look at the 'spa' would not enter the facility. It took five attempts at breakfast to get a member of staff to produce a pot of tea. We complained afterwards and were offered a return where we would get a complimentary upgrade - I can honestly say I would not use this hotel again, even if the room was offered free. The excuse for everything is about the hotel undergoing refurbishment - a total red herring. This was about shabbiness, with a lack of attention to basic comfort, and staff who have clearly had so many complaints they no longer see a need or benefit in responding. Don't stay there!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, average location, would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: cls501
Reviews.Content: On the hotel webiste it states that the rooms are cosy, which implies small and that that it is currently undergoing renovations so we were warned but we didn't think it would be to such an extreme. Upon enterting our very very small (but clean) room we found that the view from our window was into the shell of another unbuilt room! You couldn't even tell what the weather was like outside and it was not only our room that was like this. Curtains also had to be kept closed for fear of builders looking in. Location wise the hotel was near to a tube station but the journey felt quite far away from the major central sites. There were far too many rooms crammed into a small space in this hotel and they're trying to put in more! As we were on a room only basis its hard to comment much on the service except that when struggling in with large bags we were not helped by the concierge who chose to watch despite our cab driver trying to signal him to get him to help us! Overall i think better value and more space can be found elsewhere, not on a building site, the Kensington close is a disappointing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Rigobluenose
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on a Saturday and Sunday evening. Staying with a 5 week old baby was never going to be easy however the room size didn't help! We had to turn furniture on its end just to open the room door fully!! The rooms are the sixe you expect in New York however clean and modern. Without a cot it was small and with it there was no floor space to stand at all. The hotel was very busy with International coach trips and reception was always busy. It's currently undergoing a Â£40m refurb so there is some disruption. Breakfast was good variety and cost Â£3 to upgrade from continental to full english. Parking is a problem...You park in the Copthorne which is next door and it costs Â£32 a day. We were luck and parked right outside the front door on a single yellow as it was the weekend!! Staff were all very friendly and helpful, Kensington High Street is 2 monutes away as is the tube and Holland Park. Room size is the only issue and whilst not a bad hotel it wont be top of the returns list!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very unorganized business”
Reviews.Author: Pony613
Reviews.Content: The Kensington Close Hotel is in a great location in London. Just a few minutes away from Hyde Park and near great shopping, the hotel itself is only ok. They didn't tell us there was construction going on while we were staying there and unfortunately when we arrived there were scaffolding on the outside of the building. "No big deal" we thought. Then when we walked in to check in, the receptionist told us that because we reserved our rooms on a separate travel website, they couldn't find our reservation. It was a huge ordeal to find our reservation. Then once we settled in, we were excited to get a spa treatment done downstairs in their spa. They told us that they were booked out for the next 9 days. Very frustrating. A few days later when we went to the pool, the woman at the spa desk interrogated us intensely to find out if we were really staying at the hotel. She was very rude and short with us. Overall, the hotel is clean and is in a great location. It's relatively cheap for London, however the staff is very unprofessional and the business does not seem to be run very well.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel. Definitely not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: IpekB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a long-weekend. The location is good however the hotel is under construction and rooms are too small. Many rooms face into literally the adjascent building which is adjascent - horrible! I had a mini bar (!) empty and locked! TV showed only few channels. Bed lining and towels were clean. I would never turn to this hotel back. Definitely do not worth the value I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel.....small rooms....unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Saffy1972
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel through Superbreak. We were disappointed in general with the condition of the hotel although it is going through an extensive refurb at the moment. Our room was small and outdated and nothing like the pictures advertised on the website (apparently these are the superior rooms so be aware of this if booking) Also when we went to use the Spa we were told we would all have to pay extra as we had not booked directly with the Hotel. Prices of the drinks in the bar are very expensive although I understand it is London and things are more expensive I personally think Â£9 is excessive for a vodka and coke!! I would have expected more from a 4* Hotel even in London!!

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously small bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: CoxieHebdenBridge
Reviews.Content: The hotel is currently under going some type of work, I can only hope it is a COMPLETE refurb!! The public areas are shabby and our bedroom and ensuite bathroom was one of the smallest we have ever stayed in - quite awful. Another guest was complaining about the size of their twin room, whilst we were checking in, so it would appear that this is a general complaint? The reception was often under staffed and guests always experienced a long wait to Check-In. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They are renovating hotel...under MUCH construction right now”
Reviews.Author: Maidstone7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and love the location of the hotel. Unfortunately they are renovating this hotel and construction was going on in the room next to me. It's on all of the floors, just happened that the contractors were next door to my room. From 8am-5pm. Wait until they finish renovating this place to stay at this hotel. The cost was too much per room even though it was a bit discounted due to construction. The bar/breakfast was nice. Staff is always nice. Hopefully the prices won't skyrocket when the renovation is completed. It really is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Give certain circumstances it is OK, dreadful in others......”
Reviews.Author: Disgusted_TWells
Reviews.Content: Following a mid week concert at the Albert Hall we wanted a reasonably priced hotel close by. This seemed to suit the circumstances. We checked in at about 18:00, changed and went straight out to eat before the concert. The room was very clean, but small. Indeed our hoover cupboard at home would give it a run on size. The hotel was very very rited, but to be fair they do appear to be spending money on a major re-furb, presumably for the Olympics next year. In a nutshell, if you are staying one night, and will be there for sleeping hours only, this is fine and reasonable value for money. If you intend to spend any time there other than sleeping forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Removed money from my credit card- BE WARNED!!!”
Reviews.Author: do1981
Reviews.Content: A total disgrace of a hotel. They removed Â£50 from my account unauthorised and 3 phone calls, 2 emails later I am STILL waiting for a response! I believe this money has been taken by a member of staff and am going to inform the police as the hotel are unwilling to do anything about it. I have been more than patient with them. The hotel itself is nowhere near 4 star. It was clean enough. Extortionate bar prices. Wasn't told about the work going on at the time either but it did not affect my stay although can imagine it would have affected others. I would advise anybody thinking of booking here, please don't. Yes it might be cheaper than many London hotels n look good on the website but the pictures are not accurate and a hotel stealing your money is very frustrating not to mention illegal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: AuntieMasie
Reviews.Content: Booked thro Lastminute.com. Could have got cheaper hotel but for Â£150 per night I thought by the hotel website it looked rather plush. It was not!!!! This is not in a million years a 4 star hotel altho the staff were all very helpful and hard working it has to be said. There was a refurb going on so it was not pleasant to be woken on a Sat morning at 8am by the sound of drills and banging. Handy for tube but on balance I would not return. Ps - The rooms are tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: HeatherLanarkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel thankfully only one night the room we were given smelled of damp when i complained to reception staff a very rude young man told us "well we are fully booked" only when i refused to move did he strangely enough find us another room definetly not 4 star and the attitude of this member of staff brings the tone of the hotel down didnt tell us when breakfast was or what time check out was evryone else booking in was informed of this by other members of staff wouldnt stay here again not inpressed.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in the world- I mean it!”
Reviews.Author: Hibikifilms
Reviews.Content: The rate was Â£166.00 and the hotel is billed as a four star. On arrival I was booked into a shabby old room worthy of a hostel. There was a mouse in the room too. So they put me in room 508 which took several attempts to get into (other guests too made repeated trips up and down to solve their key problems) I was woken at 6.00 by someone struggling with the key next door then again at 8.15 by a worker who wanted to paint the door frame. I understand check out time is 12.00 but basically with up to eight workers in the corridor and a man drilling nearby it was impossible to stay and work in the hotel. The worker was wearing ear defenders. they should hand them out to the guests The duty manager discounted Â£15.00 from my bill but I don't think it's fair to travellers to let out rooms that are under renovation, let alone charge Â£151.00 for them for a night (if you can call a few hours a night) The manager finally called me today and claimed that it is clear from the booking .com website that the hotel is under renovations and also he expects guests to notice this on the hotel website too. why would guests look to check if the hotel is being renovated? he was rude and and patronising while he explained this I feel serious ripped off avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “4 stars? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: Zub4ik
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel I've seen. What I didn't like: 1. Bed, It was TOO soft. I have problems with my back so it was really hard to sleep on it. So if you have scoliosis or osteochondrosis don't even think to stay there! 2. Noise. The air-conditioner was too loud and I couldn't switch it off. Because of these 2 reasons I had a really bad sleep there. 3. The interior is too depressive. Bloody red walls...not in my taste. 4. Very crowded hotel. Big lines at the reception. Pluses: The room was very clean. Tea and coffee making facilities are available in the room. Also TV. Breakfast is ok, not the best but ok. The hotel is very close to all tourist attractions, very good locality. I think this hotel is ok if you stay there fo 1-2 days. But if you stay for a week or more find something else.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: TER1951
Reviews.Content: room was small, lived out of luggage, no water pressure, no washcloths unless you upgraded, tape holding down rugs, shower did not work, had to hold on wall to get by bed sideways to get to bathroom, pillows were like so many years old very flat,.Had to pay to use pool which most hotels include, charged you 3 dollars for room service. All that was good were the workers who I found to be polite and very helpful as far as getting to places. If you are renovating you should close down until you are finished.

Reviews.Title: “4 star? What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: Kellyatfield
Reviews.Content: I first arrived and saw the building was covered in ugly scaffolding. Not the end of the world I thought. I'm sure it's nice inside, after all I am staying in Kensington. Check in was ok although staff were not the friendliest I have ever come across, especially for a 4 star hotel. We were then told we could not have our original room near our friends because it was still not ready. The corridoors to the room were dingy and there was silver duck tape keeping the carpet down. Our room was barely big enough to swing a cat, the twin beds were pushed together and could not be pulled apart because there was no room. What is the point of ordering a twin if they are pushed into a double? The tap in the bathroom was broken and my friends shower was broken. The TV had barely any channels and the view from the room was awful as there was scaffolding everywhere! The restaurant was just as bad. After arguing with staff for 15 minutes and trying to convince them we did have breakfast included in our package they finally let us through. we then waited so long for the sausages, bacon, beans and toast t that we finally gave up and settled for eggs and tomatoes. After brekkie I went to check out the spa, which I had been excited about prior to arriving. I can honestly say that the pool, sauna and jacuzzi is far better at my local gym than in this hotel. The room with the pool was dimly lit and the pool uninviting. The floor tiles were all craggy and there was slimy/mouldy looking areas around doors and steps to the pool. I decided I wasn't going in but some of my friends thought they'd give it a go. They went in the sauna and said there were loads of long black hairs over the seats so they come out straight away. I have never written a bad review about anywhere before but I was so disappointed with this so called 4 star hotel that I felt I had to leave a comment. I have stayed in better and cleaner backpackers in Bangkok. Well at least I only had to stay here 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...”
Reviews.Author: sunnydee88
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, good size, helpful staff, only 4 channels on tv (not a flatscreen). bring your own bodywash and shampoo though.

Reviews.Title: “A converted store room with a bed a dog would have trouble sleeping on.”
Reviews.Author: donaldduck050
Reviews.Content: My issues in order - 1. The bed is substandard,(too soft), on closer inspection must be around 50 years old. - 2. The head board to the bed not securely attached to the bed or the wall and banged on the wall until I stuffed some towels behind it. - 3. Drapes to window could not be sufficiently closed to darken the room to sleep. - 4 TV cannot be seen from the bed, best viewed from doorway of bathroom. - 5. No where to place luggage except on floor at end of bed, then one has to jump over them to get to bathroom. - 6.1 tea bag between 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay in this establishment again”
Reviews.Author: Gladdyman
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before and had had some problems such as sewerage coming up in the bath and some other administration problems. This time we had problems checking in, our room booked 3 months previously for 3 people had 1 bed and took over 1 hour to sort out. Problems getting information on tours. We were treated like 2nd class citizens which was different to the airline crews whom the manager was all over like a rash and the Comos travel people who recieved treatment you would expect normally. The best advise was given to my wife when she wanted to purchase some stamps was told to go next door to the Novatel Hotel. Guess where we will be staying next time

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, crowded hotel. To avoid”
Reviews.Author: MFCS
Reviews.Content: Good Location, near bus stop and tube station. The hotel is in refurbishment. Very old and dirty carpets. Veru dirty windows. Bad shower. Not a freindly reception. Lots of people to check in and check out.

Reviews.Title: “A work in progress with massive potential.”
Reviews.Author: RoMn
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here for 3 nights it was a fine stay. The hotel is in a very quiet location and perfect for getting around the city. I was not impressed with reception staff as we were given a room key that opened someone else's room not the best start, then had to change room as I wasn't happy with the original allocation! Breakfast staff were very friendly, and the selection was well varied. Would stay again ONLY when renovations have been completed!!

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: local_wanderer
Reviews.Content: Ok - bear in mind that this is a BIG hotel, and it is being refurbished - there is a lot of scaffolding around the place.... The hotel is obviously getting a lot of money spent on it - and where it has been completed, the hotel is fine. We stayed on the 4th floor, and our room was fine - it was not massive, but big enough for a couple of nights. No complaints about the bathroom, or room facilities - the view was of a lot of scaffolding and walkboards, but without that, it would have been of other buildings anyway, so was never going to be pretty - but I don't come to this sort of hotel for the view from the bedroom! Some areas of the building were closed off, and there were workmen about. Noise was noticable during the daytime hours, but was quiet after about 5pm, and none in the evenings. I didn't notice working until about 930am. The staff were helpful and responsive, and the whole check in / out process was fuss free and not too time consuming. Breakfast was in the Sports Bar (I assume again because of the renovation) and got rather busy, but was OK; good selection of hot and cold food, although if you don't have an inclusive room rate, there is a cracking cafe up the road which will be less than Â£16 for a full English meal. The hotel is located near Kensington High Street, and not far from some of the swankier shops of the area, and close to 'central' London either by foot, tube, bus or Taxi. I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “Kensington Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: KathywWales
Reviews.Content: Tricky one at the moment. Just got back from a nights stay (have stayed there about 5 other times so safe to say I'm a fan mainly for location and price). Rooms are fine,everything you need cleverly squeezed in. Hotel's got restuarants,sports bar (spa but never used it!) and 5 mins walk in a quiet side street around the corner from Kensington High St tube. From the tube,hang a left,left again & you're in Wrights Lane,Cafe Nero,Muffin Man cafe & EMI records! First thing you'll see then is the cranes! Works starts at 8am (and does it start !) but didn't go to London for a long quiet lie in so no big deal,it's finished by the time you get back so no real issue for me and my room was level with the scaffolding on 2nd floor! Staff helpful,bag check in free which is a handy bonus. The no9 bus from across the main rd is a great thing,the route takes you past Kensington Palace,Albert Hall,Knightsbridge,Piccadilly to Aldwych by Covent Garden so a 'one stop shop' for me..also close to the AMAZING World Food Market which is a must! Kensington High St is ideal,plenty to do & see there,loads of places to eat etc.. but the refurb could be an issue for you so be aware of it and take a great hotel as it comes at the moment maybe!x

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Edward121
