Reviews.Content: Very close to Tube Station, and in general it was a good stay. We only stayed one night. The hotel was on construction at the same moment but it was still quiet. We had to pay 8 more pounds to get an access to the swimming pool and the gym... And to get an english breakfast we had to pay also 8 more pounds. It was still a really good week-end with my partner!

Reviews.Title: “Awful place. unfriendly staff. grubby small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SetSail84
Reviews.Content: i recommend spending 20 pounds more and going down the street to park city hotel. much nicer staff, much nice place, breakfast included. plus they are not doing refurbishment for the entire year. very unhappy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “DISASTER!!!”
Reviews.Author: alantheo
Reviews.Content: Were booked into this hotel by Red Letter Days,a supposedly first class company who promise you the best of everything,but obviously they hadn't done their homework on this hotel.We were not informed of the renovations in progress,and found the rooms to be small and grubby.Outside our room was a builders yard!! with debris,scaffold and scaffold boards lying everywhere. So to conclude,if you are thinking of booking into this place,THINK AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Why do people moan about this hotel???”
Reviews.Author: paulyjh50
Reviews.Content: i booked through a last minute agent and got a very good price. Yes there is work going on but it in no way affected my stay. All the staff were friendly and very helpfull, the hotel was constantly being cleaned. Yes i admit the toilet was very small but i never wanted to stay more than a couple of minutes there so it was no problem to me, but if you want to speand your trip in there i am happy for you. The tea and coffee in the room was more tham aadequete and the bed very comfortable. The car parking charge for that area overnight was great, and only a short walk to the tube. The hotel is very nice and i will have no problem staying there again. by the way the room service menu for that part of london was great value, cheaper than eating out.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: paduafelan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as we were going to the Royal Albert Hall and this was in a nice location near by. 20 minute walk or bus number 9,10 or 52every couple of minutes till late and 24hr service, ideal if you have an over sixty bus pass which you can use on all red London Buses. Hotel lacks care with the small things for example when we arrived back late on first night they hadn't left any milk for the room. only one shower gel and shampoo in a room for two people as i say not earth shattering but for Â£100 a night you expect better. Don't be put off by reveiews with concerns about building work you will be out most of the time they are working. No. 10 bus runs from outside Kings Cross station to Kensington high street Tube station which is five minutes from hotel. no. 9 bus goes to trafalgar square and central London

Reviews.Title: “good location and breakfast, bedrooms need improving!”
Reviews.Author: vermeerdublin
Reviews.Content: great location close to High St Ken tube, breakfast has good selection , but after that it goes downhill. There are refurbishment works going on at present and as we knew about these that wasent a problem. The room size/value is though. We booked an executive twin but it was very small. I complained asking was I in a regular twin by mistake but reception told me I was in an executive room. The twin beds are very narropw, the tv was a14inch old type (not flatscreen), the shower was very finnicky, there was no fridge and the fridge they gave us was very old, the toiletries were not renewed for the second day. Staff were helpful if limited in what they could provide. Hotel needs refreshing - finsih the works quickly please!. I expected better. stephen, dublin 19 april 2011

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gina_gstar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to celebrate our 10 year anniversary had were extremley dissapointed with it from start to finish there is a lovely hotel right next door and parking is only Â£10 its called copthorne tara i would stay there if you want a good location and cheap parking...

Reviews.Title: “problems from start to finish and beyond”
Reviews.Author: josge
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible hotel. They made it extremely difficult to book an extra night in advance and when they finally did they made a mess of it. Which we had to set right. When we arrived we double checked that everything was in order with our booking but when we were checking out all of a sudden they start claiming that we had booked two extra nights. Then they demand that WE PROVE that we had only booked one extra night and send us out of the hotel to an internet cafe to find our earlier e-mail confirmation that the mistakes were indeed theirs. Unbelievably, we then recieved a bill today for two extra nights in the hotel. Two weeks after we checked out! This hotel is a joke! ItÂ´s been nothing but trouble from start to finish and beyond! p.s. the walls around the toilet are so close I had to approach the toilet sideways and IÂ´m not obese. Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Most over priced hotel I have ever come across”
Reviews.Author: beckyphillips
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after looking at the website and it looked nice (it is in Kensington after all). From the moment we walked through the door I was regretting the choice. The check in was the slowest I have ever experienced and then when we got to the room I was shocked. It was so small you couldn't swing a cat and the bathroom was tiny and when you ran the tap on the sink the water took ages to drain away It wasn't particularly clean and was in desperate need of updating although, the bed covers were clean and fresh, The paint work was tired and the bathroom was very shabby. The facilities in the room were also poor. The TV was a small old style TV (the travel lodge even has flat screens!!!!!) and the hairdryer and kettle had seen better days. The communal areas of the hotel were also very tired and shabby and in desperate need of updating,

Reviews.Title: “horrendous hotel avoid”
Reviews.Author: natjah
Reviews.Content: dirty rooms, ancient disgusting bathrooms. Rude unhelpful staff. No way 4* more like 2'. the only good thing was the location. We complained and moved rooms 3 times but they were all bad. No mini bar, and a tv from the 70s, nothing seemed to work. It is being re-furbished at the moment, and they offered free internet, movies etc which weren't given it on arrival had to ask and present our booking info to prove it was offered. It was so bad we prefered to go out for breakfast instead of using the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: nicolad101
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel was expensive, wen we arrived the reception were not friendly, made our way to the room an the hallways were written over an broken doors. Room was no way a double, barely a double bed!!! An couldn't swing a cat. Carpets were dirty and so was the Walls and bed uncomfortable to top it off our view was just scaffolding!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sstimson
Reviews.Content: We arrived to check in at 5pm, the staff looked stressed and confused. We were promptly handed our room keys and told were to go. When we got to our rooms we realised we had been given someone elses room (luckly they were not there at the time) We complained to the manager who quickly came to meet us at the room, he then said, "leave your bags here and I shall move them to your room. Wait in the lobby please" He then moved our bags and someone elses into our room! Well after a few hours we got to know the people in the1st room and we handed their bags back after the manger thought they were ours. Sorry to say it was their honeymoon night! In the morning our room door kept being knocked on from House Keeping. This started at 8am, 8.30, 9am, 10am. Why could they not wait until we checked out! We luckly stayed one night. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: sushew
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, great service from Concierge So close to Kensington High Street but quiet! Less than 1 block to tube station. Would stay again - hotel room small - but it's London!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little over priced”
Reviews.Author: jzipster
Reviews.Content: London is notorious for its expensive lifestyle, however with this hotel's pricing that is just a little above average, I figured I would be getting something special. In some ways, I did. Booking with Expedia got me a room with free wi-fi (usually it costs extra) and the hotel was very near the High Street Kensington tube station. Really easy for travel, and when it was closed, there were so many buses it was not an issue. In some ways, I did not. I know European hotel rooms are on the smaller side, but that was not the issue. The room was just very bland, and there was a tiny draft from the window. Since my bed was up against it, I was a little chilly at night as the heat was not working, for whatever reason. In addition., when I called for extra blankets, and since my friend is allergic to wool, we were left with no options besides the thing cover on the bed. There was also construction going on, so I could hear it starting around 9 am. The staff was helpful, though I felt as if my questions tried to moved along as quickly as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very run down and customer service the worst I have experienced in a very long time.”
Reviews.Author: Kirkiep
Reviews.Content: This hotel is apparently under renovation, not before time as the rooms are awful. Bathroom in particular has cracked tiles, damaged door and mould. You could possibly forgive all of this if the customer service was good. Sadly it is not, whatever happened to service with a smile?

Reviews.Title: “Agree with "AVOID IT at ALL COSTS"!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvlktahoe
Reviews.Content: Rooms look nothing like website pictures. Shower head fell off twice, Duct tape around the window, stains on bedding. Changed rooms twice and it did not help. Would have changed hotels, but was traveling with a group of friends. TV did not work, terrible construction noise and dust. I stayed in nicer/cleaner places when I was a poor college student! The manager did reduce the price and offered complimentary breakfast, which helped. But the rooms should not cost more than 35 pounds - even if it is London! Oh, and swimming pool closed!

Reviews.Title: “A V O I D A T A L L C O S T S”
Reviews.Author: chrismcgill
Reviews.Content: Dreadful. Simple. Tiny, dirty, smelly, dated, scruffy, unkept, uncomfortable room. A very impressive alarm clock however. 8am on dot all hell is let loose whilst an army of builders hammer at your widow, drill through your ceiling and swear through your door. No indication was given that this alarm clock was a complimentary service. I was due to stay for a week. Ermmm... no thanking you. The kind of hotel you want to dedicate a couple of months to stand in front of the entrance in a desperate bid to advise others against staying there. SHOCKING!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend.”
Reviews.Author: 55711Umberhulk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kensington Close a year ago, while not the best place, its location and rates make it somewhat easier to overlook what it is lacking. This go 'round our rate wasn't that good putting it more in line with a hotel chain. Yes, the staff can be pleasant occasionally however, I found the concierge to just be wrong a lot with directions and recommendations. On Saturday a fire alarm sounded through the hotel at 8am. The whole place was evacuated. Some people were in the shower and hurried out into the cold in merely a towel. YET NO EMPLOYEE WAS TO BE SEEN. No explanation was officially offered. We had to ask several employees what happened before being told that someone pulled the fire alarm. In a proper hotel, management should have offered everyone apologies and maybe some complimentary amenity. Not at the Kensington Close.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok food, small rooms, construction going on”
Reviews.Author: senorita1
Reviews.Content: The nearest metro/ subway/ tube stop is a 3 minute walk away. There is a Boots drugstore/ pharmacy 1 minute away on foot . There is a cafe next door to the pharmacy. The Marks and Spencers is 2 minutes away on foot , walk through the Boots drugstore and you will see a mini mall with food places and marks and spencers. Forget about getting internet at the hotel, they say it's free but it doesn't work. Don't waste your time either with the spa and gym. The food is average, nothing special. The rooms are small, clean, small bathrooms. The construction starts at 8am and continues throughout until 5pm. The check in process takes a long time as do the lifts/ elevators. I would stay again just for it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing '4Star' about it!!”
Reviews.Author: Moli27
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, we were given a room on the 7th floor. As soon as we opened the door we were bombarded with the noise of Jack hammers right over our heads. Although the hotel web site stated there were refurbishments going on, it did not warn of the level of noise we would have to put up with. We immediately requested a change of room and were moved to the 3rd floor where the noise was muffled but still heard. The noise went on all day from 8am to 5pm. The room was very small although very clean and comfortable but not a 4* touch to be found. I honestly would be pushed to even offer 3 star quality. There was 1bottle of shampoo and shower gel in the bathroom, (did they expect us 2 shower together?), no shower caps, no mini bar. The tv was a tiny old thing with 3 channels. The hotel itself was very old and shabby. Dirty old capets, holes in the walls and ceilings, broken smoke alarms and even mould could be seen in places. The hotel resturant was closed and a makeshift resturant that looked more like a school canteen was available in the bar. (Very uncomfortable and tacky) We were so disappointed with the whole hotel experience. The few good points of our stay was the hotel was in a great location for shopping and the westend shows. Very close to the underground station. But of course there were many other hotels in this area that would have been better suited to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Latanja
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was wondering if I had the right hotel. I stayed at the Kensington Close at the end of May and beginning of June 2010. I had the best time there. Yes, the room was small and it took me a minute to figure out how to turn on the shower but that is exactly what I was expecting in London. However, the staff was fabulous, we had a great time in the bar and the breakfast they served (for free) everyday was great. The location to the "Tube" and "Whole Foods" was well worth having a small room. I would definitely stay there again and I can't wait to get back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Freezing conditions in a cramped room”
Reviews.Author: Inscribe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing refurbishment and not before time and the noise associated with this begins at 7.40 am and ends around 5 pm. The lobby is a grubby experience but the excellent staff do their best under trying circumstances. Checking in and checking out was a friendly and fast experience with no mistakes on the account. Would anyone believe that the double rooms in this place are barely 2.5 meters at their widest part? And the toilet area is just a cm or two over half a meter wide and unless you are petite you will have to forego the pleasure. The bath is narrow and hot water was not available from 11 am to 5 pm. The room and bathroom were clean and the soaps were replenished. The housekeeping staff did their best. The bedroom window is single glazed and at this time of the year the night-time temperature drops quickly. The heating seems to switch off when you need it most after an hour the bedroom feels very cold. The only food available was bar food and the staff in the bar were pleasant and efficient people and service was fast. Avoid the kitchen-made mayonaisse as it would pass for a laxative. I cannot comment on the quality of the breakfast as the experience from dealing with the mayonnaise on the previous evening, deterred me, and thereafter I ate in one of the many excellent restaurants located nearby in High Street Kensington. All of the staff I met were warm, hospitable and cheerful people who did their best to help the guests. Apart from cold and claustrophobic bedroom the hotel was passable if you spent most of your time away from it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Busabry
Reviews.Content: The only thing this place has going for it is friendly staff. We were booked for 3 nights but were so unimpressed we left after only 2, paying for the third night without using it. Worth it just to get away from the place!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. Total incompetence!”
Reviews.Author: Rose186330
Reviews.Content: Chaotic check in and check out. Unnaceptable confusion over charging the correct credit card. Very poor customer service. Noisy. Dirty. Tiny rooms. I have stayed here in the past and had OK experiences, but I will never stay here again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What Do You Expect for a Reasonably Priced Big City Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Glurpo
Reviews.Content: I would like to add my voice to the praise column: My room was a single and it was indeed small, but so are most hotel rooms I've stayed in within European cities. The room was warm, the bed comfortable, the TV worked (only 5 channels), hot water was there whenever I needed and the elevators were in service the whole time. The hotel staff was very friendly and went out of their way to answer our questions and show us around. The pool and exercise area are nicer than a health club. My room was very clean and well-maintained, but my maid wasn't very generous with the shampoo and bath gel. I'm used to getting replenished each morning. The tea pot in my room only came with two Nescafe pouches and one tea bag. I would've expected a better selection from a $250 a night hotel. Our package included the full English breakfast. I'm surprised that with National Health Care the Brits are allowed to eat so much cholesterol - I absolutely loved it!! And so did the many many other guests seemingly from all over the World. Everyone's plate was piled high with hash browns, scrambled or fried eggs, beans, grilled tomato, mushrooms, that incredibly delicious yet dangerous English bacon and breakfast sausages that taste infinitely better than anything I've ever had in the States. There are 5 kinds of juices, coffee, a variety of teas, hot chocolate (necessary in that English winter weather), porridge, fruits, lots and lots of breads and rolls. This was a great place to try out English marmalades - yeccch! The place was quiet being off the main drag, there were always cabs available outside the lobby doors (except when we needed one at 5:00 am to get out to Heathrow), it's only a block from the Kensington High Street Tube (not exactly the easiest stop to get to however since other District and Circle line trains always seem to be heading the wrong way), the Muffin Man tea room is half a block away and a cute little place to enjoy the obligatory English tea, there are plenty of inexpensive chain restaurants nearby as well as a Wagamama two blocks from the Tube station. It doesn't take much effort to find an "authentic" English pub in the immediate area. For those that don't mind a stroll, the neighborhood is very safe and there are some pretty wealthy folks living in the area judging by the Porsches, Ferraris, Lambos and Audi R8s parked nearby. Just a ten minute walk south on Cromwell Road will take you to a huge Sainsbury's store where you can load up on snacks and find soft drinks for under Â£2.00 a bottle. There are s few negatives - While the concierge desk was extremely helpful with directions, suggestions and early arrival luggage storage, someone REALLY dropped the ball when we asked them to book us an early morning cab to Heathrow. We had been told that in order to make our 8 am flight we couldn't use the Tube since it didn't open until after 5 am. The kind concierge suggested sharing a cab. The three of us could ride out to the airport in a mere half hour for a negotiated rate of Â£45. We agreed and the concierge wrote down our requested departure time and names. That evening a different concierge was on duty. My wife reconfirmed with him. "No problem" we were told. In the morning when we checked out and prepared to leave, yet another concierge was on duty. He knew nothing about the cab request. He tried calling for one and none were available. Finally a cab came by as he dropped off another fare. The concierge helped us with the bags and we drove off. A few blocks from the hotel we asked if the concierge had negotiated the same Â£45 rate for us. The driver said that our cab only ran on the meter, but the rate would be "about" the same. Since we were leaving the UK we had pretty much spent all of our on hand cash the night before and on tipping the hotel staff that morning. We only had a little over Â£50 in cash. As I watched the cab's meter click up .20 every few seconds I also noticed a sign inside the cab stating that credit cards were not accepted. We had already reached Â£40 before even reaching the Heathrow exit. I imagined having to hop out of the cab miles from the terminal once we hit the Â£50 mark. Somehow my wife found enough extra change in her pocket to pay the cabbie when we arrived at Terminal 4 to the tune of Â£56.20. Sorry, but no tip for the cab driver. Needless to say, we were not happy with the concierge's desk after that embarassment. There was also construction work going on about the scaffolding all around the hotel. At 8 am the workers started, even on Saturday. Fortunately we were getting early starts as well, but this might be a huge pain in the rear for someone hoping to sleep in. I would assume this work will be done by the much busier summer season. However, even in the the dead of February there were a couple of high school age tour groups staying in the hotel. Back in the rear of the hotel where my room was located I had no problem with them, but walking toward the elevators I could hear kids carrying on in the hallways. Once school's out I suspect the Kensington Close will be hosting many more school kids. Insist on a room on a different floor. Nearby sites are the Victoria and Albert Museum, Kensington Palace, Albert Hall and Memorial and the Science Museum. In addition to the nearby Tube, you can use the convenient #10 bus to take you up through the shopping area of Kensington and to Hyde Park and Marble Arch. My overall impression of the Kensington Close is quite favorable, but I am probably also subconciously factoring in the great time we had coupled with the outstanding package we had purchased. If I were paying the standard $200+ room rate without breakfast, I would probably have a much different opinion. But then again, the days of the sub $50 room in London are pretty well gone. One last note: the hotel does have WiFi, but at Â£15 a day, the rate is insane. A block away, inside the Kensington High Street Tube station the Pret a Manger sandwich shop was free WiFi. Same at the McDonald's across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrandtHousehold6
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by the lovely web site. Rooms are tiny, in ill repair, and the hotel is a construction site. The bedding was skimpy and our room smelled like cigarettes despite the fact that it is a non-smoking hotel. Toilets did not flush, the heat in our room did not work. Cold air poured in the drafty windows. The furniture was covered in stains. The desk top had burn marks in it from the kettle. The bathroom fan was so loud you could feel it vibrating. You could hear the plumbing, water rushing through pipes, from all around you while in your room. The staff was overwhelmed and unprepared for all that was going wrong around them.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Opinion”
Reviews.Author: ClaireCoughlan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Kensington Close on a short break with friends. When we arrived to the area we were delighted with the location. Just a 2 minute walk from the High Street Kensington underground stop. I was aware before we arrived that there was some renovations going on so that was not a surprise to us. When we arrived to check in there was a queue in front of us which was understandable as it was peak time for check in. When I finally got to check in I was met by the receptionist who was not one bit friendly. No apology for the wait or anything when I told her my name for booking she had all the details on screen, i had signed in and she walked away from me to see could she find a room to suit us as she didnt think she did. When she returned then we asked to pay in full as it would be easier for us. On top of this she charged us an extra 80 pounds as guarantee that would be given back on check out. I felt this was a bit steep and surely if there was no deposit paid then it should not be possible to charge to our room?? When we got to our room there was a double and single bed which was suitable for us.However the bathroom was dirty - the bath wasnt clean properly but other than that it was ok. There was no information booklet in the room to inform us of any of the hotel facilities. On the double bed there was no proper duvet more like a heavy sheet that didnt cover the full bed. All in all for the location alone the hotel was fine. We didnt eat in the hotel - there is a nice cafe just up the road called the muffin man and they do lovely food. There is a taxi rank right outside which is good if you dont know where you are going. Would I stay there again - Im not really sure.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: dannhev
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through lastminute.com as a mystery hotel after finding what hotel it was must say was a bit dissapointed after reading the reviews on here, must say it was a pleasant surprise when we actually got in to the hotel!! Ok so the outside of the hotel doesn't look great this Is because they are currently doing works on the hotel and there are a couple of leaks around the hotel this is also due to these works however the price if booking direct reflects this and believe there website refers to it, now if you book it as a mystery hotel you get free use of the pool and jacuzzi as well as the gym to make up for the fact you don't find out about the works at point of booking, I think that's fair! The rooms are small - your in central London you don't get large rooms unless you spend a lot! Room Is big enough and the bathroom has full bath with a shower again not something I have found often! Overall I believe extremely good value for money and decent hotel! Dont hesitate in booking!!! Dan

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone says...”
Reviews.Author: Lolls2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed there this past weekend with my boyfriend. Great location. Comfortable enough hotel. Breakfast good. we were 30mins late for breakfast one morning and the lady guided us to a table and allowed us to enjoy our full english even though im sure they needed to clean up and prepare for lunch One reviewer mentioned they took a charge of GBP 50 from the card for any extras. This is not true. they use this GBP50 as you pre authorise it.... It is not actually taken from your card. It allows them to debit card IF you put extra on the room Which is fair enough in my eyes. They are only protecting themselves

Reviews.Title: “poor accomadation like building site not very clean rooms in need of refubishment”
Reviews.Author: donny50
Reviews.Content: maybe after upgrade is completed it might be better hoterl to visit. not at the moment. have stayed at this hotel in the past 20yrs or so, never again

Reviews.Title: “OK for somewhere to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: BM1991
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated in Kensington High Street which is easy to get to on the underground so long as the lines are running. When we went the main line it was on was down for maintenace and therefore we had to swap and change many times. The hotel itself was easy to find and in a nice location, however when we arrived the people were not very welcoming. We were not told that there would be refurbishments going on in the spa and we were welcomed by a loud drilling noise. The hotel was quite nice but the room we had must have been the smallest room possible. It was big enough to fit two people in however there was not much room for anything else. I would not reccommend this hotel if your planning a romantic relaxing stay but if you are going to be going places then the hotel is nice and comfortable. Also note that when you arrive they block Â£50 from your card incase of any damages or use of amenities etc. This was note mentioned until we got to the hotel and I am now still awaiting them to put the money back onto my card.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, building works, but great pool and gym and overall value for money”
Reviews.Author: BBDOM44
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the end of January. The room was small a little tired and a bit noisey ( air conditioning, hetaing and water pipes). However I would certainly recomend. It is very conveniently located and for the price where else will you get such a nice pool, gym, sauna and steam room. Big Caveat though dont book through Last Minute.com or even possibly with other sites offering cheap deals. You will get it marginally cheaper but you will have to pay Â£8 a day to use the pool etc, Â£5 an hour for wireless access and additional costs on television and films, which if you book directly with the hotel all come free.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly pleaseant”
Reviews.Author: keithj2806
Reviews.Content: We stayed over night from the 5"til the 6th Feb. The room we had was a standard one, nice decor, clean and tidy, although our view was partially obscured by building work. The location was ideal, High street Kensington tube around the corner and within walking distance of Kensington gardens and Hyde park. The staff were polite and professional and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE - DO NOT GO HERE”
Reviews.Author: Jamie033
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. My girlfriend and I had lined up a Valentines evening in Kensington so we were just looking for a nice hotel to spend the night in - restaurant / lounge / room service etc. wouldnt be needed so what could go wrong? - Everything. Upon arrival in the room I saw immediately that the 4* Â£90 room I had booked was nowhere to be seen - to be honest, as soon as you leave the reception you feel like you are in a 0* hotel. The room itself was old and falling apart and the bathroom and toilet were not even clean. The shower was probably made in the 1950's as was the laughable television. The bed was basically a wooden block with a mattress on. Even with the room being this c**p I thought, who cares, I'm only sleeping here. Proceeding into the bathroom for a shower was like walking into a swimming pool - without even being used the tiolet had flooded over and covered the bathroom and part of the bedreeom floor. These things happen ofcourse, so with the inconvenience of missing a shower due to a restaurant booking elsewhere we proceeded to reception. Upon informing the staff of this we were told the room would be made ready for when we returned - no offer of a new room. How ridiculous. Ofcourse we asked for a new room and they said they would have one ready for when we got back. 1am - And we return for our night out ready for bed - new room key in hand we enter to find we have been given a twin room, rather than the double we booked. Back to reception to change rooms AGAIN and finally a double bed - ofcourse both rooms featured the same awful presentation as before. To top it all, after all this hassel we had a lovely veiw of the inside of a construction site from the window - no special treatment for being messed around at all. No apology, no nothing. Summary: Staff - Pleasant but unhelpful and not even a hint of an apology. Room - Awful Price - Disgusting for what we got Location - Also awful, the pictures of the hotal online are very misleading Clenliness - Non existant Overall - Worst place I ever stayed in. A Â£7 a night hotal in Thailand was FAR BETTER than this. What a complete shambles - I will be writing to complain. I feel that clicking the 1 out of 5 rating is 1 rating too much. DO NOT GO HERE EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Caitlyn53487
Reviews.Content: I was first attracted to the Kensignton Close Hotel because of the deal offered on lastminute.com. For the cost, I thought it would be worth the chance. It was worth the risk, as we enjoyed our stay and felt it was excellent value. The hotel is literally around the corner from the tube shop, right by all the shops of Kensington High Street and close to Holland Park. We found it to be an excellent base during our stay. Our room was clean and quiet. The bath was a good size, and the bed extremely comfortable with fluffy pillows (!). I cannot comment on the quality of the restaurants or bars, as we thought they were incredibly overpriced. However, there are tons of great restaurants in the neighborhood (I can particularly recommend the Thai a few doors down), so you won't go hungry. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to London

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel for the price we paid.”
Reviews.Author: packpack
Reviews.Content: Booked through a price compare website day before and got a real B&B bargain. Polite check in not too busy (saturday!) free upgrade to executive room, clean and good size for london hotels. 1 minute to kensington high street and very quiet considering the building works goibng on (we stayed at the front looking up to the high st). Breakfast was very good lots of choice but the hot food was too cold!! Staff very helpfull though. A bit of agro with the tubes as they were doing the usual weekend maintenance so getting into the city centre took a while as the hotel is a bit far out but not too bad and a great thai restaurant just outside the front door and very cheap too!! We would stay again if we needed to be that side of the city. I would question the 4 star? More like 3 star for sure but stll very good.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamToad
Reviews.Content: I booked the Kensington Close as the pictures on the website looked pretty decent and it was classed as a 4 star so didn't think we could go far wrong. Not the case! When i saw it from the top of the road, my heart sank. The building from the outside looks like a derelict office building, desperately in need of work! Horrible! When we entered the hotel, the hotel pics were a million miles from the reality of the tired, dismal reception. I have NO idea how this got a 4 star grading?! The room had a tv from 1985 by the looks of it-the sound didn't work properly. The bed was actually a trampoline. It just desperately desperately needs a refurb. Dire. The problem is the 4 star grading-i would expect this from a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “rip off”
Reviews.Author: ballsHerts
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel as it was easy access to the city of london . On the website it looked lovely , rooms looked great , swimming pool looked good and in all it looked nice . i booked an executive room thinking it was going to be extra speical but as we arrived to the room , it was poor , the room was so small , the decor looked dirty and very old , it was not worth the money . we had electrical socket hanging of the wall , ,, an air condition unit which didnt work right . The staff had problems smiling or even greeting you , they looked like they didnt care and had attitude towards people. Alot of them had problem understanding english .when we checked out i payed for the room and we was on our way , it wasnt until we arrived home to find that they had charge an extra Â£160 pounds to my card which was the final straw , so always check what these people are charging . i would advice people to book else where if they was thinking bout booking this hotel.The worst hotel i have ever stayed at .....

Reviews.Title: “Horrid little room, horrid little hotel - many better available for the money.”
Reviews.Author: JamieMarshall
Reviews.Content: My company booked this hotel for me when I was visiting an exhibition at the Kensington Olympia. It was very conveniently situated for the venue but that's where the positives end. The "double" room was roughly the same size as the bathroom of the hotel I stayed in the previous night. When I lay on the bed my feet went beyond the bed and touched the wall. I'm not overly tall at 6 feet. I arrived fairly late at night (around 11pm) and just wanted to get my head down. Unfortunately, the air conditioning unit in my room was very noisy, despite being turned off and this caused me some trouble getting to sleep. It felt like I hadn't been asleep for long when I was rudely awakened by workmen beneath my window long before I hoped to get up. I had ordered breakfast to my room which arrived on time but was very substandard - even the coffee and orange juice didn't taste great. I took a shower in the smallest bathroom I think I've ever been in and when I stepped out I found the shower had flooded the floor. The last straw was when I was using the toilet (standing up - I won't go into any more detail) and a housekeeper walked into my room without any notice. Avoid this hotel at all costs. I just needed somewhere comfortable to rest my head and the Kensington Close couldn't even deliver that. I could have stayed at a much nicer, more reliable chain hotel nearby for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, tired decor, noisy building work”
Reviews.Author: Veryfussy
Reviews.Content: Even by London standards, this hotel has small rooms with dated furnishings. But the main problem is the current building work going on in the hotel. This is very noisy from early in the morning - and means there are lots of builders walking around the hotel - not too nice for solo female travellers. The location is great for Kensington High Street but it's a two-star hotel pretending to be four-star - only marginally better than a travelodge at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “For emergency accomodation only, in dire need of a major referb.”
Reviews.Author: ahdguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas. Room's air-con consisted of a cheap fan heater emitting noxious smells.. Carpets covered in questionable stains. Wall paper hangin off walls. Cheapest bed and matress known to man. Without doubt the worst hotel room I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. My wife woke me up at 6am to leave to drive home rather than stay another minute. When asked at the checkout the lady asked "did I have a good stay"? I said "no", she said "was it the room"? That tells you all you need to know when the staff are embarassed by the state of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star, more like a 1 star place”
Reviews.Author: Lynda_with_a_y
Reviews.Content: This hotel was literally falling down around us. There were buckets collecting water, electrical wires protruding from the walls, paper and rugs peeling....The room was as small as a cruise ship room. The only good part was the concierge desk. ALL of staff that worked the desk were very accomodating and helpful. The hotel is in a nice location.....however, there are a TON of other hotels to choose from. KEEP LOOKING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located & I keep going back”
Reviews.Author: MissNinja
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now. I travel to London frequently on business and have tried a good variety of hotels in my time and this hotel is definitely in my top favourites. I don't understand some of the bad reviews on this site, it is very difficult to get a hotel of better quality in London, at such a good price and my experiences have always been good. This hotel is perfectly located right behind Kensington High St Tube station and access to lots of bus routes. Westfields is only a 10 min bus ride away, Hyde Park around the corner and all the shops & restaurants of the High St on your doorstep. The rooms are small, it's true, but so are most hotel rooms in London unless you pay much more to stay in executive suites at other hotels. As that is generally not an option in my case, I don't have a problem with it. I also don't spend all day in the room. I love that the rooms have bath tubs and great rain-drop shower heads. The beds are beautifully soft and comfortable and you can comfortably watch TV in bed. And what is important for me is that the rooms are quiet so I can sleep uninterrupted. The breakfast buffet was poor in my opinion, but I generally just grab a coffee and croissant from one of the coffee shops outside. I will continue to keep returning this hotel, because it's comfortable and convenient and I happen to like the rooms very much. I recommend it for business travellers, but to other travellers also because the hotel is not cold and corporate as some hotels are.

Reviews.Title: “An awful New Years Eve 2010”
Reviews.Author: silviabb
Reviews.Content: Went here for New Years Eve 2010 - and had a terrible time. Having paid over Â£50 for a ticket we were left queuing for well over an hour - and when we finally got in the staff and security were incredibly rude. There were no drinks and canapes as promised and the VIP tickets some people paid extra for had no benefits whatsoever - there were no VIP rooms/areas at all. It was a complete con. It was Â£7 for a beer from a plastic cup and took ages to be served by disinterested bar staff. For an event billed as 'a Night with the Stars' it was as far from glamorous as you could get. And there wasn't even a proper countdown to welcome in the New Year! An absolute joke of an event - poorly organised...and the atmosphere was killed by rude and sometimes aggressive staff - but to be fair they did have a lot of unhappy punters to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe this is a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mac1314
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and asked a couple of colleagues about this hotel before booking it and although I didn't hear anything very complimentary neither was I advised to steer well clear. So I booked a double room. All I can say is if this had been a Travelodge I would have been disappointed (at least with aTravelodge you expect a fairly minimalist experience). The room was small, you couldn't even walk around the bed as to fit a double bed in it was puched up against the wall under the window. For a 4 star hotel the room was small and very basic, the decor was well past the point at which it needed to be refreshed. The Kensington Close is ok (just) and it is in a good location, just don't expect very much for your money.

Reviews.Title: “A building site in a good location!!”
Reviews.Author: maggymacDevon
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one night (thank goodness!!) We'd been there before a couple of years ago and found the location close to High St Kensington and the tube very convenient although the noise from the 'tradesmen's entrance' at 5am was rather irritating.On approaching the hotel this time, we noticed a huge crane behind it and so were forewarned to some extent of what was to come! I had requested a quiet room and reminded the receptionist of this fact. She practically scoffed at me. On reaching the room, we saw why. An extension was being built onto our side of the hotel. Our small, dingy room overlooked the concrete and steel site and because of the poor condition of the ill-fitting windows, we could hear the workmen chatting as they worked, along with the banging and clattering that is part and parcel of building. No way were we going to stay there so I rang the receptionist who informed me that the workmen would be going home shortly and all would be quiet!! I persisted in asking to move rooms and eventually we were 'relocated' to the far back corner of the seventh floor!! Although the room was much bigger although still pretty shabby with draughty windows, we agreed to take it. It was quiet until 8am the next morning when we were awoken to the sound of workmen on scaffolding a couple of floors below!! On mentioning the noise factor to the receptionist, she informed us that building work was scheduled to continue for another three to four months. So.. if you're arriving after dark and leaving early, you should be ok. Otherwise, give it a wide berth for the next few months. A few plus points..the housekeeping and room service staff were extremely helpful and there is a nice swimming pool in the basement for Â£8. The cafe on the corner is an economical alternative to breakfast in the hotel. ( No need to drag yourself out of bed for a certain time)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly043
Reviews.Content: Leaking ceiling in the main hallway, grubby furniture and flooring in the bar, vomit left on the stairs from the night before (we saw it on the way to bed in the evening and it was still there after breakfast the next day...yuk!!!). Cooked breakfast wasn't the best - couldn't face it on the second morning - the scrambled egg reminded us of the stairs! Pleasant and friendly staff who are working to a standard far superior to their surroundings. We were in single rooms which were exceptionally small and very tatty, but at least they were clean. There was a lot of noise - even after eliminating the bathroom extractor fan and air-con there was still background noise that made sleeping difficult. The gym and pool were by far the best areas of the hotel - they really need to bring the rest of the hotel up to the standard of these facilities to make this a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel within minutes on High Street Kensington Tube Station”
Reviews.Author: Davidjlong
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel as part of a theatre package - the hotel is clean throughout although there are some building works going on. I'd pick this hotel again as the mattress was very comfortable and close to the tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room and tinny winny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: tinghq
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay, it is very expensive! The room is so tiny that you can hardly have any room once the luggages are in. Enough room to go around the bed! Bathroom is a joke! Stay one nite to join a cosmos tour the next morning. Really glad that I didn't book another nite here at the end of our tour. We went to stay at jurys inn heathrow which was a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “The "club room" website advertising is misleading. This is by no means afour-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianAbroad25
Reviews.Content: Always trust Trip Advisor, we realized after leaving early from this hotel. Good points: It's a great location and if you get a room for a good rate, you should be perfectly satisfied with what you get. Also, the gym has a pool - very rare in this neighbourhood. However, having booked at "club room" rates, I feel entitled to list all the manifold problems we encountered which, at the price we paid, were totally unacceptable. Among other things, we booked the "club room" rate partly because the website promised a separate, club-style room for breakfast. There was no such room. Surely this breaches advertising standards? Further, the hotel room was absolutely tiny: the bellhop could not have brought up our luggage because there would not have been enough room for all three of us. The pillows were lumpy, the walls were thin (we heard every single noise outside the door, including a man talking loudly in the corridor at 3am), the breakfast was unspeakable and served in a cavernous room staffed by understandably demoralized waiters (incidentally, ours had neck tattoo which showed over his collar). The hotel lobby and lifts are dingy and down at heel, and on the day we left there was a smell of electrical burning throughout the hotel. I feel sorry for the folks who work here - it must be awful to have to deal with disappointed travellers day in and day out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but staff not very helpful when you have a problem”
Reviews.Author: summerstar12
Reviews.Content: Good door service, good service from consierge and the room was clean etc, breakfast above average but could have done with having some cheese there. The main problem I had is that when we were checking in we had been booked into the wrong type of room and had been previously advised we had use of the Spa included in our package only to be told at check in that we hadn't and we would have to pay Â£8 each to use it! The staff were not very helpful until pushed as they said it is not their fault as we booked through the promotor that was running the NYE event and not the hotel direct but after some pushing they said they would see what they can do. After waiting for 30 mins we asked what is happening and was told that they couldn't do anything and we would have to contact the company we booked with (bearing in mind it was new years eve) but we did not accept this so the manager came and he did try to find an upgraded room for us but the hotel was fully booked so he could not do so. So they we asked he would sort out the use of the Spa for us as we had booked and paid extra to use it but he was not willing to do so, which I thought was extremely unhelpful as this would have only cost him Â£16 for both of us as a gesture of goodwill so we had to spend another 45mins trying to get hold of the booking company who then refunded us the money for the spa but by this time over 2 hours of our new years eve had gone we were not in the mood to use the spa anyway. I would stay there again but only if I booked direct as they are not willing to sort anything out if you book through a third party company as so many people do.

Reviews.Title: “I'm never going back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hsia
Reviews.Content: The tour agent helped us book the hotel and said that it was a 4*. When we checked into the room, the sound of construction and drilling made it impossible to rest. The room has a overpowering musky smell and it's the smallest hotel room I'd stayed in. The bed was uncomfortable and the heater doesn't work. Overall, the stay in the hotel was not a pleasant one. Other than its central location, there's no reason to go back to this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: 060211b
Reviews.Content: When travelling on business, there are only three things that I look for in a hotel. A comfy bed, a warm shower and a decent breakfast. Although I didn't have breakfast in the hotel so I can't rate that, the hotel failed on the other two. The room I stayed in was a small twin. The decor is very tired and in desparate need of refurbishment and this perhaps gave the feel that the room was not clean. The bed was OK, not the comfiest I've slept in and that it moved about when you sat on it wasn't ideal. However, for a hotel not to be able to offer a hot shower in the morning is a cardinal sin. My shower was lukewarm at best. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust hotel websites! A Con!”
Reviews.Author: theflyingbadger
Reviews.Content: We were excited about staying in Kensington, and looking forward to a nice 4 star hotel after a long haul flight. After checking the hotel website, it looked perfect. As soon as our cab pulled up we new we had been conned! Check in was lifeless, the room tiny, the hotel decor shabby, the restaurant and bar boring (and avoided), and the buffet breakfast without flavour! Having come from a 5 star hotel in Malaysia the night before, Kensington Close owners/management should be embarrassed to advertise it as a 4 star hotel in London. If we had known the reality of this hotel we would definitely have booked elsewhere in Kensington. Very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep factory. Wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: Swissmex
Reviews.Content: If what you are looking for is a bed in a great location in Kensington, this is fine, but don't expect any charm or personal touch. You feel like in one of 500 shoeboxes. The bathrooms are weird...the shower curtains don't protect all the open space: you pull one side and the other one stays uncovered, and vice versa. Again...the location is great! Right next to a tube station, and tons of shops and restaurants around. The breakfast room looks more like a boarding school refectory from a century ago: you march to your table and get factory-processed food. "Fun" fact: I stayed there for one whole week and they play the exact same CD every single day with the same three songs every day: I was going crazy, kind of like Groundhog Day. Room is minuscule, but I guess this is central London. Bed is comfortable though.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel with very unhelpful staff and the worst building work outside which meant no sleep!”
Reviews.Author: livvy25032
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by my boss. im not quite sure why he booked it. It was one of the worst hotels i have ever stayed in. I have stayed in better youth hostels and bed and breakfasts. We checked in nobody told us about the construction work that was happening outside the hotel it was obvious to see though as its covered in scaffolding! we were only staying for one night thank goodness! after returning from our meal we headed to our rooms and went to sleep only to be awaken by drilling noise which felt like it was coming through our wall at 8.00am. There was no way anyone could sleep through this, to see what was going on i opened the curtins and outside my window on scaffolding there was a builder looking directly at me through my window. I rang reception so they could hear the noise and complain but there was no answer. Me and another girl were sharing a room we decided it was best to just get out of the room! so all in all an awful stay, i would not recommend it the pictures look nice on the website but its nothing like that you have to pay for the gym, pool and breakfast looked like a rip off. The bar wasnt open late like it said either. The only good part was the check out.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at this hotel, would not even rate it a 2 star.”
Reviews.Author: janice018
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd read trip advisor before booking. We think this 4 night stay was the worst hotel experience anywhere in the world, and we've stayed in quite a lot! After bkg & reading reviews I e-mailed my concerns, but was assured we would have "a nice room" We were 1st shown to a tatty shoebox with the bed & lumpy bedcloths squashed against the wall. We moved twice during our stay, each time being assured we would have hot water & a quiet room. Each day & evening the water was too cold to bath our shower. We were woken at 8am sharp each workday by workmen on the scaffolding outside. Same as a report in Nov quoted this was still a worksite. Something the management seemed to deny to Hotel Direct who we bookd through. Hopefully they will come up with a refund & warning to others about staying here. Even the best rooms offered are extremely poor & small. They charge Â£8 on top per person per day to use the pool. All the hallways & breakfast room were very cold. Some people ate breakfast with coats on. The orange juice tasted watered down, only the cheapest streaky bacon & little fruit selection, also only white sliced bread some days. Hotel kept insisting it was not their policy to return money & kept wasting our time going back to reception to try to get anywhere. A very poor holiday experience. No chain hotel such as Hilton Marriott, Thistle & Holiday Inn would be anywhere in comparison, so I dont know how it can keep its 4 star. Seems most over reports say the same, never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty terrible. Ignore the images of the lobby on their website.”
Reviews.Author: mes1977
Reviews.Content: There is a reason the rates at this hotel are so "reasonable". The website shows some wonderful images of a very modern, clean and bright looking lobby, but there is more artistic license taken here than I've ever seen. The main reason I'm reviewing this hotel is because the shower in my room didn't work at all, and the bath took 30 minutes to fill up 3 inches. I reported my disappointment to the front desk when I was checking out, expecting it was reasonable to expect some form of compensation. Instead, I was told as I hadn't asked maintenance to look at it before I checked out, there was nothing they were prepared to do. Avoid is an understatement.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Swede1199
Reviews.Content: Although the Kensington close hotel seem to be a nice and large hotel with a lot of foreign visitors, they mis out in service. It's run by processes rather than friendliness and understanding. The rooms are very small, but modernized and good enough if you stay a couple of nights. I ran into reception personell that worked in their "box", not able to fulfil the simplest request like ordering a taxi to the next morning, or for that matter being able to pass on an envolope to another party. They kept pointing at the concierge desk, which was unmanned for at least ten minutes when I wanted their services. Next time I will stay at another hotel, with the name "service" written all over the place. The Kensington Close Hotel is far from being in the service sector.

Reviews.Title: “Never a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jensen56
Reviews.Content: A small room with a broken window. The cleaning staff was insufficient - our room was cleaned at 4 p.m. Breakfast que was a dissaster - they know exact how many people have ordered breakfast, so they could have used more rooms than the one they use. No cheese, no ham and only very ordinairy things they serve. As an individual traveller we did not get any service, staff refused helping us to check in at our flight. I have stayed in Quality hotel in Kensington (three stars) and the service was several times higher. How did this hotel get four stars? I only see one good thing about this hotel and it is the short distance to Kensington High Street.

Reviews.Title: “make sure your door is locked”
Reviews.Author: finneganSurrey
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was not very good. From the moment you arrive at reception staff make you wait excessive amounts of time, then when they do attend to you they make you feel that your an inconvenience. When we got to our room it was particularly small but more disturbing in a one night stay housekeepers entered our room unannounced twice while we were still in it , once while i was in the bath !. When i mentioned it at reception little or no interest was shown . I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal”
Reviews.Author: ZNA
Reviews.Content: I was actually looking forward to my stay having seen the hotel's website. The laboriously slow check-in was a big clue - that and the annoyed expression on staff faces. Eventually given a room that was a similar walk from Reception to that from the tube station. Room was about the size of a box of matches with, eeeww, blankets on the bed. Cold water only from the shower, workmen right outside the 6th floor window in the morning from 7am, Â£10 for internet, queue for breakfast - need I say more? Company paid direct so I don't know the cost but if it was more than Â£25 we were robbed. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Cold water, cold room, cold staff”
Reviews.Author: SirWalterDaventry
Reviews.Content: Not pleasant: there was no hot water (it was only luke warm). The shower didn't work, it just dripped out. The room was cold and even with the temperature control turned-up full it was like a fridge. And the staff couldn't give a fig! Unless you're into extreme sadomasochism give the place a miss.

Reviews.Title: “A Satisfactory Experience Overall”
Reviews.Author: GuamTraveler96921
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small (ours had a double bed and seemed a little roomier than our sons' room which had twin beds). The bathroom had an average-sized tub (with a shower), and the sink area was pretty small. The toilet area was a bit too narrow (the walls on either side seemed to be about two feet apart), so if you're a person of considerable size it would be a problem. Otherwise, the beds were pretty comfortable. It is in a GREAT location--underground station, restaurants, and shops are only a block away. Staff was friendly & helpful (especially one of their concierges, Graham). Our accommodations included full English breakfasts, so that was a plus. Overall, we were very satisfied and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever in terms of value for money”
Reviews.Author: woolgatherer
Reviews.Content: decadent, dirty, broken windows, bad service, and definitely to expensive for what you get. the location is alright, but you'll dread having to go back after a day around the city.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at this quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: searcher33
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning and left our luggage at the hotel .In the afternoon, we were allowed to check in early .The bedroom was very quiet and we slept well in the afternoon and all night.The beds were comfortable.Breakfast was very good.Check out and check in were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: djl44
Reviews.Content: Small room but Ok for a single traveller, always been put at back of this hotel, and wondered why, however when checking out last time I overheard some one saying they had a bad night due to the noise at the front of the hotel, with car alarms and drunken passers by. Great location - I love High Street Kensington and always feel very safe here as a single woman.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers!”
Reviews.Author: des11v
Reviews.Content: I travel to London frequently on business but on this occasion I brought my wife for a short break. As we were attending an event at the Albert Hall I chose the 4* Kensington Close Hotel because of its location. What a mistake! The room was small and cramped for 2 people. The in-room safe did not function. While we had towels for 2 people we had 1 shower gel and 1 shampoo! And these were not refreshed when the room was serviced next morning. And speaking of mornings there is a major extension underway and the contractors start their equipment at 8 am prompt. Worst of all was an ill-fitting window which allowed a gale force breeze in the room while the outside temp was 4C. This was an old propblem as 2 sides of the window had been taped up. On my way out I explained the problem to the Conceirge and he undertook to have the problem looked at. Looked at it was - maintenance removed the existing tape! I ended up stuffing the gaps in the window with toilet tissue!! There was no form in the room to ask about my stay and sad to say on checking out the clerk did not even ask. Avoid this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Set Your Expectation Low”
Reviews.Author: chefmarcus
Reviews.Content: Want an honest review about Kensington Close Hotel? My best description would be a bed factory! Not really got a lot going for it apart from location. Is it value for money then I would have to say no. It has been described as a building site well this is true with a large half completed structure at the rear and a wooden hording to the front with various areas within the hotel having works carried out with Very Loud drilling most of the day. The room we were given had been cleaned but not to the expected standard for this class of hotel and showed signs of excessive wear and tear. The public areas could also benefit from some attention to detail and then there is that smell quite unpleasant The staff were fine and no problems were encountered here, in fact the Concierge staff were quite helpful. We were aware that this hotel has had problems with their fire alarm. Well sure enough shortly after retiring there was alarm activation and we decided to leave the hotel I say this as some of the other guests stayed. We found our way out of the hotel and in to the service yard without seeing or receiving help from a single member of staff. This I can only describe as shameful. Once in the street we joined a large group of other guests. However at no point did there appear to be any sort of supervision from either the staff or the management of the hotel. We eventually returned to our room when the gathered crowd of guests started returning to the hotel. Finally the Breakfast. Poor quality, poor value and cold. I would I choose this Hotel again? No way, No chance never!

Reviews.Title: “Dire hotel surrounded in building works”
Reviews.Author: MarkieJ64
Reviews.Content: Booked this stay through Lastminute.com and the room was a joke compared to some of the places that we have stayed in London before. The noise from the builders outside our door was ridiculous. They had metal band saws cutting through metal and a crane moving and dropping things. We couldnt even have a conversation in our room as we couldntt hear each other. When i asked politely to be moved for our second and third nights i was told "yes we can move you but theres not really any point as the building works are taking place on all 4 sides of the hotel! We were assured that the builders would not be around at the weeknd which they werent. Was disappointed with their attitude on the front desk and was further told "if you have a problem go take it up with the people you biooked with!" I called LM.Com and stayed on the phone 19 minutes in the middle of Lodon being told my call was important but spoke to no one so not overly impressed with LM.Com either. Certainly would not recommend this aged, grotty hotel to anyone. Hope that helps. Its a good location but please call and ask about the building works before you book. Mark

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: deepakjain21
Reviews.Content: The place is amazing. The location is very good and suitable for tourists, business people. I stayed in the hotel for 45 days and I really enjoyed my stay in the hotel. They have all the facilities and have all kind of rooms available. I liked the spa very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ClaireCoDown
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location as its only 5 minutes from Kensington High Street tube station. However its tired and in need of an upgrade. I was upgarded from a basic room to an executive room which was great, however the room was terribly small and cramped I dread to think what the basic one was like! Its fine as a base in central London but I wont be returning, there are much nicer hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “DONÂ´T BOOK THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: nroucos
Reviews.Content: From the entrance to the hotel,jwhere one smells the damp carpet, to the check-in moment, where I was told by the receptionist to wait as she was busy doing something else, to the horrible bed, the complete lack of hot water as a result of which I was unable to take a shower, to the decrepid state of the corridors and to the lack of attention from Management who completely disregard a complaint, not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a cesspool staffed with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Morisatokun
Reviews.Content: Let's see, unclean room, uneven floors, broken shower, no hot water...Asked staff for a new room and not accommodating...complained to manager Steve and he didn't really care...no apologies given and no attempt to make amends...STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a 4 star standard hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SKNOWLES
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was supercilious & unfriendly. The bedroom was very small & cramped, the bedroom carpet was dirty & stained, the curtains discoloured & faded, the painwork & walls dirty & chipped. Black mould (UGH!) was round the basin taps, and only 1 little shower gel between 2 people for 2 days. Not even a jammie dodger or bourbon biscuit - NOT GOOD. HOW CAN THIS BE CLASSED AS A 4 STAR HOTEL?

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: rl2896
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel as part of a longer trip to England. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well appointed and the breakfast buffet that was included in our stay was very good. The location is first rate with easy access to tube and buses. Kensington has great shopping and lovely walks to museums and parks. The hotel is going through extensive construction of an addition at the back where our room was located, but this only caused minor noise inconvenience. I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Struthilde
Reviews.Content: Booked a stay at the Kensington Close as the hotel we usually stay at was full, and had been recommended this hotel by a friend. We were very, very disappointed by the experience of staying here. When we arrived, we were ushered through the side entrance(!), and I was then charged a Â£90 security deposit on check-in which I had not been made aware of in advance (the room was pre-paid). Then there's the room, which was tiny and cramped and not very clean, the bathroom was very tiny and there was very little water pressure in the shower, which also went stone cold when the second person showered. The worst of all, though, was the leaking toilet. There was toilet water leaking out onto the floor, forming a puddle in front of entrance to bathroom. We complained at reception and they sent a man up to have a look, I went up to fetch my sunglasses and he was there. I showed him the leak and he asked how many more nights we were staying, I told him four. He made a face but said nothing. That was the last we heard of the matter, the leak was not fixed nor was the shower, and we were not offered a new room. The toilets in the lobby area were almost always blocked/didn't flush. Possibly we were treated this way because we made our booking through a "bargain" booking site and paid up front, but I can't really say that makes it ok.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauras_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend, I was glad we were not staying longer. Where do I begin. You may read that the rooms are small, well I am a slim person and I had trouble getting between the bottom of the bed and the wall. Also between the side of the bed and the wall. There was evidence that mold had been cleaned from one wall. By the end of the weekend it had returned. The window was filthy and had mold on the inside. On the outside there was scaffolding and building work. We were woken early by a workman who was only feet from our bedroom window. There had been a function on in the hotel the night before and the thumping base could be heard clearly on the third floor and this function went on until 4am. There is tea and coffee provided but don't use the tea as it won't be replaced!! Breakfast was the best thing about the hotel, but the breakfast room was so crowded that you could not enjoy this. There was so little room between the tables that the whole experience was terrible. Please listen to all the bad reviews there are on this site about this hotel and do not stay at it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, pleasant service, but late night fire alarms are disconcerting!”
Reviews.Author: cjjmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kensington Close for 3 nights. On our first night there the fire alarm went off at 1:30 a.m. and everyone had to leave their rooms and stand outside or in the lobby. Many people were still in their bathrobes or barefoot. The fire alarm went off again during breakfast on our second morning. At least people were dressed this time. Hotel sports bar was a pleasant but generic place to have a drink. If you are looking for old-world charm, stay and eat some place else. This hotel was much like an American chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful stay - very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: elou81
Reviews.Content: I recently staying at The Kensington Close Hotel as working nearby at an exhibition, the locaton is great right off High St Kensington and close to transport links. However I am never received such appaling service before from a hotel. Upon arrival we we asked to give our credit card details so they could charge any extras to the room, we had already prepaid for the rooms so asked if we could decline from doing this as we would not be using any of the hotel restaurants or bars. This was refused and they insisted on card details for preauthorisation, I handed over my card and was appalled that they tried to charge Â£400, I was not made aware of this high preauthorisation amount required on booking. The staff were extremely unhelpful with this and did not seem to appreciate that it was such a high amount they were asking for and threatened to cancel our reservation if we did not proceed with the preauthorisation!!! The rooms were simply tiny and ridiculous for the amount charged, we had a twin and there was not any space between the beds and it was more like sharing a double. There was no room for luggage in the room and we actually had to place our things in a colleagues room who had a bed spare. The TV didnt work at first and when it did the picture was unclear and only the basic 5 channels were available, quite suprising in the days of Freeview!!! The bathroom wasnt as clean as one would expect and the general hotel decor was very tired and certainly not how the website portrayed. Another thing the hotel boasts is being a spa hotel on its webpage, however when I tried to use the pool at 8pm after a busy day it was actually shut. I contacted reception to be told they had to be notified before you wanted to use it and there was actually an Â£8 charge to use it! I have never known a hotel to charge residents to use its facilties before - especially when paying over Â£150 per night!!!! Shocking service from all staff and would definately not stay again - do not be fooled by the website!

Reviews.Title: “Got it cheap but its very basic and needs upgrading.”
Reviews.Author: Jannerbloke
Reviews.Content: Can't complain too much because I got two nights here at short notice for a good price on Last Minute. I had a small sixth floor single room with a narrow windowed room of an active building site. Narrow difficult to use bathroom, barely wide enough to use lavatory, mirror too far behind basin to shave easily and an awkward in-bath shower. Very small old TV with about five channels with the sound distorted on most and the radio worse. There was a lot of night-time noise. The hotel was also having an early Halloween party on the Friday and there were hoards of lively males staying for the NFL. Booking in was efficient but leaving took forever and the concierge took an age to recover bags. Its a shortish walk down Wrights Lane from High Street Ken tube but remember that there are currently works on the Central Line and having to change at Notting Hill Gate is an added irritant if your travel is at peak times. I suppose I got my money's worth but I wouldn't come back.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: adelen
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying after reading the reviews on the site however I was favorably surprised .The room was small but clean .the bathroom was also spotlessand toiletires though nothing special were adequate. The staff were pleasant and helpful and the service at reception was very quick .The hotel is very close to the tube .It is not the best hotel i have ever stayed in but it was considerably cheaper than others we have stayed in and represented excellemt value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Can we have the window sill back sir?”
Reviews.Author: busman221
Reviews.Content: I love the Kensington area so decided to give this Hotel a shot as I seemed to be getting a good rate. I arrived to a 20 minute check in queue after a long journey which was not a great start. Anyway got to my room and as the other reviews say it was a tiny smelly kip to put it bluntly! The thing that amazed me however was that the window sill was sitting on the ground with 2 4 inch nails sticking out of it ! I couldnt believe it! I picked it up and went to reception to complain. I waited 10 minutes before I was even spoken to! To cut a long story short I was so insulted by the staff that I took my sill to the pay as you go computer and booked another hotel as I would have rather stayed on the street than this hole. The duty manager told me that I was going to be charged for the room if I left so I lost it! I went back up to the queue which had around 10 people in it and in a very loud voice carried out the discussion with the duty manager while waving my window sill with nails sticking out of it. After 10 minutes of this I told him that I would make it my business to bring the hotel to court if they charged me. The best he could offer me was to ask me to reconsider leaving and if I did then he would have to get clearence from the GM the following day to refund my money..........talk about lack of power, they put him charge of a hotel but wont give him discrecion over 69 quid? Anyway they got their sill back, I left and the following day in fairness they called to confirm they wont charge me but the moral of the story is if it looks crap, reviews crap, sounds crap then it nearly always is crap! If you wish to enjoy your time in a hotel and have a relaxing break dont even think about it! If your a noisy spanish student that is on a budget then book away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay in close to central London and Tube”
Reviews.Author: judemarie
Reviews.Content: Having read quite a lot of negative reviews prior to our arriving at the hotel I was very pleasently surprised to see than none of what I had read was true. The room was more than adequate for the both of us the ensuite was roomy, cleanliness was obvious. We were extremely happy with our room. The breakfast was just amazing the selections were plenty to choose from and no restriction on amount you wanted to eat. Certainly one left ffortified for a days sight seeing. The closeness to the tube was wonderful you were soon in central London. It is hard to define what we liked best as we were so fully satisfied with the hotel, the staff, the cleanliness, breakfast. I really can't find anything to make a complaint about. But recommend the hotel, and would most certainly stay there again if I return to London.

Reviews.Title: “We would certainly stay at Kensington Close Hotel again”
Reviews.Author: chaplin30
Reviews.Content: Were concerned when we read the reviews we had made a mistake in booking this hotel, but we found staff pleasant and friendly,bedroom was excellent, clean and tidy and food was good.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay- really convenient”
Reviews.Author: gerbie_10
Reviews.Content: We read reviews on this hotel and were concerned when our travel agent booked us there. However it was much better than expected. We arrived after an all night flight at 10 am. Checkin was 2:00 Staff was very understanding and told us to go have a coffee and check back in 1 hour.
