We were in our room by 11:00 The room was small but entirely adequate THINK ABOUT A CABIN ON A CRUISE SHIP} HOWEVER IT WAS CLEAN . Staff in all areas were very friendly and courteous. Especially the concierge who helped us with maps and booking theater. The coffee server in the breakfast room remembered how we liked our coffee and even said hi when we met us on the street. Location was very good. Only one block to the subway. We got an oyster pass and went all over London by bus or subway

Reviews.Title: “Damp, Musty Hotel, Shower not working. Toilet cramped”
Reviews.Author: Pwally_15
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9am on Saturday morning. Was told slighly harshly that we couldn't check in until 2pm. We guessed this already and were more interested in asking where we could leave out luggage as we wanted to "explore" London. Concierge service was good. Arrived back around 4:30 and checked in fine. Our room was on the top floor. The room itself was big enough. It was cold in our room and attempted to switch on the air conditioning to warm the room. Couldn't get it to work. Had an electric fan heater sent up to our room. Looked in the bathroom. Shower, sink and toilet as usual. The toilet was cramped. There must have been about 8 inches between the rim of the toilet bowl and the wall so when sitting on the toilet, my knees and head were almost touching the wall. (There is no way you could sit on the toilet and read a newspaper!!!) As we heading to a show up the West End, we prepared to shower and change etc but 10 minutes after turning on the shower, it was still cold. Called recpeption who sent up maintennace man who fiddled a round and finally got the shower to be warm. Next morning, attempted to have a shower but to no avail. May as well have used a tea spoon of water to wash in. The shower was just a trickle or just dip drip. Went for breakfast which was good. Checked out and made complaint about shower etc etc but the girl on reception just said sorry and would make a note to the manager. Whether she will or not, I will never know?? General impression of the hotel was damp, musty all the way from reception, to the sports bar, to the corridors to the rooms. For a 4 star hotel, I would expect a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim048
Reviews.Content: Really was the smallest room/closet I have ever stayed in. Bring earplugs because if the doors slamming at all hours of the morning doesn't keep you awake, then the building work or tapping of pipes through the wall will. Hotel felt dingy and a walk through the bar to reception should come with a health warning. I hope that smell was only damp. Most of the staff were pleasant enough. I did however see the rudest concierge I had ever seen. A young local guy, he really didn't want to be there. I don't blame him.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyDunedinnz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The rooms are small but adaquate. However avoid the rooms on the top floor as there is very loud motor noise. We asked to be moved and were put on the 4th floor and it was much quieter. Good breakfast and coceierge staff very knowlagable and helpfull. It's a shame the reception staff could not be the same as they were very rude and unhelpfull. Internet did not work for the whole time we were there. This hotel is in a good location close the tube station and Marks and Spencer food hall. We found this hotel to be value for money for the area that it is in and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad staff, rooms smell like ammoniak...”
Reviews.Author: Kostja
Reviews.Content: Bad staff, rooms smell like ammoniak, dirty rooms and dirty bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit run down but undergoing refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: AnaAngelica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kensington Close 3 nights before our tour and two nights afterwards. We were given different rooms which made our stay different. All three rooms were bigger and more comfortable on arrival than on departure. Breakfast was great; got you through part of the day. Huge breakfast room. Very good service. The back garden and pond shown on the hotel brochure are inexsistent but the hotel is now undergoing major refurbishment so I suppose they'll be back. A pity they don't have internet connection in the lounge. Rooms were clean and some were prettier than others. Great location just two blocks away from Kensington High Street and the station. Marks and Spencer Simply Food right by the station. Lovely neighbourhood. Within walking distance of Notting Hill and Kensington Gardens. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The worst among 3* hotels , shouldn't have 4*”
Reviews.Author: alexludch
Reviews.Content: The tiniest room, sheets with holes in them, the bed on wheels started rolling away from the wall even when I coughed/ A few times woke up with fear because I was moving towards the window as I turned in the bed while sleeping. The toilet didn't flush and had to ask a few times three days in a row to fix it. Nobody did until I got really angry. All the furniture was simply rubbish. Terrifying memories!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Diana1941
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were ridiculously tiny! There are much better locations you can stay at with more supermarkets, everyday living shops etc. I would recommend the Bayswater are. We stayed at the Best Western there and even though it was a basic hotel, the location was great, rooms much more spacious and the shops and internet were great. The K Close has no computers at all for public usage and no free wifi. The only close computer access is in the hotel next door for 1 pound every 10 mins! Total rip off for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - Better hotels out there”
Reviews.Author: sbprwilliams
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night on 27th September. I was meeting friends from Australia & this was the hotel their travel agent booked for them. On the surface the room was small which I have no problem with really. However the room needs a total overhaul. There are old 70's style (plastic) fixtures in the bathroom. Terrible colour pallet (orange & yellow check) in the main room. The bed should have been trown out 10 years ago it was that old & dirty. The bed head curves outwards so you can not rest agains it to crane your head upward s at the old 34cm analogue tv. The chair needed pillows for padding. Room service food was good though Â£18.00 for steak & fries (thats it), no salad or vegetables was a bit much to charge. There is also a Â£3.00 tray fee added to every order. I guess people can't live without tacky room service trays & the hotel has decided to charge everyone for this. I spent ages trying to get to sleep as the bed was lumpy. I finally got to sleep but I was woken at 8am by electric drills & hammers just outside my window. Thats right, the hotel is currently having major works done. I made myself a coffee & rested as best I could when at 9am the fire alarm went off. The entire hotel had to be evacuated. Just perfect. The evacuation gave me another option for breakfast. I walked to Nero's Cafe on High Street & for a large coffee & pastry for less than Â£4.00. Thake that expensive grubby hotel. Location is perfect - That's the only positive so do yourselves a favour & checkout other hotels in the area. They have got to be be better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Shocked at the poor standards.”
Reviews.Author: doddy54Bolton
Reviews.Content: A weekend with friends to celebrate a 60th birthday. Small twin room with an tiny bathroom. Toilet area very cramped. Shower below head height. Moved by bed 6 inches away from the wall to see if there was a plug socket and found a used condom on the floor. I rang the manager and his response was "Do you want it moved". I said that it was a disgrace as the bedding could not have been changed without seeing it. I demanded and got a fresh room. (Same size but cleaner). Dont go for breakfast between 8 and 9 as you will have to queue for a seat for around 15 mins. Manager apologised for the condom in the room the night before and offered a 20% discount for evening meal. We took him up on his offer. The rest of the party went for meals that included fries and I went for the beer battered fish with chunky chips and mushhy peas. (Costing a very expensive Â£12.50). What arrived was a grey coloured obviously frozen fish together with FRIES. I didn't even bother to taste and sent it straight back. Ten minutes later the same fish and peas returned, but with a change to frozen WEDGES. I sent them back again and told the head waiter that I expected fresh food as advertised on the menu. Ten minutes went by and he came up to me and said they had no fresh fish. I said that was OK I would have the fish goujons instead. Ten minutes later he returned and said they had run out of chunky chips. I then asked if they had any potatos .... he said yes did I want them instead. I started to laugh at this point and said please tell the chef to get the potatos, peel them, cut them into chunky sections and deep fry them. An hour after my friends had finished a plate arrived with a piece of lovely fresh fish and chunky chips. Lazy chef though he could get away with sub standard frozen food at top prices. Add this to lazy housekeeping staff and poor middle management. You be the judge!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really really average (not what a 4* should be!)”
Reviews.Author: Sophinda
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a birthday treat for my partner so we could go and watch the football, go to London Dungeon, Harrods etc. A really city break splurge. The idea was to stay somewhere quite cheap as we wouldn't spend much time there but quite nice at the same time. This hotel pretty much fitted the bill - cheap for a four star so it wasn't vile but then it wasn't amazing. If I hadn't got a cheap deal I would never have even considered staying there. The downstairs was quite nice but there always seemed to be a massive queue for reception. I was glad that at check out all you have to do is drop your key in a bin otherwise we would've missed the train home. The room wasn't as bad as what I had read on here. It seemed tidy, nicely decorated and wasn't as tiny as everyone seems to make out. (Though it's not exactly huge either.) It could have done with a spot of work though, the electricity plugs were in highly unuseful places, the bar holding the shower curtain up had broken, as had the loo roll holder and the tv was tiny. I work in a 3* hotel myself and our tv's are double the size! However none of that really affected the trip, that's just me being fussy. What was annoying was the bed was on wheels and it moved about at the slightest movement. There was also an incredibly loud genorator outside the window (even though we were on 7th floor). The main annoyance was the heating. February this year was freezing, it snowed the whole time we were in Londonso when we came into the hotel from the cold, going into a cold room was not nice. then if you want the heating on it whirs away so loudly you don't get any sleep. So you have two choices - get no sleep due to the freezing temperatures or get no sleep due to the very very noisy heating. (I imagine this isn't a problem in summer!) One last thing that was annoying was the location. I thought circle line was a good choice but when we were there the circle line seemed to close early in the evening and the district line never went straight there, We had to go to Earl's court and then change to another district train. I was late for my dinner reservations because of this. I would not stay here again and I would not recommend to a friend just because I think you could find something better. However it was not the worst hotel in the world. (but at 4 star it shouldn't be!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Fletchiebrew
Reviews.Content: Apart from its location this hotel doesnt have anything good going for it. You can get much better for the money even in London.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ajgoldar
Reviews.Content: Our room had the door broken, and our double bed could not fit one of us. The trick is to upgrade you to a club room, that offers a normal double bed, paying additional 50 GBP per night. Staff not involved.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Vickypage
Reviews.Content: I have been booked here many times by my firm. Beyond the sleek reception area lies a very shabby, tired interior. The rooms are cramped and, although reasonably well appointed, are not very clean. The carpets need replacing and the bathrrom floors are often cracked and have hairs on the floor left from previous guests! The hotel caters for large groups of young people and they are often very noisy during the night. I have never slept well here. Even when I specifically asked for a quiet room, I was put by the lift shaft and over the generators! The beds can be uncomfortable. Once I had an executive double room which had two single beds pushed together. They were of different heights and I slept very badly indeed. The food in the restaurant is appalling. Breakfast is poor too. They are not even able to provide a pot of hot tea! The spa facilities are good and clean, but you have to pick a quiet time otherwise they are very cramped and noisy. The staff have a poor command of the English language and this can make complaints difficult. On one occasion, I had to complain as the housekeeper had left a wet flannel on my suitcase - which left a mark. The staff were not that concerned about this. Drinks are expensive in the bar. They charge you a service charge just for pouring it when you order at the bar! It's location is the only thing in its favour. Very close to the tube station and good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Well, I LIKED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bobinedmonton
Reviews.Content: My room was on the third floor, and yes, you can hear street noise with the window open, so I closed it and turned on the air conditioning. Problem solved. The room was spotless, the bed was nice and comfortable, the bathroom was really modern and clean with a nice shower and good water pressure. Service speed at the front desk can be improved, but that's my only complaint. Location is fantastic. Based on some other reviews, I wonder if I stayed at the same Hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Barely Adequate but Great Location to Tube”
Reviews.Author: NJD59
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff for the most part is either unavailable or behave as if put upon. Daily there was an unpleasant fishy smell on the bottom level. Rooms are bare minimum. Bed springs could be felt. It's inexpensive (based on London standards) and close to Tube are it's only attractive features. Also, they conveniently require a deposit of one night's stay in the event you make hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “shabby, awful, dump”
Reviews.Author: vegas12330
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT 4 star, not even a 2 star. We checked in and were given a shabby room on the 7th floor. I am a light sleeper and could not sleep for the noise of floorboards creeking it was so bad. Nobody's fault exept the dump ooops hotel!!. Called reception and they moved us to room 502, this was at 11.30 at night. The Duty manager told us he would take us to the new room, he did and we put the card in, however the guest in the room was not too happy to see a visitor!!. The manager said he did not kno the room was occupied. We were then moved to the best room in the hotel ( smashed glass door, stained carpet, mould on the window screen) if this is the best god help anyone staying there. When we eventually got our room after 00.15, we were disgusted. The hotel manager would not talk to me the next day and the duty manager thought that we would be happy with a free breakfast. I refused, having seen the poor standards I would not have eaten in that place EVER!!, dread to think the state of the kitchen, going by what I have seen. I was then offered a free upgrade if I wanted to go back. This confirmed the management are insane, I would not kennel my dogs in that place. I genuinely hope that people read this eview and avoid this dump at all costs. Its old, very shabby, dirty,rundown and has a hopeless management team. Who think that moving a woman and child into a room already occupied then telling us to wait by a lift for 10 mins late at night with all our luggage is reasonable and they could not care less.All they want is the payment. STAY AWAY. Even if you get it for free

Reviews.Title: “It's a gamble”
Reviews.Author: Patricknz1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed before and been quite happy - this time around - very unimpressed. Stayed for 5 nights. 1. Asked to be put on a higher level - put on 1st floor. 2. Asked for a room change as previously was in same rate - this room was about 20 years older in decor and state. No room change. 3. Woke up to strong smell of bacon coming into my room. My expectations were maybe too high - this was due to my previous stay - nice front desk and new/clean room. Not going back - if you book for 5 nights in a hotel you have been to more than once would you not expect to be treated slightly better ?

Reviews.Title: “Save your money, buy a tent”
Reviews.Author: bdub22
Reviews.Content: Noisy noisy noisy. There is noise every night till 3am outside from a local business loading trucks. They are currently doing contruction to the hotel and there is constant drilling noises coming from the roof at random hours. Wi-fi internet is not included and is an extra charge. Not to mention the internet is charged hourly from the time you sign on so if you buy two hours and only use one, the extra hour is wasted eventhough you paid for it. The room I stayed in smelled like a dirty gym sock, the room's safe did not work, there are no luxories besides a 13" tv with 5 channels, no alarm clock, refrigerator...etc. It's a great location but that is it. Other than that you will probably be better off being a bum on the streets for the time of your visit. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great location but 3 star max”
Reviews.Author: leesm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as it was handy for concert at Hyde Park. Location is great but this is no way 4 or 5 star hotel, 3 at most. 1st room they gave us was very small & on 1st floor right above hotel entrance, there was constant traffic noise & buses stopping right underneath dropping off guests, even with windows shut. Called reception & asked to be moved to a quieter room. Porter arrived with 5 mins to move us. 3rd floor room was larger & quieter. There was air con which was a bonus as was very hot weekend & bathroom was fine with good shower. Breakfast was good & plentiful but this is by no means a luxury hotel. Woken up early as corridors were quite noisy & doors seem to slam shut & could hear housekeeping chatting/laughing, they should be told to keep the noise down so early (didn't help my hangover!) Location is great, 2 mins from Kensington Hight Street & a short walk to Kensington Gdns & Hyde park.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsB03
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with partner. Checkin was fast and efficeint. Rooms are tiny but didn't let it bother me. Couldn't believe it, very, very old small, 14in tv (not even flat screen) and no digital or free view!! Location is great, tube station and shopping area, only 10 min walk from hotel. Have stayed in better hotels in London and don't think I would make another reservation to stay there in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Fire alarm morning calls”
Reviews.Author: Surely_see
Reviews.Content: Booked online for double, given a single at check-in. After discussion with front desk given a easy-access room that was crazy spacious but bizarre set-up, including no lock on door other than the card key system. Finally, got a decent "club" level room which was good. Major problem - stayed 2 nights and fire alarlm went off twice, both 4-5AM. One time actually had to vacate the building. Poorest sleep quality ever!

Reviews.Title: “Archaic plumbing”
Reviews.Author: regik15
Reviews.Content: Apart from the smallest hotel room I have ever seen, the plumbing was old and faulty. The toilet kept filling up with effluent which was flushed from rooms above and was disgusting. New sink taps had been fitted without plug controls and the maintenance man came around with a box of plugs on chains to supply to each room so the sink could be used.No internet available.

Reviews.Title: “UNETHICAL & HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: 365trips
Reviews.Content: The hotel failed to tell us that they were doing MAJOR CONSTRUCTION - i think they are adding an extension.. not sure but huge the crane on the roof .kind of gives it away.. Anyway THEY START WORK AT 6AM! When I called to complain they tried to tell me it was the garbage collection!!! laughable.. since when doe the garbage man drop huge metal piping on the ground! When I pressed further, they totall denied that there was even construction. BEWARE, this will be going on for quite a while so if you want to get any sleep- don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Nicki76
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a 4* hotel. Our room was tiny with scruffy furniture and exposed wiring from a broken fire alarm! The bathroom was also small and had dirty grouting a lot of which was missing in places. The bar turned off their pumps early so we had to have bottled beer and they turned off their TVs early which we, and others, were watching without saying they were going to do this or apologies. We went to view the gym but this too closed early so we couldn't. We were very disappointed with our stay and would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: Michellelb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our Honeymoon in London and stayed here for 9 days . The rooms are clean and the staff was exceptional . Yes the rooms are very small but that is a norm in Europe . And honestly who cares your just sleeping there . The breakfast was typical English style . The hotel is very close to the tube . Very quiet hotel . Car service to and from the hotel was also a pleasure . Resteraunts in the area are very good and if your looking for local pub food The Goat is a great place !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely London”
Reviews.Author: malfroj
Reviews.Content: Very lovely, clean and comfortable. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, compact rooms , very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Eilis7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the 09th & 10th August 2010 with family, we had three rooms, I booked the hotel for location, gym facilities and what we thought was value for money. We were checked in by a pleasant receptionist, only surprise here was to be told we had to pay â‚¬8.00 per person per day to use the gym facilities. I dont mind having to pay to use these facilities but this should be stated clearly when booking the hotel. All I can say about the rooms is that they are dated and compact, however there was a strong smell of paint in one of the rooms(221). First morning we were awoken by someone knocking on our door looking for luggage at 06.45am, at first we didn't respond but the knocking got louder and louder, got up explained we were not departing but porter continued to ask for our luggage, I had to get thick in the end and tell him to go away and leave us alone. Second morning awakened at 05.45am approx by the fire alarm, myself and sister got up and got my daughter and niece up in room 228 and proceeded to the stairs to exit the hotel, bit worried about the other two members of our family as they were on the 7th floor in room730. We exited the hotel and went to the other side of the road. We never encountered a member of staff during this whole proceedure, the guests basically directed themselves as to where to go, thank god it all took place in an orderly fashion. Two fire tenders arrived but just double parked outside the hotel for about 15mins and then departed. A man then announced we could all re-enter and go back to bed, no explanation given!!!! Fortunately we were able to get back to sleep but at 8.00am awoken again by two workmen directly outside our window talking. There was scaffolding erected directly outside the window, maybe they were painting? I have no idea!!!Anyway, we were only in London for a two night break but have arrived home in need of a break, did complain to reception but no explanations given, just a blank expression and sorry for the inconvenience not much use when I paid â‚¬720.00 for the two night stay for the six of us!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay, great clean room with comfortable bed, brill breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Deborah666084
Reviews.Content: Took my niece for first trip to London, booked hotel and then read reviews and was worried what exactly I had booked !! We found all staff helpful and friendly. The twin room was clean and the beds very comfortable (and bigger than I have stayed in, in other hotels in London). The breakfast was fab - we had a great stay. I would definately use this hotel again - Brilliantly placed for underground.

Reviews.Title: “I dont undestand the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: jls1967
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and read before hand some damning reviews about the hotel. I was delighted to find the exact opposite of what so many negative people had written. The staff on arrival were polite and helpful giving me all the detailed information that I required. Everything else was clearly indicated in the booklet in the room. The lobby and corridoors were beautifully finished. When I got the the room, i found a spacious and extremely clean room. This was a standard double room and it was immaculately clean. Soft pillows and a good sized bed with plenty room around it. Ample space for luggage and a wardrobe that had enough hangers etc for my stay. The bathroom was extremely clean - I noticed that there was no dust or dirt ontop of the shower rail - a sure sign that care is taken with housekeeping. i was impressed with the fact that the room was given bath sheets rath than bath towels and, even on days when I didn't require frash towels, new ones were given. The stanadard of cleanliness is exceptional and all credit to the housekeeping team as I could not fault the room. I didn't eat in the restaurant so i cant comment on food etc. i did use the bar and found the staff friendly and polite. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and would stay here again without any problems

Reviews.Title: “This is not a four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ecade
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the location and the four stars. We were truly disappointed by the quality of the mattresses which were long past their prime. Our phone did not work and many reminders to the front desk accomplished nothing. We moved on the third night and had to pay an upgrade. The bed was still awful Many renovations were taking place - they are sorely needed. All computers were down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: lilster_10
Reviews.Content: Most of the staff were very good. we eat in the smoke blue restaurant on the first night, food was great and the man running the restaurant was very helpful. I booked double rooms and ended up with 3 quarter beds, you could only get in from one side (which I count this as a single rooms). Management not very customer frendly or helpful and all they kepted on saying was you are only paying a low rate (this was the rate the hotel web site and reservations quoted me). Reservation did not know what was included in the rate quoted and I was not informed about the building work. This could be a lovely hotel if the staff were better and the building had a bit of TLC This hotel could do with a little TLC and could be a great as it is in a great location

Reviews.Title: “simply awful experience”
Reviews.Author: PeterAdP
Reviews.Content: Jack-hammers at 8am every morning of our stay, a 'smoke-free" room that stinks of cigarette smoke, front desk who seriously expect one to leave your credit card with them as security for any "extras" and who 'dock' more than the agreed room rate from your card on arrival "in case you spend anything extra", exhorbitant charges for internet access, an "executive double room" in which one can just about touch all 4 walls and which is no larger than "standard" double rooms, a room next to a luggage lift operating all hours of day and night unresponsive, unavailable management . All this a part of our one and only and last stay at this awful hotel. Avoid this hotel if you can!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: SerenEnfys
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a convenient location, minutes from the shops and tube station, and is clearly a favourite with tourists. The rooms are basic and the usual small size of London hotel rooms. Other reviews say that the hotel is impressive in the reception area, and how this does not extend to the restof the hotel and this is true. It is lso true that I encountered staff who had limited English and were unable to understand some basic questions (which was rather frustrating-especially when attempting to order drinks at the bar). This proved to be annoying when I went down for breakfast in the morning. The lady was supervising the busy restaurant told me that I had not paid for breakfast (when in fact my company had) and after supposedly checking by phoning reception, told me that I definitely had not. This then necessitated my going to reception to check myself, and the receptionist coming back with me so that I waas allowed in. As breakfast was a very busy affair, this whole process took 15 minutes, which was not ideal as I had an appointment inthe office I had to make, and almost skipped breakfast as a result. It was ok for one night, however its not somewhere I would be keen to return to having been to other London hotels which are much better (see other reviews) and in the same price bracket. I am not in the habit or writing neutral or negative reviews without good reason, and sadly this is one of these occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Best part about our stay - the location”
Reviews.Author: JS650
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to Kensington High Street shops and cafes and about two minutes walk to the tube station. This hotel is great for guests who want to spend a night/weekend close to central London. The price we paid was reasonable value for money in Kensington. You would pay a lot more to have a better room elsewhere in the area. However, I have stayed in other hotels in London for example in Greenwich (about 15mins from the centre by train) for significantly cheaper with better rooms. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. However, the room we stayed in was tiny. The double bed was pushed against the wall and there was barely enough room for two people to get ready at the same time. The dÃ©cor of the bedroom and bathroom was very tired and there were very basic and limited toiletries provided. There is a general feeling that the hotel is uncared for and the bare minimum is provided for the guests. The stairs to the fire escape looked like they had not been cleaned for years, many of the staff appeared tired/abrupt (however some were very friendly and helpful). The hotels website did not make clear that the (normal) car parking is actually the same price as the valet parking which is Â£32 per day. The car keys are left in reception as hotel staff may need to move the car during the stay. However, our experience was that staff seemed reluctant/not very confident in manoeuvring a car to allow us to get out of the car park at the end of our stay. We are also not advised that the hotel was within the congestion charge zone (although we had already researched this before our visit). There is also an extra charge for using the swimming pool and gym (Â£8 per day). Overall, our stay was â€œokayâ€� I probably wouldnâ€™t stay here again because I feel that I could have gotten much more for my money elsewhere in London.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine”
Reviews.Author: wayne_w1
Reviews.Content: We chose the Kensington as part of a theatre break package and stayed at the hotel for just the one night. Having read a number of poor reviews we were expecting the worsed but I have to say we were really pleased with our short stay. We were checked in an hour early by a very helpful young lady on reception and pointed in the direction of our room (368). The room was small but ample in size for the two of us. The room was clean, tidy and looked very much like the photos on the website. the aircon was a real blessing. The TV was a 12" portable with just the 5 channels, not really sure why some people consider this to be a bad thing, if you're in London why are you watching TV? We had a drink in the Sports bar before venturing into the city, the staff were all very friendly and effiicient, my only comment would be on the price of the drinks but hey! it's London. The hotel is perfectly situated with the Underground Circle line just two minutes walk away. The West End can be comfortably reached in around 20mins We had full English breakfast included in our room rate, the variety and quality of food on offer was really good, plenty of coffee was on hand from a roaming waitress. A very enjoyable experience and I'd certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: willye3
Reviews.Content: These were the smallest hotel rooms we've ever stayed in; but we understand that is the European way. There was air conditioning which is a must in the summer months. Very large bathroom. Good breakfast. Close to the tube. Friendly staff. Our door had a broken lock, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very exclusive!”
Reviews.Author: marcovanderkraan
Reviews.Content: Was tremendous! The food, especially the English breakfast was great. Only a pity, that you have to pay for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fake of a place!”
Reviews.Author: puppyloveLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked into the hotel on a staurday night and was totally digusted with the state of the place,the carpet was torn,it smelt mouldy and the fire alarm cap was off leaving all the wires exposed..im sure that is a health and safety measure that was suppose to have been dealt with,personally that room should never have been booked out to anybody!!I waited for my partner who was working late,the minute he walked in he told me to pack up our stuff to get out.He was tired and frustrated and wanted nothing more than to get out the place.The receptionist understood that we did not want to stay and i was led to believe that a refund would be provided since i did not stay the night..what a fool i was..The mangament has stood firmly on the fact that because i left the hotel that they will not be refunding me and the only compensation i can get is if i spend more money!! Please do not be fooled by the fancy pics,it is anything but what it looks like!!!I feel cheated and would never in a million years recommend this hotel to anybody because above all i do believe that for a business to be succesful u have to understand your customers...These people dont care about their customers and should be done for false advertising!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round experience for a London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lillypieryser
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to London for many years and I was there for a family wedding. My single room was small but very comfortable and clean with every amenity I needed for my stay. The buffet breakfast was excellent and you could eat up till11a.m at the weekend. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. The hotel was just a 10 mins walk from High Street Kensington tube I would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay is what you get. Good value”
Reviews.Author: Traveller007009
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the hotel before and I only can say, that no one should complain for the prices the hotel is charging, if you book with lastminute.com and so on. Yes, the rooms are small, but very clean. If you want a bigger room than go elsewhere but be prepared to pay much more, size cost money, especially in a city like London. The staff was always very polite and helpful, internet is quite expensive but usual for a hotel of this category to charge for it. All of the staff did speak very good english, therfore I don't understand why previous reviews alleged that many don't do . There is a great Sports Bar in the hotel, which was also a great experience. The Bar is expensive, but again hey you are in London and any hotel bar charges you more for your meal than your local pub in the Welsh countryside. All in all a good hotel for a short stay,if you want luxury, than you need to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, had a pleasent stay.”
Reviews.Author: Siobhany25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when on a west end break to see a show for a friends birthday. The hotel was in a nice location and were were impressed with the hotel. The rooms were nice, clean and comfortable. It is easily walkable to the tube station which took us to the theatre. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor poor hotel at this price”
Reviews.Author: LindsayMac
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms are grim, too small, poor standard. Executive rooms are of a better standard but still on the tired side. Food average to poor. Staff including management unhelpfull. Standard reply with a smile is sorry we can't do that........Can't even provide a copy of the invoice that was being sent to my company! I have no idea what they area charging for. Suspect could be fraudulent. ie charging for breakfasts that I did not have!!! Will do my utmost to never return. Just spend 2 weeks trying to like this hotel for its location. Given up on that idea.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: jessmidlands
Reviews.Content: We arrived by coach to this hotel, and the driver found it hard to park. When we arrived at the hotel we weren't welcomed, we went up to front desk and was told to wait for our keys, we then got told to follow them to sign for them but they didn't no where to go and it took two of them, we found it hard to communicate with any of the staff as they weren't English and looked at us gone out when we asked a question. When we got up to our room on the 6th floor, it was quite small but clean, just could do with a lick of paint.. On a positive the bed was really comfy and the shower was more like a power shower. They gave you the choice of some of there food on offer in a menu in the room, who would pay Â£7 for a egg sandwich!! The breakfast was ok not brilliant, i found the staff in there all quite rude, would let one of staff past not even a thankyou, where there manners were i do not know. Over all ok.

Reviews.Title: “THE USUAL AVERAGE LONDON HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: roadtripping1
Reviews.Content: If you are accustomed to travelling to London youâ€™ll know that most of medium category hotels have the same characteristics: small rooms, not too clean, bad service. Kensington Close is more or less the same but it has some good points about is. Locations is unbeatable: in the very heart of Kensington High Street, one minute walk from bus and tube stop. Rooms are absolutely tiny but ours was fairly clean: the bathroom was immaculate, sheets and towels were changed daily. Carpet and curtains were definitely worn out and in need of a good wash but for London they were ok. Personnel was nice, and breakfast (both continental and English), although not remarkable, was plentiful. The hotel is definitely not 4 stars, maybe a 3 stars but in London perfect location and cleanness are hard to find at a decent price so I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: christine48
Reviews.Content: I stayed in London last year for a sight-seeing holiday with my daughter and this hotel could not have been in a more perfect location. Very close to the underground! Also very close to Kensington High Street with a big variety of shops and restaurants, such as Urban Outfitters which kept me very happy :) There is even a cimena, which I went to at night time. There is also a little cafe called 'The Muffin Man' just a few steps from the hotel entrance, which served sandwiches, hot food, cakes, buns and snacks and stayed open 'till about 8pm I think which I ate in lots of times. I stayed here for four nights, but I wish I had stayed longer. The hotel is also beside the EMI music studios, so I thought that was cool :) The concierge was very helpful! The friendly man managed to book us tickets for things such as The London Eye & Madama Tussauds so we didn't have to queue. We really appreciated this. Despite all these advantages, there were a few downsides. The rooms were quite small I suppose, as stated before, but when you're visiting London, you want to get out and see the exciting city, not sit in your hotel room all day. Another dissapointment for me was that you had to pay extra for use of the hotel swimming pool, which I found very strange, considering the price for staying at the hotel. I can't remember much about the breakfasts, but I don't remember ever being hungry! They must have been adequate enough to satisfy me :) All in all, I enjoyed my stay here and if I was travelling to London again I am fairly confident that I would be more than happy to stay at this hotel again. Just a few words of advice for those travelling to London... if time permits, try to see at least one show. I recomend 'The Lion King' which I have seen twice, but still want to see again sometime. Also, be very wary of pickpockets! I would also like to note that I tend to be fussy and hard to please, but this hotel did the trick!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely ... the worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: CosmoWindsor
Reviews.Content: Surly, unhelpful reception desk staff; small rooms poorly cleaned and maintained; stayed for six days (paid in advance as part of a tour ... couldn't get out of it) and WiFi was out for the entire time. The only positives were the location - five minute walk to the tube station, and one of the concierge staffers ... but only one. And only five tv channels ... please. London is a great city. You'll enjoy it more if you stay ANYWHERE else.

Reviews.Title: “MY DOG HOUSE IS BIGGER THAN THEIR ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: importedinteriors
Reviews.Content: You will feel right at home if you were in the Super Max prison..rooms are approx. 8 feet by 12-14 feet, bathrooms are tiny..hotel is run down, doors are scratched, our T.V.did not work, the wash basin and tub did not drain, the electronic keys to the door rarely worked, we had to go to the reception every time to get them re-booted, the shower curtain covered only 75% of the tub, so by the time you finished your shower, the tiny bathroom was wet, asked for a wake up call..twice they failed to wake me up, on the last day, they called me three times even though i picked up the phone...the maids do a lousy job of cleaning the rooms, this place is a rip off...for 150.00 per night, you can do better

Reviews.Title: “We nicknamed this place the Kensington CRAP Hotel. Overpriced and Poor Quality.”
Reviews.Author: Artl11
Reviews.Content: On the upside this hotel is near the tube, on the downside it's old, they have construction going on all around this hotel and inside of it. Do not waste your time with the spa services, they are overpriced and very poor. The food was ok . They offer free Wi-Fi but they haven't had internet service for over a week now. Do not upgrade to a club room it will be worse. The standard rooms are very small so they convince you to upgrade and really you just upgrade to a bigger piece of crap. The staff was fairly decent and available. Housekeeping was very friendly. If you are just staying one night here you could survive. We stayed four and I wish we could have cancelled but they charge you. So we were stuck here.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Onward64
Reviews.Content: The first surprise about this hotel is the size. From the outside it looks unassuming. However it stretches so far back that the corridors could be used for the 100m sprint. I had a single room and was a little surprised that it had a single bed rather than the usual double/queen. For London, the rooms were average size; small but passable. Being a single room it was a little cramped. However, the Double rooms were perfectly adequate for two. The rooms are getting a little tired but were clean. The bed was very firm. Breakfast was more than adequate with a better than average buffet style.The internet cost was outrageously high. The outstanding feature is the location. The tube is only 200m away ready to whisk you to the centre of London. It is an easy walk to Kensington Palace and Gardens. Even Harrod's is within a few kilometres. There are plenty of pubs, cafes and restaurants around. My greatest concern was a fire alarm forced everyone to evacuate at 6am one morning . . .but not the fifth floor where no alarms sounded. On the street there was chaos, with no way of knowing if the guests were all out. We found a staff member and told them that our friends were still in their rooms. He shrugged disinterestedly and said no one is allowed in.The fire brigade came and soon the all clear was given to return. No one seemed concerned about what could have been a massive issue. It wouldn't stop me staying here, but I'd want to avoid the fifth floor or at least know exactly where the emergency exits are located

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best single room I've had.”
Reviews.Author: NicolaWales
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews I was concerned that a single room would be very small and the bathroom even smaller. It was small but more than adequate for my needs. It was nicely decorated and very clean. Breakfast was tasty and plentiful.The staff were pleasant and helpful. Location was good, quiet but close to Kensington High Street with all the shops, cafes, buses you may need plus a tube station. My only concern was in the bathroom, due to the design it was hard to get out of the bath and nothing to hold on to when getting out of the shower, as the bath was quite high this was potentially dangerous. Other people on the tour told me that they'd had a very different experience; the rooms being tired, small,and noisy air conditioners. I had dinner in the nearby Thai restaurant which was OK but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Kensington Close, is "Close" to Everything. Had a great time there.”
Reviews.Author: lesiab1
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel, the staff was friendly, the breakfast was good, and it was within walking distance to everywhere I wanted to go. Just up the street is a plaza and stores where I could find essential items that I needed as well as snacks, which are very important. :) The room was clean and roomy enough for 2 people. Room service was great and so was everyone we encountered inside the hotel. I am planning to return to London in the next few years and Kensington Close is definately where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “For the Price it had a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: casakey
Reviews.Content: The Hotel cannot be faulted for the weak US dollar. The room was small as expected. The restaurant was expensive as expected. The location was great as planned. The price of wireless Internet was really un called for. In this hotel and many others, the price of a adult movie was cheaper than finding out what the wireless Internet code fore my computer was. They had a nicer Gym for a price...I knew that ahead of time..no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Contrary to the bad reviews I found this...”
Reviews.Author: emz_ing
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the bad reviews I found this place quite pleasant. We payed Â£100 for a Saturday night which I thought wasn't too bad for central London in a nice area. To be fair the rooms are 3star standard but absolutely fine. Very good standard breakfast and a nice spa but it is a bit expensive for only a pool,jaccuzi, sauna and steam room at Â£8 per person per day. Watch out at check out because they tried to charge us again for the spa even though we paid cash. The receptionist didn't believe us but luckily we kept the receipt.other than that hiccup the staff were pleasant and so was our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Found the hotel very disapointing”
Reviews.Author: aleksander99
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we where presented with the smallest hotelroom I have ever seen. There was hardly any space to move around, especially when you have suitcases. The paint was scratched off doors and doorframes etc., the curtains where hanging off the rail. In the hallway the wallpaper was torne off. The hotel was in general very worne down. I don't understand that this is a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth it”
Reviews.Author: richardCurry
Reviews.Content: I got back into my room at 11.20p.m after a meeting. When i lay on the bed one leg collapsed(it was already broken and hadn't been repaired) I propped a couple of books under it. When i complained in the morning the manager didn't even come out of his office and offered me a free breakfast and to knock the service charge off my bar bill (Â£4) A shabby hotel both in decor and service. even if he had appeared and apologised. I bet the room was let with the broken bed the next night.If you want a swim its Â£8 a day extra! Never again

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jasminefairy1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 9.30 am after 4 1/2 hours of travel and although we knew we were too early to check-in, we wanted to leave our luggage safely in order to explore the city. Having arrived and been greeted by sour faced lady at reception, we were directed in the direction of concierge and told to come back at 2pm when check-in opened. The concierge, which I have agree with the comment below, was very rude. He grunted, threw some luggage tickets over the counter to us (not bothering to attach the other half to our bags) and from then on we knew how this stay would be! We returned at quarter to 3 only to be give someone else's case! Surprisingly ... they had been incorrectly labeled so couldn't find our last case and my fiance had to go down to the basement with the concierge to locate his own case! Checked-in, again with the same miserable reception staff and got our room, which was really really small. Had I been a bigger person, I would not have been able to fit down the tiny tiled corridor to the toilet! We went to a show that evening and upon our returned at midnight, were delighted to find teenagers everywhere, having a school party at the hotel and running completely riot. We got to our room on the 5th floor and an hour later these teenagers were screaming and running up and down the corridors, jumping in and out of the lifts and just causing mayhem, so complete lack of sleep that night and no attempt of control from the hotel staff. After checking out on Sunday morning, with a gentleman called Pascal, the first pleasant member of staff we had seen, we returned home. Upon checking my bank account this morning, it appears they have not only debited my account on check-in with their charge, but again on check-out?! I have been straight on the phone to the hotel to have been put on a "loop" for 10 minutes and then had to leave a message with switchboard as nobody as reception is available! Lets see how long I have to wait for my call back now. Would not rate this as a 4 star, would not recommend to anyone and the staff definitely need some customer service training if they wish to improve this place!! Not a pleasant experience and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: awayuk
Reviews.Content: On arrival at midnight (very tired after a long drive and when I simply want swift and professional service) the concierge really wasn't keen to give me access to the car park (Â£32 per 24 hours), made me wait around and was offhand with me. Once I parked in the creepy underground car park (next to a high pile of soiled matresses) a second, deeply unfriendly, concierge appeared in front of me (shudder) and demanded my keys then marched back to the hotel. I had to change rooms straight away as the noise on the 6th floor was unbearable (school trip). I was moved from a depressing prison cell style single room to a double. The concierge escorted me to the second room but didn't offer to carry any of my four bags (though I noticed how keen they were to assist the overseas guests on any and every occasion. The cynic in me assumes that good service is given in return for tips, otherwise forget it). The double room was shabby and worn-out. The wardrobe smelled of urine so I kept it firmly shut and my clothes in my suitcase. The safe didn't work. The linens were clean. There were only 4 channels on the TV. The breakfast was cold - really poor value all round. The â€˜poshâ€™ ambience the hotel tries (and fails) to create was laughably undermined by the textbook hookers I noticed popping in and out. The hotel isn't too hot on safety (see photograph). I returned the following weekend and a young concierge was exceptionally rude to me when I pulled up in my car and tried to speak to him about parking. To describe him as obnoxious is a compliment. I spoke to him about it and he grudgingly apologised, but it really isnâ€™t any way to communicate with paying customers (or indeed anybody) and the damage is done. Would I return? Never.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: m8knstamps
Reviews.Content: After being returned to this hotel after our bus tour, we were stranded in London for an undetermined period of time due to the no fly status. My husband went to reservations to inquire about rates and extending our stay while we tried to rebook our flight. We were given a rate for that Sunday and Monday of 129lb. We had to extend again, still no flight so he went back to reservation, requested that breakfast be removed from the room and he was given a rate of 109lb. We then had to extend again and they put him through on the phone to reservation who quoted him 79lb for Thursday. Having been given this information we decided to stay put since this is where our transfer from the airport would leave from. Many of the other travelers that were on our same tour went to another hotel because of the rates. But we felt that with these rates our travel insurance would cover us. Let me add that we had 2 rooms at these rates as there were 5 of us traveling. We finally got a flight on Friday. 30 minutes prior to our departure we went down to check out only to find out that the rates that my husband had quoted had not been honored. The Tues & Wed that he was quoted 109, we were billed 149. The last day we were given the 79 on one room, but the other was 109. We spent 40 minutes trying to get some satisfaction before we had to just sign it and go since our transfer was waiting for us. They did not budge 1lb. He would not even explain why we were charged different rates on the last day. He even tried to pull that these were the rates because of the volcano and that they had a lot of bookings even though we know that there were many cancellations because people couldn't get in. We had looked into renting a holiday rental on Wed. We went to talk to them Tues. night about checking out Wed. and they said we'd be charged because it wasn't 24 hour cancellation. There was ZERO assistance or consideration for all the travelers that were stranded. Here at home people were telling me how in Orlando, stranded travelers were being given free rooms and free tickets to the theme parks. We didn't get one break until we got home and were given a discount on the additional days that our car had been parked. The lesson learned and the advice I'd give to travelers, get everything in writing and not only the name of the person, but have them sign it. They don't honor what each other say and did nothing to help us in a bad situation. And don't get ripped off paying for the in room internet. 15 pounds and we constantly had to reconnect. Also, keep your bag on your lap. My mother's wallet was picked while we were sitting in the Lion's Pub. The gentleman in the pub was very concerned when we bought it to his attention and said he'd have someone talk to us before we checked out, but no one contacted us. We too were evacuated for a fire drill on 4/5. Luckily we were dressed read to start out on our bus tour. And yes, they are doing renovations, they were putting up beautiful wallpaper on the 3rd floor. Good thing,, because our shower was mildewed and the faucet didn't work right. But a couple days we were awakened by some very loud banging, apparent work being done underground, or in the basement, we didn't know. The most courteous and helpful people there, the young blonde that works in the pub and the men that got us our cabs. And if this is read, please don't say sorry, and you would like us to have a better stay next time, there will never be a next time. And I'll be writing to Cosmos to voice my complaints. Although we were out of Cosmos's hands at this point, I'm sure they'd like to know about your service.

Reviews.Title: “A woeful experience”
Reviews.Author: tbagfish
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about this hotel after reading reviews, but I wondered how bad it could really be paying about Â£100 a night for a 4 star hotel. The answer was 'very bad'. Upon checking in, I was given a twin room when I had booked a double. Hotel staff told me to call Reservations and confirm that I had booked a double room, which they confirmed to me, and then said they would pass this on to the reception staff. After about half an hour of waiting to hear back from reception, I took the initiative to call them again and was asked to go back down there. I did, explained that I had called their Reservations dept as requested, but they still didn't believe me, so I had to wait a further 20 mins while they confirmed this with Reservations themselves. Eventually I was granted my double room, where the 'state of the art' entertainment system was a 15" CRT TV with 4 channels and poor reception. Yep, 4 channels. Hardly what one would expect in a 4 star hotel. To summarise - TINY dirty rooms, poor communication between staff, the restaurant will forget your girlfriend's food order, even when you remind them to bring it out, and unless your room is near reception you can expect to walk for a very long time down a 100m hallway to get to your box. This is not a 4 star hotel - I would be loath to give it 2 or 3 stars if I were a hotel inspector

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kensington Close for three nights. Upon arrival, we were assigned a room that was extremely tiny! We could barely move around the room with our two suitcases. The bathroom was quite dirty and the shower was moldy and rusted. The double bed was pushed up against a window as well and it still left little room to move around. There was a 10' mini TV in the room as well. It seemed very outdated and dirty for a four star rated hotel. We went back downstairs and inquired about an upgrade to a different room. We were informed it would cost an additional 60 EUROS per night to upgrade but it would include free use of their gym/pool facilities. We were desperate to get into a comfortable room so we paid the extra charge per night. The upgrade was well worth it. The room doubled in size but in U.S standards, it was the size of a regular standard room. It was much cleaner and no signs of mold or rust in the bathroom. We had breakfast in the lobby every morning and one morning, the ceiling leaked water onto my hair and back. The manager came over and apologized but nothign else was done regarding the situation. The ceiling was yellowed and it appeared the water damage had been there for some time. Overall, the hotel is not a four star hotel. It is in need of upgrades and renovations especially the leaking in the breakfast room. The staff seemed friendly and the location was conveniently located to many cafes, restaurants and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “they dont show the right pics online”
Reviews.Author: tootaboots
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for a weekend, we were going to london for a concert in the royal albert hall, which is in walking distance. the area is beautiful around the hotel so walk around a little. The tube station is 100 meters away. there is a grat cafe 20 meters away called the muffin man. The hotel is really clean, the staff were not that good though as i was paying everything in cash it seemed my money wasnt good enough and the bar man tryed to ripp me of on a service charge in there sports bar, even though i walked to the bar myself, if i was using credit cards i wouldnt have known, watch out for that. But once u get away from the reception, the hotel is great, the pics on there website dont do them any justice, there is a hallway/lounge that leads to there restruants that is stunning. the sports bar is great to catch a bite and a game, the food was very good. i would give this hotel 8/10 they lost 2 points on the staff. sorry.. next time i go i will be packing plastic,,(they dont take maestro)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Phil369
Reviews.Content: OK the price should have rung a bell - the rooms are not very expensive if you have and take the chance to look for discounts and last minute rates on the net. But still : One thing is sure, from what I have seen this is not a 4 star hotel at all, maybe a 3. The location is great indeed - just less than two hundred metres from the High Street Kensington Tube Station (four stations away from Victoria station). The place was rather peaceful and quiet at night - if you forget the fire alarm at 7 am which was very annoying indeed and seems to happen very often there... upon check in you will be asked whether you need a wake up call... here this is not necessary, the fire alarm will do it for you just free of charge). But if you share my experience - being hooked by the pictures of the hotel on the website tou will be fairly disppointed by your room. It is pretty clean but oh so small indeed, much smaller than you could expect. The telly only has five channels. If you wanted to watch the Champions League leg between Barcelona and Arsenal you just could not do it from your room but had to be in the pub - where (drinking a beer) you could enjoy the show on a large screen in a very noisy and friendly atmosphere when maybe some of you would need deserve and prefer tbhe peace of your room. The bathroom is really tiny indeed - unbelievable. 2 or 3 star hotels in this city often offer more and better for less. You get a free newpaper deliveverd to your room door every morning - which is always nice though no big deal. The breakfast is not included in the price and is rather expensive - though I guess you get value for money and can eat as much as you want. But if you book a room and are interested in all the "extras" (using the pool and spa, having some decent breakfast) your stay will be pretty expensive indeed - the price of a 4 star hotel but without the service and standards. The place is not overpriced but well overrated and that is the problem. You get the impression of being cheated, which is very bad. The concierge was very friendly and as I checked out in the morning but was only leaving at night I could leave my luggage with him just for free - which is not always the case.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location, quiet night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: ToriPIka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as part of a theatre break booked with Hotel Direct, with tickets to Sister Act at the Palladium included. We got a great price so were not convinced the hotel would be up to much. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel is 2 mins walk from Kensington High Street and the tube, located on a quiet street. Check in was busy but effiecient, the room was clean and modern with a full bathroom and shower. The hotel has great facilities and we slept soundly - no street noise, which for London is unusual. Would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap, good gym and pool, great location”
Reviews.Author: TellSyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kensington Close Hotel several times a week for the past year, as my London office is in the area. I can understand leisure travellers who expect a luxurious, Ritz-like experience not being overjoyed here - but get real - it is priced well below what 4 or 5 star luxury would cost in this area of town. It is always clean - even if some rooms are tired; the staff are always efficient. I usually get good prices (booking direct in their site rather than through third parties); and the gym and pool are great. I don't mind paying an extra Â£8 for the gym when the room is so reasonably priced. My advice is to book room-only and get the best rate - why eat in, when there are so many great places close by for dinner or breakfast? Highly recommend this hotel for business travellers who aren't into wasting their company's money, or leisure travellers who are pragmatic about what what their budget will buy them.

Reviews.Title: “Not my idea of 4* .....”
Reviews.Author: skywalker047
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kensington Close for two nights where I was attending a conference. The room I was given was a double - it was ok for one person, but if there'd been two people it would have been a joke! A VERY, small room - however, it was clean and reasonably quiet but the decor was very dated and bathroom seriously in need of an upgrade .... not my idea of 4*, though I understand the room rate was good for London - I still thought it expensive. The swimming pool was a very good size and quiet in the morning - hardly surprising as you have to pay an additional Â£8 for use of the facilities even as a resident, not what I had anticipated, or perhaps I am naive about these things - I thought as a guest at a spa hotel you'd at least be able to swim for free. Breakfast was ok - but had to queue for too long to get a table - there were tables free, but they were slow to sit guests, then no one came to serve coffee either day - had to go and ask or help myself. They ran out of muesli! Could definitely do better. I was on the sixth floor and twice my room key didn't work and I had to go all the way back to reception to get it 're-validated' - they finally gave me a new one. On the up side, it is very well located, but I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “worstest hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulosantosportugal
Reviews.Content: it is impossible smoke in hotel.the coin it was 50 pounds.i have 1,8 m and my bed 1,70m.i saw many people at seven in morning with -5 temperature smoking in the street. .the room is a room from a guy with 1,50m.with two bags he room is full.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal on the Kensington Close. A hotel that really, Tries!”
Reviews.Author: renwaaarr
Reviews.Content: 1st of all, from reading the reviews, I was wholly prepared to be under whelmed by my room size....and I was pleasantly surprised! All I wanted was a single room for a solo traveler. Wasn't the jazziest of rooms...heh...but size was, fine! A desk with an uncomfortable, no arms, straight back chair, a TV, and a window that actually opened, right next to the bed, a bathroom that was fine for showering. The 5 channels on the TV, was ok...and if one wanted---well--for a few lbs, more you can get a bunch of channels with a variety of themes. 1 day I bought the International news channel network, and sure enough---the CNN's and FOX's of the world are on dozens of channels. Was a little complicated to operate but, I liked it for a day. I will say this about The Kensington Close.... They try really hard to be a 4 star hotel. I applaud that....and for the most part, they achieve that star rating. In some aspects they exceed it. Some, fall below that status. For instance, they have an extensive menu for room service...but the impressive part is, it is a 24 hr, 7 days a week service. Including alcohol. Amazing! That is a 5 star service. Then, there's the pool and the whirlpool. There are tons of 5 star hotels that don't have that and the pool at the Kensington Close is an EXCELLENT pool. That they charge 8 lbs a day to use it is a blessing and well worth it! Keeps the so called..haha..riff-raff out. I always had a lane to swim and the intense, steam room was virtually empty for the 3 days I used it. The whirlpool was tiny...but exhilarating. I was in it every day for a 1/2 hr each day and was the only one in it, every day. That's good, but, if there were another in there, it would be very close quarters, and if you went crazy and had 3 in there, knees would be touching. As it was, tho, it was perfect for 1...and that's what I had. A little bonus, if your room is around or AT---#645, the elevator, takes you virtually from the pool, to your room! In fact, where my room was-----I had, what was almost----a private elevator. Hard to explain how behind the scenes my elevator was....but it was a direct shot from the pool, below the 1st fl, to my room, . And btw---it is NOT, the main elevator. Ask about it. Because that must be an incredible benefit, in a large hotel. Then, there is...24 hr concierge service. I could be wrong about that, but, at every hr of the day, that I happened by the lobby, of which, there were many hrs, in the wee-ist of the morning.... lol----.there was a guy there at the concierge desk. Just to start with, there was the Super Bowl on TV at the Sports Bar, on a Sunday night at 11:30 PM. That game is over at 3:30 AM. I only hung until hafltime, and watched the rest in my room... but...heh...the concierge, was there. As he was at all my late night hours. That is another 5 star quality. Never tried the restaurant or breakfast, because that just didn't fit into my schedule. I swam at breakfast and was out and about for the rest of the time. I used the room service a lot. Here's a pretty good service that, the hotel, probably doesn't even know it provides. There is a 3 lb charge for room service. Twice, I called down and asked them to bring up 2 champagne buckets full of ice, so I can keep my champagne, and Belgian Beer, cold. As was always the case, within minutes, there was a beautiful girl with a tray full of 2 filled champagne buckets. What is even nicer about this was...in, ice-NOT, crazy Europe, one invariably has to go to the local supermarket, and lug a bag or 2 of ice back to the hotel....costing----3 lbs! To Americans that might sound stupid, because... heh...even the seediest of, MOTELS, have ice machines for free. That's why that room service charge, was a virtual steal. Room service overall, was very, very good. I even had a real dinner one night at....3 AM. Beer and all! Food was good too..tho...I'm not a picky guy. I was just stunned...I could be doing that at 3 AM....and, was able to. I did hit the aforementioned, Sports Bar they have. Nice atmosphere...but, just a bit uncomfortable for a solo traveler, since the only places you could sit, were in chairs at, 3 and 4 or more...people tables. No barstools. Very crowded on Fri and Sat nights. Was a half filled crowd for the Super Bowl and the sound was very low...if at all, on. All one could hear was the buzz of people talking. If you turn your head for a minute, you would easily miss a play or 2. There is something to having the volume raised, especially, for the Super Bowl. It's almost too much work to be riveted to the TV, without sound, to keep up with the game. You want to HEAR the announcers. If you're talking with someone and hear, "Manning fades back..........there's a longggggg bomb to Wayne.................TOUCHDOWN!!.....". Well...when I hear the beginning of that, I'm paying attention and not missing anything. If that same sequence happens, and there is no sound....well...you're still listening to someone talking about little Johnny's 4th grade field trip...lol. When you look up---- You see a touchdown was scored. Anyway...that bugged the hell out of me. No Sound. I only watched the 1st half there. They need a little polishing up, over there, on how to watch a Super Bowl...heh. The bartenders are good, there...but the beer list is limited. The computer center was unbelievably busy for lots of the time. Is a drab area but bustled. What was more amazing was, these people pay 1 lb, for 10 minutes. I did it once....but found out...if I don't use all my time...I just lose it as soon as I leave. I only used it once, and that was fine. I took a pic of it, empty. You at least can see it's non-charm. The counter personal were stand out. They even got me a room ahead of many others, because I was so jet lagged. (check in was at 2 PM and I was there at 8 AM, due to leaving Phila Airport, 4 hours earlier on the flight before, due to a blizzard starting). I only had to dabble for about 3 hrs before they got me in. The tube stop is close and if you take the tube, to and fro, Heathrow--you will save, $85, (EACH WAY), and get there, 60 % quicker, with no traffic, in an uncrowded tube. It's almost too much to pass up. And I didn't. Was the 1st time I ever tried it...and it was fantastic! Was faster, and more efficient, and except for the 150 yards you have ] to walk from the hotel to the tube stop---is almost as effortless as a taxi door to door.. Over all...The Kensington Close earns a 4 star...or close to it. Not over 4 tho. My room was blase' at best. Even the hallways could use some brightening up. Everything was clean, but the drabbiness of the carpets & walls were evident. Certainly, not enough up there to not endorse this hotel. You get everything they say they offer. Ren

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: andrelabadie
Reviews.Content: What a dump! Everything scratched or stained, grotty bathroom, tiny bedroom and loads of school kids running riot down the corridors and in the lifts. The one saving grace is that they moved me without questions when asked (into a room marginally less miserable than the one I was first put in.) And the receptionist when I checked out seemed genuinely interested as to why I wasn't impressed. I didn't stay in here through choice and won't be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Clean - And great location - Breakfast fab -”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Shariff
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 429 the club room, was lovely and had good side room, flat screen TV and min bar ect, Great Location - Lovely breakfast in the private Club lounge room, Sandra the Revenue Manager was very help full, - Love the 18mm Swimming - Overall Lovely Hotel and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like Gulliver's Travels”
Reviews.Author: Brummies-a-Float
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our daughter's birthday and for us to attend the Carling Cup final at Wembley, we booked 3 double standard rooms for the week-end. We chose the hotel for its location and the fact it had a car park. When we arrived we discovered they had allocated twins, even though we had requested doubles. The rooms on the 5th floor were the tiniest we had ever seen. They were clean, but pokey and totally charmless. It's obvious the rooms were originally built without bathrooms and had been "split" to accomodate en-suite. To get to the toilet you had to "back in" as the space was so narrow. Now I'm not petite, but neither am I huge, but my shoulders barely fitted. We were moved to a standard double, which was OK, but still tiny. Now my wife is petite and she found it dificult to move around the room. The lifts, of which there are many, only holds 3 people and would always stop on each and every floor, just for the hell of it. Our room was not made, even though the supervisor checked with us. The Car Parking was Â£32 per day, which although expensive, probably par for the area. The Breakfast was very good however. Worse of all we lost the final, suppose the hotel weren't totally at fault for that. But would never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Patriciamm
Reviews.Content: Booked 1 night, tiny room, bit grotty, heating not working, bathroom ok but old fittings, shower over bath. No space in wardrobe if needed, as was only staying 1 night this was'nt an issue for us. However,breakfast was good. Overall, disappointing as location is excellent, but not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Mould on bedroom walls - not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: trustworthytraveller
Reviews.Content: spent 2 hours of a precious time with my 10 year old daughter, just trying to be shown to an acceptable room ! The first 4 we were fobbed off with were dreadful - all tiny with black mould spores on window frames and walls. The staff were very slow to respond in the correct manner and upgrade us - but this hotel should not be offering people this standard of accomodation. This hotel cannot describe itself as 4 star! We were on a tight schedule and missed our slot at Madame Tussauds because of the 2 hour tour of damp smelly rooms - staff not interested and would not refund ticket money - offered me upgrade on next stay ! I would never stay there again and they knew it !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Lovely Front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Mkhitaryan
Reviews.Content: I booked the Armenian Television Crew at the Kensington Close Hotel ,We had 5 rooms, on arrival we did not have the credit card my boss had made our bookings with so the hotel could not check us in untill we had the payment and to make matter worse i could not get intouch with my boss so all the crew was waiting in the lobby. I asked to see the Manager , I think his name was Daryl ,he was so pleasant and helpfull he not only calmed me down but went beyond to take care that everything was seemless and we were quickly checked in .During our stay the crew who can hardly speak english had difficulty communicating to hotel staff but i should commend the help from the manager Daryl who even helped the crew to use his personal computer to download filming that the crew had made during the day. I should say after travelling all around the world i havent seen such lovely reception staff ..Overall A great location and friendly and helfull staff ..We will definetly visit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very small room, but good location and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: just2busy
Reviews.Content: I am not a large person, but if I had, then would have struggled to use the room. I asked for a quiet room as London is busy through the night. The hotel food is rubbish. best tip go to the Med kitchen restaraunt within walking distance just off Kensington High St. Superb food, plenty of choice, affordable in a really nice (secluded spot) location next to the big expensive shops. tesco is just around the corner so you can stock up on goodies for the room.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: waylesmann
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in december whilst xmas shopping. Great location near the tube with a nice cafe nearby which opens till early evening. The breakfast is grat , buffet style with plenty of choice although you need to get there early to avaiod the queue. nice decor , reasonably priced with pleasant staff ....we will stay again
